story:
Wherever we live, we are connected by the flow of water—the creeks and rivers that are around us. This web of life is called a watershed. *

Help us raise funds for a fabulous new collection of music inspired by the watersheds that connect us! Contribute $20 or more and receive our new CD. We appreciate any level of support. Letting others know about our project is one of the biggest ways you can help.

Our CD Project

Watershed: Music Inspired by the Place that Connects Us is a music CD produced by the Gallinas Watershed Council (GWC), an all-volunteer organization located in San Rafael, California, and dedicated to stewarding local creeks and watersheds.

All proceeds from the album will support the group’s efforts to protect Marin County watersheds through education, advocacy and conservation action. This project is a collaboration with Floating Records.

To produce the CD, we need to raise $1,900. We hope you will help us reach our goal! All of the artists donated their songs. We are very grateful to them and to the many individuals (listed below) who contributed their time and expertise to create this CD. Anything beyond our $1,900 funding goal will enable us to produce more CDs to support our important work.

Artists featured on CD

Darol Anger & the Republic of Strings • Fiver Brown & the Good Sinners • Amber Cross • Alice DiMicele • Robin Flower & Libby McLaren • Kurt Huget • Evie Ladin • Laurie Lewis & The Right Hands • The Littlest Birds • Jeff Norman • Steep Ravine • Forest Sun

About this Album

This album brings together an eclectic group of musicians with styles ranging from folk to pop to bluegrass. Some musicians are seasoned, widely acclaimed artists, while others are accomplished artists in an earlier stage of their musical careers. The CD features original songs performed by both solo artists and groups, as well as two instrumental tunes.

The songs in this compilation, while diverse, all celebrate the watershed as a place of connection. Some convey the movement and energy of a stream in the music itself, while others address the impacts of human activity and development on our valuable and often threatened waterways. Some compositions range into the realm of memory, testifying to the special place that creeks and rivers can hold in our lives, as places of work, play, and spiritual replenishment. Finally, some artists sing about water as a metaphor for important life experiences. They all affirm the centrality of water in our lives, and the urgency of protecting healthy and vital watersheds.

For those who love and care about nature, we hope this musical celebration of water will inspire you in your stewardship. For those who love music but may not know much about watersheds, we hope these songs will stir greater awareness. For those who simply appreciate good music, we believe the superb songwriting and musicianship on this album will delight you!

We titled this album Watershed: Music Inspired by the Place that Connects Us in the hope that the songs on this album speak to a network that nourishes both our social “ecology” and the watersheds that sustain us, wherever we live. With climate change and the very real changes it is bringing to our global ecosystem, strong, vital and caring human communities that model the very principles of watersheds offer our best hope for the future. 

Many thanks to those who donated their time & expertise to this project:

Joyce Clements • Jessica Davenport • Michael Davenport • Thomas A. Cohen • Andy Greenberg • Kurt Huget • Tamara Hull • Alex Kahl • Carla Koop • Evie Ladin • Sue Mace • Jeffrey A. Moss, Esq. • Don Murphy • Jeff Norman • Lucy Reid • Christopher Richard • Bob Seeman • Stefan Thuilot • Nelia White • Don Zimmer

______________________________________________________________________

*What is a watershed?

A watershed is not a shed that stores water, but an area of land that “catches” water, or a “catchment.” It is defined by topography—the shape of the land—rather than by political boundaries or property lines. Water flows from higher parts of the landscape, such as ridges, towards lower areas, such as valleys or ravines. Runoff often forms a river or creek that makes its way toward a lake, bay or ocean.

A watershed is a place where all beings are connected through the life-giving flow of water. As water moves over and through the landscape, it carries soil and rock to form new habitats, brings sustenance to plants, and gives nourishment to wildlife and human communities. Fish like salmon and steelhead make their way from the sea back to creeks and rivers as they complete their life cycles, bringing the nutrients of the open ocean back to the watersheds of their birth.

Just as creeks can be part of larger river systems, smaller watersheds are part of larger watersheds. So, too, are humans, wildlife, and elements of earth held within this branching web of life.

story:
When they released their debut EP, Brotherhood, in May 2012, their message was clear as were their influences- Killswitch Engage, Demon Hunter and Bullet for My Valentine, just to name a few. From These Ruins have definitely found and defined a dynamic of aggressive passion, melodic vocals, and groove-heavy drums with grinding guitars. 

“Finally a hard rock/metal sound with all the right ingredients! In early 2012 they released Brotherhood. The six track, pulse pounding, over thirty minute album is loaded to the brim with heavy licks, melodic vocals and powerful messages.

From These Ruins finds an impressively rare quality with their sound. Rusty Sparks booms out the perfect metal voice while Jeff Garloch and Timothy Hartman intertwine their tour-de-force guitars. Matthew Bridgewaters and Chad Anderson pack the rhythm section with precision audible explosions. And here’s the bonus, Anderson, yes a metal drummer, shares vocals in plain English, one of the best metal sounds I’ve heard in a long time.” Greg’s Take, NanobotRock.com

Since the release of Brotherhood, FTR have maintained a rigorous gigging schedule with crowds growing constantly at every show. With an exceptionally energetic live show, where stage antics are never a stranger; along with diligent self-promotion, the band has increased their Likes, Followers and Subscribers from just under 1000 at the the release of Brotherhood – to just over 10,000 only 12 months later.

From These Ruins have are also on heavy rotation on over 50 radio stations including Broken FM, Righteous Radio – where they have been named band of the month numerous times, Broken Neck Radio, Threat Con Radio and Nuclear Fallout Radio where the band is the current Headline Artist.

From These Ruins have shared the stage with Nine Lashes, I Am Empire, The Wedding, The Protest, Loftland, Lastwatch, Children 18:3, Corpus Christi, Inhale Exhale, and Wolves at the Gate. FTR is continuously gigging this summer and are part of many festivals including Kingdom Come Festival 2013, Lamb Jam 2013, Juggerfest, and the second annual Priasecore Festival. With the little down time they find themselves with, FTR are working hard in the studio writing new material (that they like to debut during shows randomly). 

“We are so excited for everyone to hear this new stuff, we don’t want to wait to get in the studio for people to get a taste!” Rusty said.

With the goal to record and a release a full length LP this fall, From These Ruins are doing nothing but putting everything they have into this project. 

To get the latest news and tour information for From These Ruins,you can make your way to the bands official website at www.fromtheseruins.com and on any and all of the popular social networking sites.

What We Need & What You Get

From These Ruins are ready to take it to the world. We have a magnitude of new material written and ready to record for our first full-length album and we want to do it the right way. Do-it-yourself is great, but there's something special about working with a producer and a professional studio. The problem is this- that gets expensive and in today's world that's just hard to afford. 

We also want to tour the country but when all you have is a small SUV and no trailer, that can be a pain sometimes. This is what it comes down to- we need your help to finish up our full-length record and we really need a van and/or trailer for our gear and equipment. 

By helping us out on this campaign you are helping make our dream a reality. The closer we get to our goal, the closer you get to making From These Ruins the next big thing. We don't let any good deed go unnoticed, either. By helping us, you'll become part of the FTR family for life and an honorary member of The Brotherhood. We will continue to thank you at every possible moment and who know what the possibilities are.

The Impact

Young bands like us just don't have the funding to do everything we would like to do or the things we need to do- the necessities to make it to the next level. Everyone who sees us live is automatically hooked. The stories we've heard from people who have connected with our lyrics, our testimonies and our lives are priceless and unforgettable. We want to hear your stories and connect with you too and we want to meet all of you. We can't do that without touring properly and without the right things in place. We need a full-length album and a van and trailer (if possible). If you help us meet our goal, we guarantee that we will come to your city in the future. 

Everyone loves good music. In today's music industry there's no shortage of bad music, bad rock and bad metal. The "role models" of today are, let's face it, people you don't want your kids looking up to. We need good people for our kids to look up to and we, along with the other bands we've formed relationships with are here to put a stop to it and take the morals and positivity of our country back.

Let's make music something we can be proud of again and you can be part of the movement by helping us out! 

Not everyone has the opportunity to spread the word of Jesus to crowds of people who've never known their need for him. Here's your chance to help us to do so on your behalf!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone is able to donate their money. In today's economy, many people can barely make ends meet and we've seen many campaigns and causes we wanted to support but just couldn't afford to. We've been there and we understand- we won't hold it against you.

Here's how you can help:

Share the campaign link on your Facebook, Twitter, email messages and texts Word of mouth is an amazing tool.

Drop us a line and tell us that you support us- sometimes a simple "hi" will go a long way or turn a bad day around. 

Just show us some love, we could always use some prayer and come out to a show- spread the word about From These Ruins and support The Brotherhood.

story:
The Project

Bad Wolf is an alternative rock band, or "faerie rock" band, based in Los Angeles CA. Since 2012, we have released 3 singles ("A Better World (ft. Traci Hines)", "Drowning Beautiful", and "Stay With Me"), but we need YOUR help so that we can record four more songs in the studio and create a full EP! 

Because we are unsigned and 100% independent, we need the support of our fans to help fund this EP and open up doors for us that will take us to the next level! With already nearly a quarter million hits on our YouTube channel, we hope to keep increasing momentum from here and create high end and exciting content for our fans!

We put 100% into everything we do, and we won't settle for less. Because we want to produce high quality content for our fans, we need extra funding to do it right!

We will return to the studio with producer Erik Ron (producer of "Stay With Me") to finish recording a full EP to be released this Summer! 

What We Need & What You Get

So here's what it breaks down to:

  • The bulk of this funding will go directly to the production cost of recording the new songs. 
  • We will also use the funding to press physical CDs of our EP.
  • Donators will get awesome perks and prizes, ranging anywhere from sticker packs, all the way up to private concerts from the band!
  • If we do not hit our target, we will still use any funds collected and put it towards recording our EP. 
  • If we are lucky enough to EXCEED our target, we can use the extra funding for PR, music videos, promotional photo shoots, or creating new merch! Every dollar will be put to good use!

The Impact

Every contribution will bring us one step closer to achieving our goal to be able to record and release the music we've been working on for the past couple of years. We love our fans so much and want them to hear all of our new music so they can really get a sense of who we're becoming. 

We hope to spread a positive message with our music, changing the music industry and pop culture one song at a time. 

We are so grateful for the support of our fans thus far, helping us to create our first music video, "A Better World (ft. Traci Hines)" in 2012 from our first crowd funding project, and hope that our supporters have even more faith in us now and will help us make this EP!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Share this project and spread the word! Word of mouth is the strongest tool!
  • Visit our YouTube page and subscribe.
  • Shop in our online merch store to help us raise more funds! 
  • Buy our music on iTunes!

And that’s all there is to it!

We love you guys and hope to be able to share lots of music with you for years to come!

2014 is the year of the WOLF! #wolfpack

*international shipping costs will be charged extra

http://wearebadwolf.com

The Band

Kota

lead vocals, piano, xylophone, synth

Kota has been writing and recording music since she was 9 years old. She joined her first rock band when she was 15 and fell in love with it. Since then, she has opened up an all ages live music venue in Hollywood, Amplyfi, signed to Seventeen Magazine's YouTube network for her channel "SteamfaerieTV", and is signed to JC Chasez (of NSYNC) and Golden Globe winning producer Jimmy Harry's project, Girl Radical, an 11 member girl group. Kota has had almost 9 million views on her personal YouTube since starting it in 2013, proof that she is someone to watch!


Tommy

lead guitar, rhythm guitar, vocals

Tommy started playing guitar when he was 15, and joined his first band, a melodic metal-core band, when he was 17. He's shared the stage with bands like The Bled, and has brought his edgy, spacey guitar composing skills to each and every Bad Wolf song. His unique style of writing is what sets Bad Wolf's music apart from other bands. He's also an electrical engineer at a medical device company by day!


Alicia

bass guitar, vocals

Alicia Vigil is a multi-talented musician, model, and actress who, at just 18, is already extremely accomplished in many fields. She starred in Black Veil Bride's full length movie, Legion of the Black, as well as appearing in ad campaigns for major companies such as Vitamin Water. As a musician, she is talented in multiple instruments, including guitar, bass, and even saxophone. Alicia joined Bad Wolf in late 2012 after appearing in the music video for "A Better World". 


Tim

drums, percussion

Tim Falco has been playing music since high school, being the drummer of his metal-core band with Tommy when they were just 16 and 17. Tim's style of drumming is incredibly unique and detailed, bringing all of Bad Wolf's songs to a whole new level. Besides being a killer drummer, Tim also has a heart of gold, and went to school to become a physical education teacher for children with special needs.

story:
Help our Concert Series Inspire People and Heal Them Through the Power of Music.

"Unfolding Secrets: A Symphony of the Heart" has been called "inspiring", "breathtaking" and "like unspoken poetry".  It offers music lovers an infusion of what critics are calling "High-Resonance" music. The result is as audiences listen, they feel, awaken, and transform as their passion is ignited to share abundance.  

Soul's Calling - Feel the Music Now...

 

We are the co-creators of “Unfolding Secrets: A Symphony of the Heart,” dedicated to supporting the evolution of consciousness on this planet through the healing and transformative power of music. We are a small team of 7 enthusiastic and heart-centric people dedicated to manifesting positive change for Earth and all of Humanity.

Meet Marco. . .

The man with a dream-- Marco Missinato, Unfolding Secrets Founder, Composer and Executive Producer – Born in Italy and raised in the beautiful ancient city of Rome.  His gift for piano composition began blooming at the age of six. In his own words, he wishes to share with you his dream:

“I always wanted to share with everyone my dream.  However, in the past I refrained from doing so because I knew it was not the right time for such sharing.  Both within and outside of me, the frequencies were not right yet.

And now the time to dare into such sharing has finally come.

It is a dream that always comes over and over again since my earliest childhood time.  It comes when I am in my highest state of love and joy.  It comes through the power of imagination, the same imagination through which I am able to allow the melodies and the music to come through.

In the dream I see thousands of us coming from everywhere on Earth gathering around the music fully embracing the love and the oneness purging from the pure notes and the lovingly healing sounds of the many musical instruments.

I see sacred geometry shapes, breathtaking ever-changing lights and colors, images of love all blending and dancing together with the music embracing both the players and the listeners, taking all of them into Oneness.

I hear magical whispered spoken words and singing voices gently caressing each cell of our consciousness.  I feel everyone’s emotional releases, their letting go, their tears of joy and their welcoming to higher energies which fully stretch and open everyone’s hearts.  I see and feel the delicate process of remembering, gently unfolding, taking all of us back into the full awakened presence and light that we truly are.”

As Marco shared his dream and the music, people came to offer their benevolent time and energy to help manifest the dream.  With love in their hearts and in true generosity of a cause greater than themselves, a team began to form around Marco beginning a focused effort towards a goal, a goal of sharing with the world what we all came here to accomplish. 


Meet Kristin, Unfolding Secrets vocalist . . . 

Kristin Hoffmann, Julliard Trained Soprano Vocalist, Co-Composer, and Vocal Producer –Starting at the age of 4, ethereal renaissance pop songstress and multi-instrumentalist began building a prolific career that includes major record labels and song placements on hit TV shows. With a strong sense of artistic altruism, she is most passionate about projects that explore music’s healing power and allow listeners to tap into their higher potentials.

Having studied with Sound Healing pioneer Fabian Maman, Hoffmann not only made music to accompany acupuncture sessions but also composed 170 songs for health-challenged children as a writer/producer at the non-profit organization, Songs of Love. A spokesperson for ocean conservation, she has performed her Song for the Ocean at environmental awareness conventions around the world.  Kristin shares:

“My goal is to spread love, light, peace and truth into the world through the vehicles of music and energetic frequency.”


Our Purpose...Our Project

We, the Unfolding Secrets team are excited to share with you the launch of our next Project for 2014, which is the unfolding of the dream.  We bring to you, the Open Hearts Concert Series.  These will not be just ordinary concerts, they will be multimedia live music events bringing together "thousands of us from everywhere on Earth gathering around the music."  They are designed to create personal and planetary energetic shifts through the calling forth of 144,000 people to simultaneously tune in to the high frequency, vibrational music of "Unfolding Secrets" via in-person concerts and live streaming video.

Scientests and spiritual leaders have talked about the importance of 144,000 high-conscious beings on the planet at this transformative time, creating the necessary critical mass to effect positive change.  

Read about the importance of 144,000 high conscious being

Our goal is to raise the electromagnetic fields of participants through the sound and light experience of The Open Hearts Concert Series, in support of Mother Eart and the Human Awakening.  But we need your help!

The Call

We need to raise $144,000 to cover the initial cost of the concert series. 

Events in Sedona, AZ  $40,000

Events in European country  $44,000

Events in Hawaii    $60,000

  Approximate breakdown of costs:

· 30% Musicians fees/expenses,

· 30% Technology and equipment rental

· 20% venue and performance management

· 20% Marketing and promotional fees

We are calling upon our strongest supporters and all who resonate with this project to ask for contributions.  In kind, we are offering thank you gifts from our hearts to your hearts.  Some of the perks from this campaign include:

1.  $25 Love & Music - Acknowledgement of your contribution on www.symphonyoftheheart.com and digital download of the "Unfolding Secrets" album.

2.  $250 A Dream from my Heart - Autographed A Dream from my Heart photo and much more...

3. $2,000 Come with Me - Personal Skype call with Marco Missinato and much more...

Not only will you receive an amazing perk for your contribution, you will also be helping us bring about positive change on the planet at this pinnacle time.  Further, your contribution and hopefully your participation in these heart-opening events, will help support the planetary and human awakening in this transformational year of 2014.


Why All of Us Are In this Together

Marco began to share the music of Unfolding Secrets in 2013.  The world premiere concert took place in summer 2013 in Cuenca Ecuador.  On October 10th, 2013 the USA premiere concert took place in Greenwich Village, New York City.  Each time it was performed, at every event, people’s hearts would open and tears would fall from their eyes at the joy and love they felt--maybe an experience they had not felt for a very long time, if ever. 

Marco could see the magic created through the power of the music and he could feel its potential to change this world.  What if heaven could be made manifest by connecting with your heart?

We believe that together, WE are the ones we have been waiting for!  WE are the Symphony of the Heart!

With immense gratitude!

Marco Missinato and the Unfolding Secrets team

story:
Short Summary

  • We are an 8-piece band from Vancouver, BC and Seattle, Washington. 
  • It's been 5 years since our last studio album, and we are ready to get back in the studio to make a new CD. Over the last few years, we have written and collected many great songs and we are excited to share them with you.  
  • With your help, we can make this album happen. Have a say on how the record is made!


What We Need & What You Get

  • We have budgeted $20,000 to make this CD. I know this may seem like a lot of money, but it is a shoestring budget in the recording industry. This money will go to studio time at $500 a day, producer fees of $10,000 for the album, guest musicians, CD designer at $1,000, and finally CD duplication and printing.  
  •  We are offering several ways to fund the album from pre-buying the CD, to having a say on what we call the album, or being named an "Executive Producer". 
  •  If we don't reach our goal, we will still use whatever monies we raise and put them towards making the album. 

The Impact

  • We are not kidding ourselves, and we know we are raising money for a CD and not an invention that will save people's lives. Having said that, we know that our music has come to mean a lot to people, and at times, a song or a concert has changed someone's life. Music has the power to move and change people. We are asking you for help in creating something that will have an impact on a lot of people. We are asking for help in creating something artistic, everlasting, and hopefully adding a little more beauty in the world. It's a bit of a hippy ideology, but we believe it to be true.  
  •  In the past we have had success in crowdfunding as well as government grants such as Canada Council and Factor.
  • We guarantee that all the money will go to fund the record and nothing else. It has become harder and harder to make a living from playing music, and along with the record industry, we have seen a major decline in record sales due to downloading, and a general economic downturn in the world. Simply put, our industry has become one where artists continue to make music that they are not properly compensated for. We don't want to cry the blues too much about this, because at the end of the day, we do get by, and we are incredibly grateful that we get to play music for a living. We never take this for granted. We feel that the “perks” we have listed in this campaign are not out of reach, and they each give you something back directly. We hope you agree.  


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't afford to help, that's ok. Perhaps you can help us by sharing this with others who might be able to help. Thank you!

  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Let The Guilty Hang

Thank you for taking the time to look over our campaign. We as a band were leery at first as to how to approach a Crowd Funding campaign but once we realized that it was basically a Pre Order process and a way for fans to get their hands on some special incentives, we were sold. We as a band have fought the good fight to keep the ship sailing through stormy seas, from divorces and deaths to weddings and babies, we have stayed together. It is rare to find a band with tenure like we have that have managed to keep a consistent line up and stay relevant. We feel like we have an amazing collection of songs that must be heard and recorded properly... That's where we need your help.   

What We Need & What You Get

We realize that some people want a copy of the record... short and simple, we also know we have some crazy fans who would love to have a piece of this bands history and help out, no matter the cost. We feel like we have a tier for everyone from this casual fan or someone who would just like to help to people who want to make a huge dent in this goal. We appreciate everyone equally and look forward to making a record that is deserving of these songs...

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar counts and the more eyes we can have on this the better.
  • Use all of the Share options Indigogo has provided to share the the Social Network of your choice.
  • Tell your friends... If you believe in this band, sing it from the mountain tops!

story:
Here's another example of the sound Shannon has been nailing for me at Lost Creek Studios. This is a song about life on the road:


An edited cross section of some of the songs we're working on. Please have a listen:

Donate $50 and receive a CD copy of 'The Sixth Avenue Verses' and a special handwritten copy of lyrics of one of the songs from the album.



The Sixth Avenue Verses

My name is Michael Coughlan, a singer-songwriter based in Medicine Hat, Canada. I’m excited to be running my first indiegogo campaign – seeking your help – to crowdsource my first full length studio album!

I write and perform roots music - calling on a variety of classic genres like country, blues, traditional folk and rock and roll.  My influences include (but are not limited to) Kris Kristofferson, Neil Young, Bob Dylan, The Replacements, Shannon Lyon, Warren Zevon, Dinosaur Jr., Leonard Cohen, and the like. My songs are strongly rooted in story and come from a real place.

In my career I’ve recorded two previous CDs – one with my old band, and a more recent five song demo EP of my own material with my current band. Both recordings have great energy and content, but I really want to take it to the next level in terms of sound and production. I’ve drawn from the thirty or so songs I’ve written in the last year and a half and managed to choose what I feel are the best for 'The Sixth Avenue Verses'.

For guidance and assistance, in the role of producer I’m turning to one of my great musical influences and someone I deem to be one of the best songwriters in Canada, Shannon Lyon. Shannon has written and recorded eleven albums in his career and has shown himself a worthy producer specializing in his work with singer-songwriters. Shannon’s own music has been featured on various film and TV productions like the feature films ‘Textuality’ and ‘Old Stock’, and TV shows like ‘The Border’ and ‘Rookie Blue’. He’s shared stages around the world with noted artists like Lucinda Williams, Blue Rodeo, Jay Farrar, Richard Buckner, Ray LaMontagne and Bruce Cockburn.

We’ve already recorded some tracks at Shannon's Lost Creek Studio up in Thompson Valley (Vavenby), British Colunbia and I’m encouraged by how the project is sounding! But we have a long way to go.  Lead guitar tracks, bass, drums, keyboards, and harmony vocals. This takes time, effort and money to pay the professional musicians involved. As a believer in serving the songs Shannon may be calling on his associates in Holland. People like Elly Kellner, an amazing vocalist for backing harmony vocals, or renowned guitarist BJ Baartmans to do some added tracks.

All things considered, I'm looking for $5000 above and beyond the $1000 I've already put into the initial recording. This money is for the musicians, the production, and manufacturing of the CD.

And that’s why I’m reaching out to friends, family, and complete strangers for assistance in helping me realize my solo record dream! I really believe in honest, emotional music. The pieces that will appear on 'The Sixth Avenue Verses' are inspired by the people and places of the badlands of southern Alberta - my apartment on 6th Ave. in Medicine Hat, the surrounding coulees, the expanse of blue sky above. Songs that tell stories and come from a real place. I’ve never felt more at peace than I have since I’ve taken this path. Please do a kindness and help through your generous donations! There are perks for your selflessness, from signed copies of the completed CD to the option of having me perform for you in your own home! Just look at the perks list to the right and see if something’s right for you. If you can’t afford a donation you can still be of valuable assistance. Please pass on the word of my quest through social media (there are links to do just that on this page), e-mail, and word of mouth! Every bit counts!

Thanks so much!

Best,

Michael Coughlan

story:
We are hoping to raise funds for the production costs of Tcha Limberger's instructional video projects with DC Music School.
 
Costs involved:
 
-Travel costs (Flight from Belgium to Montreal)
-Production costs (studio time / assistant engineer(s))
-Artist advance
 
Why are we requesting help
 

This project will go on with or without financial backing; however, your support would basically accelerate the entire process and make things easier for everyone. Furthermore, it would allow DC Music School to take on other projects as well and perhaps create more products with the same artist or others.

 

What is DC Music School?


Dc Music School is an online music school that specializes in niche music genres. We are comitted to bringing the finest instruction possible at the lowest cost possible.  We dare to tackle on genres / topics that are not always the most profitable but can be of great benefit to musicians around the world. We are also comitted to making music education as accessible as possible through our numerous free products. Consistent support has allowed us to release a number of free products; and with continued support, we will continue to create free products.  Since its inception in the summer of 2011, thousands upon thousands of registrations have been recorded around the world. Our free and paid products are an immense success.

 

Who is Tcha Limberger?

 

Tcha Limberger was born into a family of musicians. His grandfather was violinist and his father a guitarist. He started playing in his father’s band “De Piottos’ first of course and later became the rhythm guitarist of Waso.

When he was seventeen, he started to play violin, inspired by stories of his grandfather, and recordings from Hungarian Toki Horvat. He split with the Orchestra De Piotto’s, and made a trio with his father Vivi and his uncle Bisque Limberger. A year later, they started a band named “Romani” with Koen de Cauter and two of his sons Dajo, Viv.

In Budapest on tour Tcha decided to return there again to learn the Gypsy music of Budapest.
He learned Hungarian, and when he was twenty-three, he arrived in Budapest and studied for eighteen months with Horvat Belame.

 

Why Tcha Limberger?


Simply put, Tcha is a complete musical genius. He is competent in many instruments such as the guitar and the violin, among many others. His knowledge of music and traditional folk/jazz styles is immense; the man hears everything and absorbs everything! I have had the fortune of spending a bit of time and picking his brain; the knowledge he has to share would be invaluable to the music community. 


What kind of video projects would we do?



Tcha's musical knowledge is encyclopedic, but for now, we have decided to focus on two general aspects of his musicianship: the guitar and the violin.

As far as the guitar is concerned, he grew up in the Sinti community of Django Reinhardt and is related to the legendary Waso Grunholz  who was instrumental in the development of many famous GJ gutiarists, such as Stochelo Rosenberg. Tcha's knowledge of the music of Django Reinhardt is very deep, and he is also very familiar with the folk music of the Sinti. His knowledge of harmony alone is impressive. Furthermore, he spent time learning the traditional music of Hungary and has much to say about performance and accompaniment issues in these styles.

 

As far as the violin is concerned, he is one of the very few people (if not the only) in this world who is able to play the traditional Hungarian and Manouche folk repertoire and ABLE to teach it and explain the intricacies and nuances of the styles in fluent English, French, or any of the other 5 languages that he speaks. For the first time, this valuable information can be shared with the rest of the world.

 

A successful fundraising campaign could lead to the creation of more projects in the near future with Tcha or with other renouned artists, so every level of support matters to us! Thank you!!!

Dc Music School is an online music school that specializes in niche music genres. We are comitted to bringing the finest instruction possible at the lowest cost possible.  We dare to tackle on genres / topics that are not always the most profitable but can be of great benefit to musicians around the world. We are also comitted to making music education as accessible as possible through our numerous free products. Consistent support has allowed us to release a number of free products; and with continued support, we will continue to create free products.  Since its inception in the summer of 2011, thousands upon thousands of registrations have been recorded around the world. Our free and paid products are an immense success.
 
Who is Tcha Limberger?
 
Tcha Limberger was born into a family of musicians. His grandfather was violinist and his father a guitarist. He started playing in his father’s band “De Piottos’ first of course and later became the rhythm guitarist of Waso. When he was seventeen, he started to play violin, inspired by stories of his grandfather, and recordings from Hungarian Toki Horvat. He split with the Orchestra De Piotto’s, and made a trio with his father Vivi and his uncle Bisque Limberger. A year later, they started a band named “Romani” with Koen de Cauter and two of his sons Dajo, Viv.  In Budapest on tour Tcha decided to return there again to learn the Gypsy music of Budapest. He learned Hungarian, and when he was twenty-three, he arrived in Budapest and studied for eighteen months with Horvat Belame.
 
Why Tcha Limberger?
Simply put, Tcha is a complete musical genius. He is competent in many instruments such as the guitar and the violin, among many others. His knowledge of music and traditional folk/jazz styles is immense; the man hears everything and absorbs everything! I have had the fortune of spending a bit of time and picking his brain; the knowledge he has to share would be invaluable to the music community. 
What kind of video projects would we do?
Tcha's musical knowledge is encyclopedic, but for now, we have decided to focus on two general aspects of his musicianship: the guitar and the violin.
As far as the guitar is concerned, he grew up in the Sinti community of Django Reinhardt and is related to the legendary Waso Grunholz  who was instrumental in the development of many famous GJ gutiarists, such as Stochelo Rosenberg. Tcha's knowledge of the music of Django Reinhardt is very deep, and he is also very familiar with the folk music of the Sinti. His knowledge of harmony alone is impressive. Furthermore, he spent time learning the traditional music of Hungary and has much to say about performance and accompaniment issues in these styles.
 
As far as the violin is concerned, he is one of the very few people (if not the only) in this world who is able to play the traditional Hungarian and Manouche folk repertoire and ABLE to teach it and explain the intricacies and nuances of the styles in fluent English, French, or any of the other 5 languages that he speaks. For the first time, this valuable information can be shared with the rest of the world.
 
A successful fundraising campaign could lead to the creation of more projects in the near future with Tcha or with other renouned artists, so every level of support matters to us! Thank you!!!

story:
“Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory of God that is within us. And as we let our own light shine, we are liberated from our own fear, and our presence automatically liberates others.”

- Marianne Williamson

Hi. I’m Lauren Bruno, the mother of Les RAV.  The two things I love most in this world are music and community and this campaign is about both. I’m a singer and songwriter, I play piano and I’ve been paying out of pocket for every musical/communal endeavor thus far. And now I can no longer do that.

As some of you may know I've been suffering from a painful stomach disease called Ulcerative Colitis since I was 11 yrs old.

Between being in and out of the hospital, having my income go toward medical bills and having to quit my job to get well, it has made it near impossible for this album to come to fruition.  I've received so much support from the local community and fans around the world and that has given me the hope and strength that together we can make this album happen.

Music is my medicine -- I choose music over any poisonous pharmaceutical drugs and I want to share the deep gratitude and gratefulness I feel with you through the art of creating a magnificent album for you.

This is what gets me through...

Les RAV Mantra

Les RAV I have the right to be happy
Les RAV I can learn from my mistakes
Les RAV I can give more than I have
Les RAV I can use my mouth for positive change
Les RAV I am stronger than I have ever been
Les RAV I am open to accepting peace, within myself, within my heart, within my soul
Les RAV

More about Les RAV....

Press

Thus far Les RAV has been fortunate to be invited to showcase at both SXSW and Fusebox Festival, was featured on the PBS-KLRU Arts in Context show and was named one of Austin's top young women to watch in 2012 by Austin Women's Magazine. 


READ FULL ARTICLE

 

This past month Les RAV was given a huge honor when April 11th 2013 was proclaimed by Mayor Lee Leffingwell as Les RAV day in the city of Austin.

 Lauren with Mayor Lee Leffingwell on Les Rav Day, Aprill 11th 2013 at City Hall

 

 

 

If we reach our goal....

With the help of producer Keith Gary (Rufus Wainwright, Antony & The Johnsons), string/horn arranger Harlan Hodges and a group of talented players including the reknowned Tosca String Quartet, the album will be a place where two worlds meet - classical and contemporary.


"Darkest" is the first song I wrote for this album. The video below is a glimpse into what I plan to create.


 

What Les RAV needs and what You Get

Your involvement will get you pre-released music, personalized gifts and treasures and exclusive material directly from Les RAV only offered during this campaign.

I am aiming to raise $18,000 during this campaign.

The chart below is a rough representation on how the funds will be spent if the goal is achieved.  If I don't make the goal, I will adjust accordingly.  If we go over the goal the extra money will be put back into the band for merchandising, musical equipment, etc.

 

 

FROM THE FANS

This journey has connected me with such incredible people and I quickly realized that Les RAV is more than me or a band -- it is a vector of inspiration for many. I created the Les RAV fan page where I showcased the letters and e-mails I began receiving in the first few weeks of the project up until now. See what fans, friends and fellow artists have been saying: http://lesravfans.tumblr.com 

 

Les RAV realizes that many of you are probably a lot like me: kind of poor. I don't take your contributions lightly!  Check below and on the right side of your screen to see what sort of EXCITING perks Les RAV is offering to our generous contributors!  Feel free to email lesravbookmeplease@gmail.com with any specific questions you have about how Les RAV will be spending the money we raise or the perks you will be receiving!--

with love,
Les RAV 

 

Offered in the "Peacemaker Package"

"Les RAV Indiegogo Exclusive Package"

- Les RAV hand crank music box
- Les RAV handmade flower headband
- "Breathe” essential oil from the herb bar here in Austin, TX with the “Peace Prayer Script”
- Les RAV Bindis Package
- AliceRabbit Crystal Bullet Package
- Private henna session for 2 or hoop lesson for 2 with Henna Kim (Only offered in Austin,TX)

 

 


Les RAV does this because of the power of music and the connection to the people that enjoy it. I write music to spread hope and inspire passion and I'd like to share the product of that process with you.

I'd be honored by any contribution that will help Les RAV accomplish the goal, but if you find yourself like Les RAV at the short end of the financial stick, there are other ways you can help spread the light!

Share this campaign via email, on Facebook, Twitter or any other social network (you can use the Indiegogo share tools to make it easy).

Spread the Word and Spread the light

Facebook: http://fb.com/lesrav
Twitter: http://twitter.com/lesrav (@lesrav)
Youtube: http://youtube.com/lesravbookmeplease
Vimeo: http://vimeo.com/lesrav
Instagram: http://instagram.com/lesrav1111 (@lesrav1111)
Soundcloud: http://soundcloud.com/laurenbruno
Bandcamp: http://lesrav.bandcamp.com

 

 

Thanks for taking the time to read this. Les RAV wouldn't exist without the generous contributions from our fans and patrons. Les RAV loves you all and can't wait to share this music with you! 

Thanks to the generous sponsors who are helping to make this campaign possible.

story:
WE DID IT!!!!! THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Στην καρτέλα updates δείτε το πρώτο ολοκληρωμένο δείγμα από την "Κλωστή", καθώς και τρόπο να βοηθήσετε αν δεν έχετε κάρτα.

- Ποιοι είναι οι 2L8 (scroll down for english version)

Ας μιλήσουμε λίγο για εμάς.

Μέχρι σήμερα έχουμε κυκλοφορήσει τρία άλμπουμ:

  • “Armed angels, frustrated youth, the art of self - deceit and music industry” (Poeta Negra / 2005), 

  • “He&She, Angry enough to keep loving in the Dark Ages” (Inner Ear / 2008), 

  • “New Battles, without honor and humanity” (No more happy music productions / 2011), 

Χαρακτηριστικό της δισκογραφίας μας είναι η αλλαγή σε ύφος και μουσικό στυλ από άλμπουμ σε άλμπουμ. Για αυτό η μουσική μας είναι δύσκολο να καταταχθεί σε κάποιο συγκεκριμένο μουσικό είδος. Είναι post rock, post punk, new age, pop, rock, avant garde, και ταυτόχρονα τίποτα από όλα αυτά. Την μουσική μας μπορείτε να την βρείτε στην σελίδα μας στο Bandcamp και να την κατεβάσετε με ελεύθερη συνεισφορά.

Έχουμε εμφανιστεί σε πολυάριθμους συναυλιακούς χώρους όπως Gagarin, Bios, Κύτταρο, Synch Festival, AN Club, Στέγη Γραμμάτων και Τεχνών(Αθήνα), Υδρόγειος, Μύλος, Eightball (Θεσσαλονίκη), Rec, Λιθογραφείο (Πάτρα), καθώς και σε πολλές πόλεις της επαρχίας, ως πλήρες σχήμα, ακουστικό, ή σόλο εμφανίσεις του Κ the Clown, ιδρυτή της ομάδας.

- H ιδέα πίσω από τους 2L8

Οι 2L8 έχουν να κάνουν με την ομάδα. Στη σκηνή και εκτός σκηνής. 

Η σύλληψη της ιδέας να προσδώσουμε στη μουσική μας έναν χαρακτήρα συλλογικό, και μη ιεραρχικό, υπήρξε αποτέλεσμα του κοινού συναισθήματος, της αντίθεσης μας στην εξουσιαστική δομή της κοινωνίας. Συνδετικοί μας κρίκοι η ανάγκη για ελεύθερη έκφραση, για ομαδικότητα και άμεση επικοινωνία της μουσικής μας με τον κόσμο. Η άρνηση μας να συμμετέχουμε σε ένα τέτοιο παιχνίδι πελατειακών σχέσεων, μα πάνω από όλα η μουσική ως ιδέα που δεν εμπορευματοποιείται, αλλά αποτελεί αγαθό άυλο και συλλογικό, μας οδήγησε στην απόφασή να μοιραστούμε τη μουσική μας μαζί σας χωρίς μεσάζοντες. Να την θέσουμε απευθείας στη διάθεσή σας ως οικουμενικό αγαθό που δεν απαλλοτριώνεται, αλλά εξ ορισμού ανήκει στο κοινό. Διότι δεν επιθυμούμε να είμαστε απλοί παρατηρητές της αλλαγής που επιδιώκουμε να επέλθει, αλλά συμμέτοχοι αυτής με το να θέσουμε πρωτίστως τη λειτουργία της μουσικής ομάδας μας σε ένα πλαίσιο εξωσυστημικό...

- Προηγούμενη εμπειρία από crowdfunding

Η δίψα λοιπόν για ελεύθερη έκφραση και διακίνηση ιδεών, μας έκανε να στραφούμε για το τρίτο μας άλμπουμ "New Battles, without honor and humanity" στην χρηματοδότηση από το κοινό. Μία κίνηση που θα μας έδειχνε κατά πόσο η μουσική μας είναι απαραίτητη στον κόσμο.Η απήχηση του κόσμου καιτο αποτέλεσμα μας δικαίωσαν. Παλιοί φίλοι και νέοι, μας χρηματοδότησαν, στο μέγεθος της οικονομικής βοήθειας που μπορούσε ο καθένας να συνεισφέρει. Απ’ τις πρώτες μέρες έφθαναν σ’ εμάς ενθουσιώδη μηνύματα, και βλέπαμε κάθε μέρα να πλησιάζουμε πιο κοντά στο στόχο που είχαμε θέσει. Και τελικά καταφέραμε να κρατήσουμε ακέραια τα δικαιώματα της μουσική μας και να έχουμε εμείς το λόγο για το πως θα τη μοιραζόμαστε με το κοινό.

- Νέος δίσκος / Νέο εγχείρημα

"Η Κλωστή". Νεος δισκος με ελληνικό τίτλο και ελληνικούς στίχους! H ανάγκη για ακόμα πιο άμεση επικοινωνία με εσάς, η ανάγκη να μιλήσουμε για όσα συμβαίνουν εδώ, στον τόπο μας, οδήγησε στην απόφαση να εκφραστούμε στην ελληνική γλώσσα. "Η Κλωστή" θα κυκλοφορήσει ψηφιακά την 1η Οκτωβρίου. Θα προσφέρεται με ελεύθερη συνεισφορά, αλλά η πρόθεση μας είναι να κυκλοφορήσει και σε βινύλιο! Επίσης θέλοντας να αποδείξουμε και έμπρακτα τα πιστεύω μας για την ελεύθερη διακίνηση της μουσικής, αποφασίσαμε να κυκλοφορήσουμε μια ειδική έκδοση σε μορφή USB stick, σε τιμή κόστους. Μία έκδοση που θα περιέχει όλη τη δισκογραφια μας, την οποία θα έχετε τη δυνατοτητα να τη διακινήσετε όπως εσείς επιθυμείτε. Τα χρήματα θα μοιραστούν ακόμα στο τύπωμα των t-shirt, στο τύπωμα συνοδευτικού υλικού έκδοσης, πόστερ, κάρτες, αυτοκόλλητα, στα έξοδα αποστολής υλικού promo. Όπως καταλαβαίνετε ο στόχος που έχουμε θέσει πιθανότατα δεν καλύπτει όλα τα έξοδα, αλλά έπρεπε να θέσουμε κάτι το ρεαλιστικό. Δεν είμαστε αποκομμένοι από την πραγματικότητα, αντίθετα για αυτήν την πραγματικότητα τραγουδάμε, για αυτό και αντιλαμβανόμαστε τη σημασία της βοήθειας σας και ευχαριστούμε διπλά όσους θα έρθουν αρωγοί στην προσπάθεια μας.

Έχουμε τελειώσει το στάδιο των ηχογραφήσεων, της μίξης και πλέον εξαρτάται από εσάς αν θέλετε να ανοίξετε τον δίσκο, να μυρίσετε το βινύλιο, να το βάλετε προσεκτικά πάνω στο pickup σας και ακουμπώντας σιγά την βελόνα στην άκρη του δίσκου να ξεκινήσει να παίζει η "Κλωστή". 

Η απόφαση είναι στα χέρια σας.

Η αρχή έχει ήδη γίνει.

Η πορεία μας απο εδώ και πέρα εξαρτάται από εσάς...

- Κάλεσμα για δράση

Ξέρουμε ότι δεν είναι λίγοι εκείνοι που θα ήθελαν να συνδράμουν αλλά αδυνατούν. Σε αυτούς να πούμε ότι η διάδοση αυτής της σελίδας είναι εξίσου σημαντική βοήθεια για εμάς. Μιλήστε στους φίλους σας για αυτή την προσπάθεια, μοιραστείτε την στις σελίδες κοινωνικής δικτύωσης σας.

Ειρήνη και αγάπη για όλους.

2L8


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

- Introducing 2L8

Let us briefly talk about us.

2L8 have released three albums:

  • “Armed angels, frustrated youth, the art of self-deceit and music industry” (Poeta Negra / 2005), 

  • “He&She, Angry enough to keep loving in the Dark Ages” (Inner Ear / 2008), 

  • “New Battles, without honor and humanity” (No more happy music productions / 2011), 

What is characteristic about our discography is the radical stylistic shift between albums. This is the main reason why our music is hard to place in one firm category. It is post rock, post punk, new age, pop, rock, avant garde and at the same time nothing like that. Our music can always be found in our Bandcamp page, where you can download it on a choose your contribution concept.

In the recent past we have performed in almost all major venues in Athens, Thessaloniki, and also in numerous towns in the countryside as a full band act, an accoustic or a solo performance one.

- The idea behind 2L8

2L8 is about the team. Both on and off the stage.

The original apprehension of the idea of our musical group acting collectively, not hierarchically, can be found in the common sense that we share, in our opposition to society's authoritative structure. What links us individuals together is the need for free expression, the need to be part of a group of people that wishes to share music with the world as straightly and honestly as possible. Our denial to be part of this game, but above all the belief that music is an idea that can not be commercialized, but exists as an immaterial and collective commodity, lead us to the decision to share our music with all of you without the middleman. We desire to offer it direclty as a universal good that can not be alienated, but it is defined from its birth to belong to the public. We do not wish to be mere observers of a changing world, but to be part of the change we crave for, and we do so by putting ourselves outside common practices, in a context that does not comply with the system.

- Past crowdfunding experience

Our longing for free expression, distribution of ideas, lead us to turn, for our third album "New Battles, without honor and humanity", to crowdfunding. A move that was bound to show us if our music is needed. Your feedback and the result justified us. Old friends and new, funded us, of course in the extent and amount each was able to offer. From the first days we received enthusiastic messages, urging us to keep going, and we were left in awe watching us getting closer to the goal we have set. And we did it! We managed to retain the rights to our music, to have the final say on how to share it with the world.

- New album / New venture

"H Klosti (The Thread)". Our new album, the first one to be sung in greek! The need to talk about everything that is taking place in Greece, the need to communicate more directly with the people that we share our lives with, lead us to this decision. "The Thread" will be digitally released on October 1st. As all previous releases on a free contribution concept, but we also intent to have a vinyl publication! We also desire to prove in action our free music distribution beliefs, so we decided to have a special USB stick edition, in a price almost equal to the actual cost of the stick. This edition will include our entire discography, which you will be free to distribute as you wish. The money will also be used in making t-shirts, printing posters, card postal, stickers, and postal expenses of promo material. As you probably realize the goal we've set won't cover all these expenses, but we had to set a realistic target. We are well aware of the harsh reality, this is what we sing about, and this is why we understand the importance of your help, and we thank anyone who decides to step up and answer our call.

We are done and over with recordings and mixing and now it depends on you guys. Do you want to open the sleeve, fill your lungs with the smell of vinyl, place it carefully on the deck of your pickup and listen to "The Thread"?

The decision is yours

The journey started long ago but are we to continue our course?

That depends on you...

- Call to action

We know that some of you would love to but are not able to contribute. Spreading this page is equally important to us. Talk to your friends about this effort, share this on your social pages.

Peace and love to all

2L8

WE DID IT!!!!! THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Χαρακτηριστικό της δισκογραφίας μας είναι η αλλαγή σε ύφος και μουσικό στυλ από άλμπουμ σε άλμπουμ. Για αυτό η μουσική μας είναι δύσκολο να καταταχθεί σε κάποιο συγκεκριμένο μουσικό είδος. Είναι post rock, post punk, new age, pop, rock, avant garde, και ταυτόχρονα τίποτα από όλα αυτά. Την μουσική μας μπορείτε να την βρείτε στην σελίδα μας στο Bandcamp και να την κατεβάσετε με ελεύθερη συνεισφορά.
Έχουμε εμφανιστεί σε πολυάριθμους συναυλιακούς χώρους όπως Gagarin, Bios, Κύτταρο, Synch Festival, AN Club, Στέγη Γραμμάτων και Τεχνών(Αθήνα), Υδρόγειος, Μύλος, Eightball (Θεσσαλονίκη), Rec, Λιθογραφείο (Πάτρα), καθώς και σε πολλές πόλεις της επαρχίας, ως πλήρες σχήμα, ακουστικό, ή σόλο εμφανίσεις του Κ the Clown, ιδρυτή της ομάδας.

- H ιδέα πίσω από τους 2L8

Οι 2L8 έχουν να κάνουν με την ομάδα. Στη σκηνή και εκτός σκηνής. Η σύλληψη της ιδέας να προσδώσουμε στη μουσική μας έναν χαρακτήρα συλλογικό, και μη ιεραρχικό, υπήρξε αποτέλεσμα του κοινού συναισθήματος, της αντίθεσης μας στην εξουσιαστική δομή της κοινωνίας. Συνδετικοί μας κρίκοι η ανάγκη για ελεύθερη έκφραση, για ομαδικότητα και άμεση επικοινωνία της μουσικής μας με τον κόσμο. Η άρνηση μας να συμμετέχουμε σε ένα τέτοιο παιχνίδι πελατειακών σχέσεων, μα πάνω από όλα η μουσική ως ιδέα που δεν εμπορευματοποιείται, αλλά αποτελεί αγαθό άυλο και συλλογικό, μας οδήγησε στην απόφασή να μοιραστούμε τη μουσική μας μαζί σας χωρίς μεσάζοντες. Να την θέσουμε απευθείας στη διάθεσή σας ως οικουμενικό αγαθό που δεν απαλλοτριώνεται, αλλά εξ ορισμού ανήκει στο κοινό. Διότι δεν επιθυμούμε να είμαστε απλοί παρατηρητές της αλλαγής που επιδιώκουμε να επέλθει, αλλά συμμέτοχοι αυτής με το να θέσουμε πρωτίστως τη λειτουργία της μουσικής ομάδας μας σε ένα πλαίσιο εξωσυστημικό...

- Προηγούμενη εμπειρία από crowdfunding
Η δίψα λοιπόν για ελεύθερη έκφραση και διακίνηση ιδεών, μας έκανε να στραφούμε για το τρίτο μας άλμπουμ "New Battles, without honor and humanity" στην χρηματοδότηση από το κοινό. Μία κίνηση που θα μας έδειχνε κατά πόσο η μουσική μας είναι απαραίτητη στον κόσμο.Η απήχηση του κόσμου καιτο αποτέλεσμα μας δικαίωσαν. Παλιοί φίλοι και νέοι, μας χρηματοδότησαν, στο μέγεθος της οικονομικής βοήθειας που μπορούσε ο καθένας να συνεισφέρει. Απ’ τις πρώτες μέρες έφθαναν σ’ εμάς ενθουσιώδη μηνύματα, και βλέπαμε κάθε μέρα να πλησιάζουμε πιο κοντά στο στόχο που είχαμε θέσει. Και τελικά καταφέραμε να κρατήσουμε ακέραια τα δικαιώματα της μουσική μας και να έχουμε εμείς το λόγο για το πως θα τη μοιραζόμαστε με το κοινό.

- Νέος δίσκος / Νέο εγχείρημα

"Η Κλωστή". Νεος δισκος με ελληνικό τίτλο και ελληνικούς στίχους! H ανάγκη για ακόμα πιο άμεση επικοινωνία με εσάς, η ανάγκη να μιλήσουμε για όσα συμβαίνουν εδώ, στον τόπο μας, οδήγησε στην απόφαση να εκφραστούμε στην ελληνική γλώσσα. "Η Κλωστή" θα κυκλοφορήσει ψηφιακά την 1η Οκτωβρίου. Θα προσφέρεται με ελεύθερη συνεισφορά, αλλά η πρόθεση μας είναι να κυκλοφορήσει και σε βινύλιο! Επίσης θέλοντας να αποδείξουμε και έμπρακτα τα πιστεύω μας για την ελεύθερη διακίνηση της μουσικής, αποφασίσαμε να κυκλοφορήσουμε μια ειδική έκδοση σε μορφή USB stick, σε τιμή κόστους. Μία έκδοση που θα περιέχει όλη τη δισκογραφια μας, την οποία θα έχετε τη δυνατοτητα να τη διακινήσετε όπως εσείς επιθυμείτε. Τα χρήματα θα μοιραστούν ακόμα στο τύπωμα των t-shirt, στο τύπωμα συνοδευτικού υλικού έκδοσης, πόστερ, κάρτες, αυτοκόλλητα, στα έξοδα αποστολής υλικού promo. Όπως καταλαβαίνετε ο στόχος που έχουμε θέσει πιθανότατα δεν καλύπτει όλα τα έξοδα, αλλά έπρεπε να θέσουμε κάτι το ρεαλιστικό. Δεν είμαστε αποκομμένοι από την πραγματικότητα, αντίθετα για αυτήν την πραγματικότητα τραγουδάμε, για αυτό και αντιλαμβανόμαστε τη σημασία της βοήθειας σας και ευχαριστούμε διπλά όσους θα έρθουν αρωγοί στην προσπάθεια μας.
Έχουμε τελειώσει το στάδιο των ηχογραφήσεων, της μίξης και πλέον εξαρτάται από εσάς αν θέλετε να ανοίξετε τον δίσκο, να μυρίσετε το βινύλιο, να το βάλετε προσεκτικά πάνω στο pickup σας και ακουμπώντας σιγά την βελόνα στην άκρη του δίσκου να ξεκινήσει να παίζει η "Κλωστή". 
Η απόφαση είναι στα χέρια σας.
Η αρχή έχει ήδη γίνει.
Η πορεία μας απο εδώ και πέρα εξαρτάται από εσάς...
- Κάλεσμα για δράση



Ξέρουμε ότι δεν είναι λίγοι εκείνοι που θα ήθελαν να συνδράμουν αλλά αδυνατούν. Σε αυτούς να πούμε ότι η διάδοση αυτής της σελίδας είναι εξίσου σημαντική βοήθεια για εμάς. Μιλήστε στους φίλους σας για αυτή την προσπάθεια, μοιραστείτε την στις σελίδες κοινωνικής δικτύωσης σας.
Ειρήνη και αγάπη για όλους.
2L8

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Introducing 2L8



Let us briefly talk about us.
2L8 have released three albums:

“Armed angels, frustrated youth, the art of self-deceit and music industry” (Poeta Negra / 2005), 


“He&She, Angry enough to keep loving in the Dark Ages” (Inner Ear / 2008), 


“New Battles, without honor and humanity” (No more happy music productions / 2011), 
What is characteristic about our discography is the radical stylistic shift between albums. This is the main reason why our music is hard to place in one firm category. It is post rock, post punk, new age, pop, rock, avant garde and at the same time nothing like that. Our music can always be found in our Bandcamp page, where you can download it on a choose your contribution concept.
In the recent past we have performed in almost all major venues in Athens, Thessaloniki, and also in numerous towns in the countryside as a full band act, an accoustic or a solo performance one.

- The idea behind 2L8





2L8 is about the team. Both on and off the stage.
The original apprehension of the idea of our musical group acting collectively, not hierarchically, can be found in the common sense that we share, in our opposition to society's authoritative structure. What links us individuals together is the need for free expression, the need to be part of a group of people that wishes to share music with the world as straightly and honestly as possible. Our denial to be part of this game, but above all the belief that music is an idea that can not be commercialized, but exists as an immaterial and collective commodity, lead us to the decision to share our music with all of you without the middleman. We desire to offer it direclty as a universal good that can not be alienated, but it is defined from its birth to belong to the public. We do not wish to be mere observers of a changing world, but to be part of the change we crave for, and we do so by putting ourselves outside common practices, in a context that does not comply with the system.
- Past crowdfunding experience



Our longing for free expression, distribution of ideas, lead us to turn, for our third album "New Battles, without honor and humanity", to crowdfunding. A move that was bound to show us if our music is needed. Your feedback and the result justified us. Old friends and new, funded us, of course in the extent and amount each was able to offer. From the first days we received enthusiastic messages, urging us to keep going, and we were left in awe watching us getting closer to the goal we have set. And we did it! We managed to retain the rights to our music, to have the final say on how to share it with the world.
- New album / New venture



"H Klosti (The Thread)". Our new album, the first one to be sung in greek! The need to talk about everything that is taking place in Greece, the need to communicate more directly with the people that we share our lives with, lead us to this decision. "The Thread" will be digitally released on October 1st. As all previous releases on a free contribution concept, but we also intent to have a vinyl publication! We also desire to prove in action our free music distribution beliefs, so we decided to have a special USB stick edition, in a price almost equal to the actual cost of the stick. This edition will include our entire discography, which you will be free to distribute as you wish. The money will also be used in making t-shirts, printing posters, card postal, stickers, and postal expenses of promo material. As you probably realize the goal we've set won't cover all these expenses, but we had to set a realistic target. We are well aware of the harsh reality, this is what we sing about, and this is why we understand the importance of your help, and we thank anyone who decides to step up and answer our call.
We are done and over with recordings and mixing and now it depends on you guys. Do you want to open the sleeve, fill your lungs with the smell of vinyl, place it carefully on the deck of your pickup and listen to "The Thread"?
The decision is yours
The journey started long ago but are we to continue our course?
That depends on you...
- Call to action


We know that some of you would love to but are not able to contribute. Spreading this page is equally important to us. Talk to your friends about this effort, share this on your social pages.
Peace and love to all
2L8

story:
What is BR Hops?

A multidisciplinary arts and education festival incorporating elements of visual art, performance theatre, history and dance rising out of Hip Hop Culture. BR Hops is dedicated to the advancement and preservation of Hip Hop Culture.

When and where?

September 12-14, 2013 at the Manship Theatre and Shaw Center for the Arts/North Boulevard Town Square

What time does it begin?

The opening reception will begin Thursday the 12th at 6 p.m..

Why?

To celebrate the history and artistry of Hip Hop culture while promoting local performing and visual artist in Baton Rouge.  To continue to aid in the revitalization of Downtown Baton Rouge.

What to expect?

Color, music, live art, dance workshops, deejay workshops, spoken word, good food and a good time.

What type of dance workshops?

West African dance, hip hop, contemporary and freestyle.

How is it funded?

Sponsors are the main contributors to the festival. If interested in sponsorship, visit brhops.com or email brhops@gmail.com

How to get involved?

brhops.com

 Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise about BR Hops!

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

I have been a hard working musician for twenty six years so far. I am ecstatic about the release of my first solo album, Time to Rise. Thank you for your help making this happen!

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $4,500 to finish: the album, mixing, mastering, duplication, artwork and graphic design, download cards, promotion, band fees, cd release parties and tour support.
  • I have listed several perks to say thank you for your contribution! every contribution makes a huge impact on the success of the record! In short, YOU are RAD!

 

The Impact

  • I am promoting my album locally and worldwide through touring, internet radio stations, college radio stations and by word of mouth.
  • You make a difference in the success of this record. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute financially, I would appreciate you sharing my music and video with others.
  • The world is a better place when we help each other out!
  • You rock, you're RAD, thank you so very much for helping!!!!

story:
Short Summary

2012 was Elisium's best year to date! 2013 is shaping up to be EVEN better.  We've been playing shows with awesome bands, playing great new markets, and gaining new friends and fans at every stop.  A week ago, we were leaving a show and hit some snow, and our van wrecked into a tree.  :( Our trailer and van are totaled.  So, we have no choice but to ask for help. 

What We Need

Here is the situation we are in, honestly:

  • Our van and trailer are totaled, and need to be replaced.
  • The trailer will cost between $1500-2500, and the cost of our van is unknown
  • Our schedule of summer festivals keeps filling up, and our hope is to not miss a SINGLE show - but that will take a group effort (Thank you in advance!!)

Rewards For Helping!

We really appreciate even a few dollars to help us out.  Our van and trailer are with us ALL the time, so we want to give you guys something as well that can be with you all the time, and remind us of your support!  So we have a few really cool reward to offer including:
  • Special VIP Backstage Laminate that says "I Saved The Band"
  • Private Instrument lesson from a band member!
  • Acoustic CD (to be recorded in May)
  • Acoustic show in your home!
  • Your company name or logo on our printed materials for a year.
  • Your company logo on the side of our new trailer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money sucks.  Let's face it, it's true.  We are here because we don't have enough, and we hate to ask anyone for money ever.  So, if you are unable to contribute dollars, but still want to help out, here are some tips and ideas!

  • SHARE this fundraiser - post it on your Facebook page, your Twitter, Instagram, email it to your friends and family, help us reach as many people as we can!
  • Have a bake sale, or fundraiser of your own! One of our awesome friends who makes jewelry gave me this idea, she's created some custom Elisium items, and is donating a portion of the sales to our cause.  Awesome!

Thanks for taking the time to explore our campaign.  All of the money we raise will go straight to replacing the trailer, van, and paying accident related expenses, which are huge.  This is the most important fundraiser we have ever conducted, and its success is critical to maintaining our busy show schedule, and making sure that Elisium stays on the road, where we belong. 

"The woods are lovely, dark and deep. But I have promises to keep.  And miles to go before I sleep.  Miles to go, before I sleep."  - R. Frost

story:
Hey folks!

If you've found my page, thank you for stopping by and checking out what I'm working on. 

About Myself + The New Album

For those who haven't met me, I am a singer-songwriter living in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, and I'm about 75% of my way through making my 4th album, Chrysalis. It's been a beautiful adventure so far...I kinda feel like there are angels watching over this one.

Side A: In the Summer of 2012, on the heels of 3 years of illness, and with the help of nearly 140 people, I raised over $8,000 for the recording sessions for Chrysalis. Since then, the project has been in very good hands with my co-producer and the incredible musicians. We began recording in November in Pittsburgh. Even in their rough state, the new songs have a real vibe and appeal. So excited about this! 

Side B: Now that we're well into the recording sessions I am looking ahead for ways to fund the post-production in February. In all humility, my friends and fans helped me rock the first campaign, and working towards "paying back" my sponsors with music and gifts rather than money is a brand new experience for me. I love it so far, and want to keep the momentum going. 

Why the Campaign & What You Get

Making recordings can be expensive, like buying a new car -- in my case an economy car and not a Tesla! Through Indiegogo, I am seeking people, such as yourself, to essentially pre-order my album as a way to fund its production. Your support will sponsor the mixing, mastering, artist/album design, and so on. This is the final stretch and every little bit helps!

When you donate to one of the levels of the campaign you get the album before it's released plus receive other unique perks that only backers (that's you) have access to PLUS!...if you pre-order before December 31, 2012, I will add a bonus track to any pledge level!

You can also:

SHARE: My 'Side A' campaign was largely successful because of enthusiastic support on Facebook. As an introvert, this support is huge, and I invite you to share my page with your networks and friends. Be my megaphone. I will do what I can to megaphone you back.

Every Little Bit 

What you should know is that Indiegogo is an on-going proposition. Backing/pre-orders happen in real time. I know times aren't so easy, but whatever support you could provide would be greatly appreciated, and all of it will count. Indiegogo's flex funding is a WIN-WIN: whether I reach my goal or not, you will still get the music and your selected perks, and I will still receive resources to keep working.

I very much want to share the new music with you. Thanks again for stopping by, considering backing my project and helping me bring this home. You will allow this album to happen!

XO 

Heather

“Love calls - everywhere and always. We're sky bound. Are you coming?” - Rumi

story:
James Weston just finished recording his first album since 1997.  It was recorded "old school" to Analog Tape.  He needs your help to complete it.  It has been mixed and is waiting to be mastered and distributed.  The intention is to get funding to pay for mastering and duplication.  Digital and Analog will be included. 

     It is going to be cut to vinyl record from the world famous "The Mastering Lab" run by Doug Sax.  Google that guys name and you will be blown away.  He is a pioneer of how music sounds today.

     From Pink Floyd, The Rolling Stones, The Eagles, to Miles Davis, Willie Nelson, and Neil Young, The Mastering Lab has made their mark as the premier mastering facility in the world since 1967. They will prepare, and cut the vinyl record as well as digitally master the album.  Then it is off to United Records in Nashville, TN to be cut and packaged for you.  200 copies...   Go buy a record player and listen:)

Here is a sample of a song called "Have You Ever Loved Someone" from the album.  CLICK HERE

      Once again, thank you for checking out my project.  I am so close to completing this dream I have had for almost 20 years.  With your help, it will happen.   Cheers.   JAMES WESTON

story:
Hey guys. I'm Charlie Rey. You may have seen me on last season of The Voice.

Since the show, I've been working on a really great record, and I can't wait to share it with you.  Right now I am in the process of creating my first music video. We chose an awesome song, and have a great idea, and I know it's going to turn out great.

In order to make it the best quality possible, I'm starting this campaign to raise money for the production materials needed to make this dream a reality.

My dream is to make music. I know I'll be doing it for the rest of my life.  My goal is to make a video so I can share this dream with as many people as possible

What We Need & What You Get

I have a lot of great talent already committed to this project.  Many people who are donating their time and skills for absolutely free. However, acquiring materials can get costly. That is where the campaign dollars come in.

The money will be used to secure proper production materials including lights, grips, etc. as well as ensure proper conditions for all of the crew.

We are asking for 2000 dollars, which we hope will cover most of the shoot. 

I've arranged a bunch of cool perks for anyone who is able to help this cause.

Regardless of the outcome of this campaign, any money raised will be completely put towards my musical endeavors, and creating songs that you want to sing.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help out by donating, there are plenty of ways for you to get involved. I'd appreciate you sharing this link, or referring people to my facebook page. Any litttle bit helps.

To all the fans I have, and to all the fans I will make... Thank you for everything!

story:
Agni Varsha (Fire and Rain) is a parable from the ancient Indian Mahabharata. Composer Vanraj Bhatia, now 87, has created an opera around this complex tale, which he considers to be his magnum opus. He will travel from Mumbai with his librettist, Rani Day Burra, and theater director Amal Allana, to participate in the reading, and honor the vast South Asian community of Jackson Heights Queens.

Performances will take place on May 11 & 12, 2012 at the Renaissance Charter School, with students  making both tech and musical contributions at all levels.

the principal roles will be taken by distinguished singers from the NYC and upstate areas, including David Gordon, Tory Browers, Kirsten Sollek, David Neal, Davis Schmidt, Aram Tchobanian and John Petrozino. We have received a small grant form the Queens Council for the Arts, and community support from local merchants and banks. As the renaissance school is generously donating their auditorium, almost all funding will go toward artist fees. With 15 solo roles and additional chorus, the total comes to $7500. Many of the singers have agreed to a sliding scale based on our fund-raising success, but we will need to raise at least $2500 in addition to the grants we already have. There will be minimal prop/costume and meal expense, absorbed somewhat by in-kind contributions from the community.

The impact of producing this world-premiere event in this community is immense. the cast is ethnically mixed, as is the group of participating students. Vanraj Bhatia is, for many here, a household name, and it is an honor for him to come (the Indian government has provided funding for his travel with his colleagues).

the music is a beautiful mix of western art music and Raga themes that, in the words of the composer, "is an exuberant musical interpretation of a little-known myth from our great Mahabharata - a new showcase for the music, dance and literature of india. For me, it is the culmination of my life's work."

story:
Opera is not obsolete.  Popular opinion of opera is.

One Ounce Opera aims to put opera in unexpected places - your local pub, live music stages tenured by bands and DJ's, outdoor festivals, and of course, private celebrations and fundraising benefits.

Why "One Ounce" Opera?  Two reasons, really.  First, OOO aims to provide a come-and-go, laid back, interactive atmosphere to experience a virtuosic sonic event up close -- in small, powerful doses (just “one ounce” of opera).  Secondly, we welcome a few ounces of adult beverages both during and after, and hope to "share an ounce" with you soon, in the spirit of music and fellowship -- two things we believe in passionately.

This fantastic ensemble of professional, dedicated singing-artists was assembled after local auditions in April. As Founder and General Director, I carefully chose people who committed to strong and fearless performances.  You will truly see something new, different, and exciting every single show.  You will immediately sense each singer's love for what they do and what they have trained tirelessly for.

Austin is ripe for innovation.  We want to be a part of the musical landscape in Central Texas for years to come.  We are Opera, Austinfied.  And we need your help.

 

What We Need

Opera ain't cheap - even if the beer is.

My OOO Team has already given so much of their time and talents, simply out of passion in this project and our unique vision for the music we love to sing.  Moving forward, we must reach out to fully realize our potential.  This is where we turn the spotlight on YOU.

Quite literally, we cannot do this without you.  Every single contribution, regardless of amount, will directly fund imperative actions like:

  • Purchasing of musical and sound equipment - quality portable electronic keyboard, piano bench, music stands, speakers, monitors, specialty microphones, cords, amps, PA's
  • Our pianists - they do this for a living, y'all.  No rehearsal or show can "go on" without them. Their expertise is absolutely essential to a successful company.
  • Space and time - rehearsal space rental, workshop space rental, and down the road just a bit, theatre or large venue rental / time for showcasing a new opera written by a local composer.
  • Odds and Ends - copies (and copies and copies...), administration help, website hosting, marketing and promotions, purchasing a banner and a backdrop, buying boas (yes, boas - don't judge), a few $ for gas (can't ride Valkyries everywhere).

What We Will Do With It

Our objectives are simple, powerful, and most definitely possible:

  • Encourage a new generation of “opera lovers” with culturally significant, non-traditional venue and program choices.
  • Become a respected artistic company of professional singing-artists and musicians providing memorable alternative musical experiences, while promoting opera and classical singing as a vibrant, current, accessible art form.
  • Challenge our singing-artists to perform with every inch of their talent, both vocally and dramatically.
  • Give our singing-artists a platform to explore new repertoire, share the stage with their peers, and perfect their craft in front of a very live audience.

Other Ways You Can Show Support

Spread the word, folks!  "Like" our page on Facebook, follow @OneOunceOpera on Twitter, share our website with friends and family, and bring your peeps to shows.  We can always use Street Team Members, willing to hang posters at coffee houses and hand out flyers wearing horns (*optional).

Our Thanks to You

On Thursday, August 23rd, with your support and contributions, we will present a GRAND LAUNCH SHOW AND PARTY at the newly-tricked-out Red 7, right in the heart of the Live Music Capital of the World.  What better place for us to meet and thank every person who has made One Ounce Opera a successful, viable artistic company, born from the spirit of Austin and the dream of a crazy soprano.

PS - you MAY give anonymously, or elect to not show the amount or your name publicly.  See the options available by clicking "contribute now".
