story:
Our Story

   Young Bloods is a 5 piece rock outfit that hails from Rochester, NY. Here's our story.
   
    It takes a lot of heart and passion to be a DIY band in today's music world. Without the backing of a label, booking agent etc. everything comes from long nights in front of a computer screen and a strong will to reach the goals we set for ourselves. With this path, it also means that all funding comes from our very own pockets %70 to %100 percent of the time, and touring is definitely the most enduring and difficult process of being a DIY band.

    As of a month ago, a day before leaving on our most recent tour we had to say goodbye to our van that has graciously kept us on the road for a little over 3 years. Unfortunately the wear and tear of touring caught up to her, and as a result, the transmission is no longer with us R.I.P. 

    Since then, we've spent many many hours cramped into a Jeep Liberty, making the best of our situation to continue to do what we love, and make the connection that music allows us to make with every person we meet on the road.

    We've started this campaign to ask the help of all of the people we've made that connection with over the years to assist us in the purchase of a new van. As we all know it is no cheap venture, and we are in a position where we definitely need help.

 

The Impact

    Touring and driving 2000+ miles in a matter of a week or more depending on the length and distance covered in any given tour definitely takes a toll on anyone, even in a van suited to fit 7 people or more. Doing all of this in a smaller sized SUV is suprisingly a very demanding feat on all of our bodies, minds, and morale. The seating capacity and space available in a Jeep Liberty is manufactured to seat 5 people, barely. Add bags, food, and other essentials, the space gets very small, very quickly.

                                   Take a look for yourself

 

What We Need & What You Get

Where will your money go?

    All of the funding's we receive will go directly to the purchase of a new van and all of the expenses needed to make a vehicle legal for 5 dudes to drive across the country in. We feel that $2500 dollars is a good average amount to handle most if not all of these costs.

    For example:

- Down payment, or payment in full for a van.

- Registration

- License plates

- Insurance

    Other than what we can gather from our own personal bank accounts, this is the only other funding we have towards our goal.

 

Whats in it for you?

    In return, for anyone who graciously takes the time to participate in this campaign, besides our eternal gratitude and thank you's, will receive one or more of the perks we have set up that we hope will be worth your time and donation.

                                                                 CHECK OUT THE PERKS ----->

                *Exclusive 'I Heart YB' Tee (Included in select perks)*

 

Other Ways You Can Help

   Money is tight. We know that its how it is for most people in the world today, ourselves included. Even if you aren't able to make a donation there are other ways to help! We hope that anyone who takes the time to read this, or watch our video can share the links to this campaign, make a tweet, or even a facebook status to help us spread the word. Literally any amount of support will go a very long way, and we can not thank everyone enough ahead of time for the help. THANK YOU!

story:
This Summer, Beautiful Chorus is heading out on a great adventure to the west! We are calling this the Tour of ABUNDANCE because we believe that all we need is available for us, and all we do in love will flourish with great prosperity!

We'll be traveling for over a month, beginning at the end of May. This tour is important to us because it helps us connect with more of YOU! As a divine harmony collective of 12 powerful women (sometimes more), we are fully aware of the divine energy within connecting with love, and expanding as we learn more and more of ourselves through these connections. The Tour of ABUNDANCE may be coming to a city near you. Here is a pic of the cities we've been called to for our first tour. If you're nearby, come see us! 

 

Resonance Meditation is what we call our genre of music. Sometimes it's rhythmic, sometimes it's ethereal. Sometimes we whisper, sometimes we sign with the force of 144,000 tribes. The focus of our Resonance Meditation is to help bring about the feelings and experiences of personal alignment! We believe meditation can be for people of all ages, from all walks of life.

We created our form of Resonance Meditation after months of preparing for only one show. Once we had come together, practiced, and fallen in love with our experiences of Beautiful Chorus, we knew we had to share it.... and so, Resonance Meditation and the Tour of ABUNDANCE were born!

 

Whether you'll be seeing us on tour, or enjoying the sounds of Beautiful Chorus online, we've got plenty of gifts to send your way in thanks for donating to our campaign! Everything listed below is made by us, and we hope to have all the perks delivered by the time we head out on tour. You can also pick up your perks directly from us if you're in one of the cities above! We're coming up with new BC merchandise ideas every day, so if there's something you'd like to see, send a message our way and we'll add it to the list!

 

In a live setting, the unique blending of harmonies by Beautiful Chorus, coupled with the pure tones of crystal and alchemy bowls, brings the experience of Resonance Meditation to new levels. With innovative soundscapes and elegant vocal expressions, the undulating waves of harmonies are truly transcendent and will have you reaching deeper and more personal states of clarity, self-awareness, and refreshing calm.

Our studio recordings are a combination of Beautiful Chorus voices and the production mastery of Divinci of Solillaquists of Sound. The flow and ease of these songs helps to release mental resistence, which in itself... is exactly what we mean by 'meditation.' We've been recording our album to be ready for our tour this Summer.

On this tour, we'll be focusing on two types of shows

  • Live Resonance Meditations in places like yoga studios, resonant environments, and in-home private sessions, where all participants will be invited to bathe in the sounds of Beautiful Chorus.
  • Music Festival and large group settings where we can play with the tones and melodies created by lots of loving people in an artistically diverse environment.

We'll also offer a limited amount of very special, private meditations for individuals and small groups of close friends. These are perfect if you'd like to personally hire Beautiful Chorus to help you set an intention and cultivate its focused creation within your own space and personal being. Write to us at beautifulchorus@gmail.com for more info on these types of sessions.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * 

For our Live Resonance Meditations, we'll be bringing with us a set of beautiful Crystal Singing Bowls, sent especially for Beautiful Chorus by Crystal Tones (www.crystalsingingbowls.com) We're so in love with working with this conscious, open-heart, purely resonating company. These bowls will be attuned to the vibrations and tones of Beautiful Chorus for our ABUNDANCE Tour and we look forward to bathing you in their, and our, divine sound!

 

Day by day, we are coming to an even greater understanding of the power within being able to share these songs and practices with you. This tour is about US + YOU, and we're so excited to see what may come of our dreams intertwining.

Each of us is responsible (able to respond) to the inner calling of personal alignment. All of us here in BC know that this can be an exciting focus, an exhilarating ride, and a path filled with light. Meditation, and bringing oneself into the experience of alignment, is always possible with practice. We've cultivated and specifically tailored our meditations to fit within both large and small group/individual settings.

Intimate, Private, and Small Group Sessions

The deep, personal quality of small group resonance (30-100 people), allows for the participants to focus easily within themselves, bringing the experience of interconnectedness from within to the external group. Smaller venues also allow for the nuances of natural, vocal meditation, to be heard. It is in these more intimate settings that Beautiful Chorus will often travel throughout the room, providing a 360 degree soundscape for everyone who has gathered.

Community and Large Group Meditations

The celebratory energy of large groups is one of the most intense and powerful ways for people to experience the feeling of coming into alignment, and experiencing their relationship to a larger whole. Once a resonant field has been established amongst a large group, it carries with it an outstandingly strong momentous force.

Are you ready for Resonance Meditation? What kind of Resonance Meditation is calling to you?

 

Beautiful Chorus started with Love, is sustaining in Love, and imagines an experience of pure Love in all ever-present visualizations.  Resonance Meditation is a powerful tool for upliftment, for peace, for ease and clarity. There is a key that we have found within our resonant tones, within the spaces between our tones. We are honest, we are always growing, and our adventure is exceeding even our greatest expectations on the daily.

We love our calling to share the feelings we've discovered, with you. We love our calling to share this resonance, this bliss, and this fun. Love is our greatest foundation. Beautiful Chorus exists because of Love Unconditional. 

 

You can listen, sing along, hum the melody in your head, or just sit back and relax. Meditation is truly a journey, and every journey begins with a single step. Whether tidying up, driving, relaxing, waking, sleeping, during yoga practice or therapeutic massage, be patient with yourself and enjoy! We hope to see you on our Tour of ABUNDANCE!

 

This project is about beautiful harmonies and beautiful connections.      If you know someone who you think would be interested in this project or would like to help us in another way, we are ready. You can always write to us directly at BeautifulChorus@gmail.com 

You can help us create our Resonance Meditation community by sharing this page and spreading the word. We love meeting stellar people along our journey!

We are excited to share our voices and experience of togetherness with you. See you soon! ~XOXO BC

Community and Large Group Meditations

The celebratory energy of large groups is one of the most intense and powerful ways for people to experience the feeling of coming into alignment, and experiencing their relationship to a larger whole. Once a resonant field has been established amongst a large group, it carries with it an outstandingly strong momentous force.
Are you ready for Resonance Meditation? What kind of Resonance Meditation is calling to you?
 

Beautiful Chorus started with Love, is sustaining in Love, and imagines an experience of pure Love in all ever-present visualizations.  Resonance Meditation is a powerful tool for upliftment, for peace, for ease and clarity. There is a key that we have found within our resonant tones, within the spaces between our tones. We are honest, we are always growing, and our adventure is exceeding even our greatest expectations on the daily.
We love our calling to share the feelings we've discovered, with you. We love our calling to share this resonance, this bliss, and this fun. Love is our greatest foundation. Beautiful Chorus exists because of Love Unconditional. 

 
You can listen, sing along, hum the melody in your head, or just sit back and relax. Meditation is truly a journey, and every journey begins with a single step. Whether tidying up, driving, relaxing, waking, sleeping, during yoga practice or therapeutic massage, be patient with yourself and enjoy! We hope to see you on our Tour of ABUNDANCE!


 
This project is about beautiful harmonies and beautiful connections.      If you know someone who you think would be interested in this project or would like to help us in another way, we are ready. You can always write to us directly at BeautifulChorus@gmail.com 
You can help us create our Resonance Meditation community by sharing this page and spreading the word. We love meeting stellar people along our journey!
We are excited to share our voices and experience of togetherness with you. See you soon! ~XOXO BC

story:
Let's Do This Thing!

Hey lovely people!  We're Dan and Megan, also known as The Blackwood Two.  We're fundraising cash-money to record and release our new album, and we need YOUR help to make it happen!

In December 2010 we released our first EP, which we recorded and packaged entirely ourselves.  That EP allowed us to tour from coast to coast, play some great gigs, and meet some amazing people.  Now, with a bunch of new original material, an evolving sound, and a little more experience, we're very excited to record a brand new album.

With your help, we can make this new album a reality.  Your donations will make you directly involved with the creation of this album, and together we'll make it happen!  We literally wont be able to acheive the results we want without you, and we're excited about the idea of having all the wonderful people we've met along the way be part of this!

The Deets

We're asking for $3000.  This probably sounds like a lot (it IS alot!); however you can rest assured it's a reasonable amount for the creation of a new album.

This money will be divided into:
- recording costs (studio time, mixing, mastering)
- CD duplication costs
- packaging (CD sleeves and printing)

We have some pretty sweet perks listed on the right of the page!  Every donation gets some kind of perk, including a copy of the new album.  Think of donating as pre-buying the album in order to fund its creation.  Pretty cool!  Every amount helps.  Check out the perks and donate what feels good to you!

All in All

Bottom line:  we're pumped about our new material.  It's high time we get a new album out.  We want our friends, family, and fans to be a part of the process.  We think it's going to sound sweet, and hopefully be a meaningful contribution to the new Canadian folk canon.  We want you along for the ride!

ALSO, please please please, share this link, share the video, spread the word, tell your friends.  Monetary support certainly isn't the only way to help (although that's cool too).

Thanks very much everyone.  We're looking forward to making this happen!

 

Peace and Love,

Dan and Meg

story:
What I'm Making (And Need Your Help To Complete!)

I'm making an album about zombies! And George W. Bush! How could you not already be sold?!

Broadly speaking, the album will be industrial, but it's not being constrained to hardline interpretations of the genre. Think early 80s industrial that grew out of early electronic, cold wave, etc. Fans of Skinny Puppy, Depeche Mode, Kraftwerk, early video games (8-bit & 16-bit), Front Line Assembly and a bunch of other bands will feel right at home with my music.

So, here's the setup for the album's concept:

In another reality, George W. Bush is still President of the United States. The recent rash of cannibalistic, zombie-like attacks have turned out to be the harbinger of an actual zombie apocalypse. Turns out that the Mayan calendar predicted the full outbreak with almost laser-like precision.

As the country descends into terror, carnage and societal revolt, President Bush enacts a plan to round up, inter and quarantine the zombies, believing that there may be a cure for the infection, that they may yet be helped.

Ultimately, this plan proves futile, and the zombies break free of the government's containment facilities, overrunning and decimating the federal forces keeping them in check. Because nearly all the nation's defenses have been stationed at quarantine facilities, there are few organized forces left in place to fight the coming horde.

As chaos descends, the nation struggles to maintain order and safety and ultimately largely succumbs to the undead threat. Bands of survivors hold together and fight back against the horde, which is eventually defeated, but only at catastrophic cost to humanity.

The problem is this: I need a bit more equipment than I currently have to finish this album. 

 

What Will The Final Product Be?

Primarily, it's a downloadable album of music. If this fundraising exercise is successful, there will also be a digital download of a comic book that tells the story of the album.

Want to hear some of the album to know what you're contributing to? I don't blame you, I'd want to know what I was funding before I gave my money to the cause, too! So you can get a taste for what the album will sound like, I've loaded up two of the tracks that you can stream (or purchase, if you choose) from BandCamp:

http://99kmusic.bandcamp.com/track/internment
http://99kmusic.bandcamp.com/track/epidemic

 

What Do You Get For Helping Fund This Campaign?

First and foremost, you'll get access to the album and that warm fuzzy feeling of knowing you've helped make it a reality! If I don't get fully funded, the first thing to go will be the comic, which I can work on after the album is done. However, I plan to proceed and work to finish this project regardless. People who have earned perks will get them, regardless of the goal being met.

If you contribute at least $10, you'll get a link to download the album as soon as it's ready for release.

If you contribute at least $20, you'll get the album, plus access to the video diary I'm starting about the process of writing and producing this album. This video diary will cover the last 5-7 songs I'm writing for the album.

If you contribute at least $30, you'll get the album, access to my video diary, plus a link to all the b-sides that won't be included on the final album. There are a few pretty cool songs that won't make the cut, and this is your opportunity to have them.

If you contribute at least $50, you'll get the album, access to my video diary, the b-sides and your name in the credits for the album.

If I exceed funding significantly, the top contributors will get additional awesome stuff that may include physical copies of the album, physical copies of the comic or other awesome stuff. I'm structuring this fundraising campaign to be as bare-bones as possible. I'm not asking for help funding any kind of payment for this album, only help funding the equipment I need to make it. So, I can't say what higher level perks would be because I'm not shooting for a whole lot of money for this. Suffice it to say, I want to say thank you to everyone who helps this dream of mine become a reality, and I will make sure that I reward people as generously as I possibly can, above and beyond the perks I've outlined.

 

What I'll Be Using These Funds To Purchase (And Why!)

• Akai Pro MPK61 USB MIDI Keyboard Controller ($417) - PURCHASED

http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002M897SE?ref_=sr_1_2&s=musical-instruments&rps=1&qid=1343924454&sr=1-2&keywords=88%20key%20midi%20controller

The keyboard I presently have is a two-octave mini keyboard. Creating music on this type of keyboard is incredibly difficult due to the size of the keys, which are roughly 40% smaller than standard. The Akai Pro keyboard allows for many more on-the-fly adjustments, which will allow me to create better, more interesting sounding songs.

• AKG Perception 120 USB Microphone ($135) - PURCHASED

http://www.amazon.com/AKG-PERCEPTION-120-USB-Microphone/dp/B003DSI62U/ref=sr_1_2?s=musical-instruments&ie=UTF8&qid=1343924662&sr=1-2&keywords=AKG+Perception+120

I do not presently own a recording quality microphone. Every time I have recorded vocals in the past, I have done so at friends' home studios or using borrowed equipment. This is a great quality digital mic at a reasonable price that will allow me to add vocals to this album.

• Logic Pro ($200) - PURCHASED

http://www.apple.com/logicpro/

I presently mix and master all my music in Audacity. It gets the job done, but it's certainly not the most elegant or powerful solution. In the end, I firmly believe that adding a high-quality post-production suite will allow me to create a much more compelling album. I have used Logic Pro in the past and am familiar with its workflow. Transitioning my knowledge of mixing and mastering to a new software tool will not be a difficult process.

• Art ($400) - INSUFFICIENT FUNDING

This album is based on a story I've written. I'm working with a very talented artist to finalize the comic form of the story, which will be included as a digital download with the album.

Total expense: $1152 before taxes, shipping and fees.

Fees: IndieGogo charges either 4% or 9%, depending on whether the project is funded fully. PayPal also charges me about 3%. These fees add up quickly, as do taxes and shipping. The difference between total expenses and the goal will be used to cover these additional costs.

Total goal: $1500

If I am lucky enough to raise more than my goal, I'll use that money to fund additional software purchases. The more software I have, the more I can do with the album to create lots of awesome, varied soundscapes. If I'm lucky enough to go beyond that level, I'll look into options for printing physical copies of the album on CD and maybe even on vinyl! No matter what, you can rest assured that whatever you donate will be funneled directly into the composition, production, editing, mixing, mastering and distribution of this album.

 

What I Already Have And Am Using (And Why I Need Even More Stuff)

• Native Instruments Maschine

Maschine is an incredibly powerful software / hardware combination that allows for extremely tight composition. It uses a physical (midi based) controller that's designed specifically to work with the Maschine software. It's really an awesome tool and integrates seamlessly with other Native Instruments software like Komplete.

• Native Instruments Komplete 8

This is the basis for most of the sounds I use. Komplete comes with a heaping helping of incredible synths, but falls a bit short on the drums for industrial music. I am an avid user of FM8, Reaktor, Absynth and Guitar Rig, which allow me to create most of the sounds I'll be using on this album.

• Studio Hardware

I have a great little home studio. For mixing and mastering I use Tannoy Reveal 501a monitors and Audio Technica ATH-M50 headphones. I write, edit, mix and master on a MacBook Pro. I've been working with digital recording for about 12 years now. 

• Akai MPK Pro Mini USB MIDI Keyboard Controller

This keyboard is an abomination. For use on the go, it's passable, but as a main keyboard for composing, it's absolutely terrible. The keys are about 30-40% smaller than standard, making playing in keys other than CMaj and Am a near impossibility. It is definitely the largest bottleneck I have in terms of composing.

 

My Background In Music

When I was 5, I started playing the piano. At 8, I began flute lessons. I took flute lessons, played in the school's band and, there, learned to play several other woodwinds as well. When I turned 14, I began taking guitar lessons and stopped flute lessons. I took guitar lessons from the time I was 14 until I was nearly 19 and went to college. During high school, I played in the school's jazz band as lead guitarist and also played in a few punk and metal bands. I also took 3 years of music theory and composition classes. When I went to college, I began playing more with friends and started up another band with some friends. We mostly played metal, often with an industrial bent, and I learned to play the drums and bass. I also took up the mandolin while in college and started tinkering with digital recording and electronic composition. In college, I also took another couple years of music theory and composition.

In the 7 years since I graduated, I've kept playing guitar and have begun working more with electronic composition. I started out with FruityLoops and Cakewalk, dipped my toes into the hardware side of electronic music with a few synths and progressed into using Propellerheads' Reason software. Since then I've started using Maschine as my primary mode of composition, and I absolutely love it!

Music has been an integral part of my life for as long as I can remember. I've finally gotten to a point where I have the time to really dedicate myself to making an album that I think is worth releasing and that I think a lot of people will really enjoy.

story:
Skandalism is a ska/punk band from the East San Francisco Bay Area. We're a young band, and we've been playing for two and a half years. With no one in the band over 20 years of age, and all of us being full time students, your contribution to this campaign would mean a whole lot to us. Our dreams may be limited by the weight (or lack thereof) of our wallets, but we're determined to make this record happen. And with your help, it will.

 

The goal for this campaign is but a fraction of the total cost for this album, but it's a start. Every cent donated to this campaign goes directly to one of three expenses: Recording and Producing, Artwork, or Mass CD Printing/Burning. Everything will be professionally done, which is why we are asking for your help.

 

Fear not, though, we are not just asking for donations. This will be more of a pre-order platform than one for free money. For a mere $5, you receive a copy of our 16-track, full-length album (electronic copy for non-CA residents). For $10, it comes signed! Check out the sidebar for more perks!

Feel free to check us out on facebook, twitter, and soundcloud

story:
THE STORY

I’ve been playing bass for over 30 years and I’ve always come up with song ideas which didn’t really fit any of my bands. I’ve been dreaming of making a solo release for years but never found the time for it. At the moment I play in two bands: Ensiferum and Metal De Facto, so my schedule is quite busy. Well it was until spring 2020...

Because of the global COVID-19 -crisis I haven’t been able to do either of my professions: touring with my bands nor working as a kindergarten teacher’s substitute. This meant that I had lots of time in my hands and many unfinished songs and obviously a strong lyrical theme from just seeing what’s happening around the world and how people are reacting to this crisis, so I decided to use this time to fulfill the dream of my very first solo release. But I can’t do it alone...

 

 

THE STYLE, THE SONGS, THE THEME

Naturally the style of the songs is quite different from what my bands represent because if these songs would sound like Ensiferum or Metal De Facto there wouldn’t have been any reason not to put them on either of the bands’ albums. 

Short peak into the history:

I have old friends who were very much into electronic music in the 90’s and through them and MTV (yep, it was still playing music videos back in the Middle Ages when I was a kid) I found Prodigy. I still think that ”Music For The Jilted Generation” and ”Fat Of The Land” are extremely good albums. I also had a high school friend who introduced me to bands like Nine Inch Nails, Marilyn Manson, White Zombie, etc. It took quite many years before getting a gear to compose/record anything similar (computers were not that powerful and versatile back then) but the seed was sown. 

I think it was year 2000 when I went to Stockholm to see Mr. Bungle with my friends but besides of going to see a marvelous band, I had a secret agenda: to find Pain’s album ”Rebirth” because I had heard one song from it and liked it a lot, but for some reason I couldn’t find the album from any of Helsinki’s record stores (yep, no streaming services were available yet). Gods of Metal smiled upon me, I found ”Rebirth”-CD and I think this was the album that made me think that it would be great to create this kind of metal one day...

It took more years than I expected but I don’t regret it at all, because now I have a much better vision of what my solo material should sound like. All the songs I have written and recorded with my other bands have tought me a lot and I’ve used all this knowledge on this release. 

 

There will be seven tracks on the EP:

    Invisible Enemy (Intro)

    Away With You

    iConsume

    Untouchable

    Weight Of The World

    Beast Within

    iConsume -acoustic version (Bonus)

 

All songs, all instruments by yours truly.

All lyrics are inspired by global news and people’s reactions during the global pandemic crisis.

Oh, and please be advised that there is some strong language on the EP, so heads-up:

 

 

 

WHY DIGITAL EP?

I believe in quality over quantity in this matter also. These songs were enough to tell the stories I had in my mind for now. I don’t like the idea of putting ”filler songs” on a release just to make it a bit longer.

I chose to release the EP, for now at least, only as a digital version. Why? Because I think most of the people enjoy their music in digital format nowadays and the costs would have gone up if I would have included a physical version of the release (manufacturing, distribution etc.).

 

 

WHY CROWDFUNDING?

I’m a musician. I compose, arrange, write lyrics and I can even record most of my music but I have no skills to mix and master songs, nor any no idea of any graphical design or digital distribution etc. So I need help from professionals to actually release a good quality package. 

The crowdfunding goal is set as low as possible, just enough so I can pay the people who will help me with the release. If the goal is reached, the rest of the funds will help the people involved to carry on during these hard times and enable them to pursue future projects.

Please note that the campaign is quite short so don’t hesitate too long!

 

PERKS

UPDATE! The Girlie T-shirt in XS-size is unfortunately NOT available, even if the link says so. Sorry for this rookie mistake.

 

If you feel like participating to the campaign, there are a lot of different perks you can choose from. Starting from just the digital EP, very trendy ”Away With You” -T-shirt/Girlie, limited to 250 signed album cover -poster, all the way to Skype-call with me (You choose the topic but I’ll have my bass next to me, just in case) and naturally something megalomaniac has to be included in the perk list, so in case you won at the lottery and you already have everything, why not get the ”Ultimate bundle” and get all the perk items and get to sing/play on a song on my NEXT solo release. Yep, now that I got this started, there is no turning back!

 

Here is the ”Away With You” -design of the T-shirt and the Girlie T-shirt. Pretty cool, right?

 

 

TEAM

During these years in music business I have had the honor to meet many extremely talented professionals around the world, so I was sure I could find the right people among them for this release. This would guarantee the seamless communication and the best possible result.

I’m very happy that I was able to convince these wonderful and talented people to help me with the EP.

 

Mixing and mastering:

Esa Orjatsalo, who has worked (both live and studio) with countless bands like Moonsorrow, Korpiklaani, Shape Of Despair, Ensiferum, Turisas, Die Apocalyptischen Reiter, Finntroll, Kilpi, Twilight Guardians, Teräsbetoni, Tyr, Metal De Facto...

 

The cover and the booklet:

Gyula Havanchák, who has made cover art and booklets for tons of bands like Kreator, Accept, Stratovarius, Wintersun, Ensiferum, Tyr, Grave Digger, Metal De Facto, Destruction...

 

Consulting:

Andy Whittle, who has worked with many bands and he will share his knowledge as a consultant and helps with the distribution

 

Guest Vocals:

Krista, singer/songwriter who was also featured on movie scores and on many metal albums 

 

 

Sami adores Ibanez Instruments, Darkglass Electronics and DR Strings.
story_txt: THE STORYI’ve been playing bass for over 30 years and I’ve always come up with song ideas which didn’t really fit any of my bands. I’ve been dreaming of making a solo release for years but never found the time for it. At the moment I play in two bands: Ensiferum and Metal De Facto, so my schedule is quite busy. Well it was until spring 2020...Because of the global COVID-19 -crisis I haven’t been able to do either of my professions: touring with my bands nor working as a kindergarten teacher’s substitute. This meant that I had lots of time in my hands and many unfinished songs and obviously a strong lyrical theme from just seeing what’s happening around the world and how people are reacting to this crisis, so I decided to use this time to fulfill the dream of my very first solo release. But I can’t do it alone...  THE STYLE, THE SONGS, THE THEMENaturally the style of the songs is quite different from what my bands represent because if these songs would sound like Ensiferum or Metal De Facto there wouldn’t have been any reason not to put them on either of the bands’ albums. Short peak into the history:I have old friends who were very much into electronic music in the 90’s and through them and MTV (yep, it was still playing music videos back in the Middle Ages when I was a kid) I found Prodigy. I still think that ”Music For The Jilted Generation” and ”Fat Of The Land” are extremely good albums. I also had a high school friend who introduced me to bands like Nine Inch Nails, Marilyn Manson, White Zombie, etc. It took quite many years before getting a gear to compose/record anything similar (computers were not that powerful and versatile back then) but the seed was sown. I think it was year 2000 when I went to Stockholm to see Mr. Bungle with my friends but besides of going to see a marvelous band, I had a secret agenda: to find Pain’s album ”Rebirth” because I had heard one song from it and liked it a lot, but for some reason I couldn’t find the album from any of Helsinki’s record stores (yep, no streaming services were available yet). Gods of Metal smiled upon me, I found ”Rebirth”-CD and I think this was the album that made me think that it would be great to create this kind of metal one day...It took more years than I expected but I don’t regret it at all, because now I have a much better vision of what my solo material should sound like. All the songs I have written and recorded with my other bands have tought me a lot and I’ve used all this knowledge on this release.  There will be seven tracks on the EP:    Invisible Enemy (Intro)    Away With You    iConsume    Untouchable    Weight Of The World    Beast Within    iConsume -acoustic version (Bonus) All songs, all instruments by yours truly.All lyrics are inspired by global news and people’s reactions during the global pandemic crisis.Oh, and please be advised that there is some strong language on the EP, so heads-up:   WHY DIGITAL EP?I believe in quality over quantity in this matter also. These songs were enough to tell the stories I had in my mind for now. I don’t like the idea of putting ”filler songs” on a release just to make it a bit longer.I chose to release the EP, for now at least, only as a digital version. Why? Because I think most of the people enjoy their music in digital format nowadays and the costs would have gone up if I would have included a physical version of the release (manufacturing, distribution etc.).  WHY CROWDFUNDING?I’m a musician. I compose, arrange, write lyrics and I can even record most of my music but I have no skills to mix and master songs, nor any no idea of any graphical design or digital distribution etc. So I need help from professionals to actually release a good quality package. The crowdfunding goal is set as low as possible, just enough so I can pay the people who will help me with the release. If the goal is reached, the rest of the funds will help the people involved to carry on during these hard times and enable them to pursue future projects.Please note that the campaign is quite short so don’t hesitate too long! PERKSUPDATE! The Girlie T-shirt in XS-size is unfortunately NOT available, even if the link says so. Sorry for this rookie mistake. If you feel like participating to the campaign, there are a lot of different perks you can choose from. Starting from just the digital EP, very trendy ”Away With You” -T-shirt/Girlie, limited to 250 signed album cover -poster, all the way to Skype-call with me (You choose the topic but I’ll have my bass next to me, just in case) and naturally something megalomaniac has to be included in the perk list, so in case you won at the lottery and you already have everything, why not get the ”Ultimate bundle” and get all the perk items and get to sing/play on a song on my NEXT solo release. Yep, now that I got this started, there is no turning back! Here is the ”Away With You” -design of the T-shirt and the Girlie T-shirt. Pretty cool, right?  TEAMDuring these years in music business I have had the honor to meet many extremely talented professionals around the world, so I was sure I could find the right people among them for this release. This would guarantee the seamless communication and the best possible result.I’m very happy that I was able to convince these wonderful and talented people to help me with the EP. Mixing and mastering:Esa Orjatsalo, who has worked (both live and studio) with countless bands like Moonsorrow, Korpiklaani, Shape Of Despair, Ensiferum, Turisas, Die Apocalyptischen Reiter, Finntroll, Kilpi, Twilight Guardians, Teräsbetoni, Tyr, Metal De Facto... The cover and the booklet:Gyula Havanchák, who has made cover art and booklets for tons of bands like Kreator, Accept, Stratovarius, Wintersun, Ensiferum, Tyr, Grave Digger, Metal De Facto, Destruction... Consulting:Andy Whittle, who has worked with many bands and he will share his knowledge as a consultant and helps with the distribution Guest Vocals:Krista, singer/songwriter who was also featured on movie scores and on many metal albums   Sami adores Ibanez Instruments, Darkglass Electronics and DR Strings.

story:
The Story:

"All In Your Mind" by ParkerFoti is the story of a delusional guy living his dreams of success as a rapper.  Watch as the story of the song unfolds through social media, transporting you all over florida from scene to scene! 




Parker Foti already has made a splash in the music world and social media. Now he's taking the show to Theaters, Vimeo, Youtube and VEVO!

https://soundcloud.com/parker_foti/all-in-your-mind

http://www.vevo.com/artist/parker-foti

This video is going to be an incredible, yet challenging production with beautiful cars, sexy people, huge boats and unique shots all over the city of MIAMI

Our goal:

is to to transport you into the day-dreaming mind of Parker Foti.


What We Need & What You Get:

Through our collaboration with film students from University of Miami we are going to get the right equipment we need. Although, there are always ways we could improve our production with equipment that will need to be purchased. There are also a few locations that we think would make this music video great, but that costs money too. 

We need to buy necessary misc. on-set necessities, and of course we would like to provide food for our crew and extras during long shooting days in the hot Miami sun.


See the sidebar for an amazing list of perks you can get for donating to us!

The Impact You Make:

Parker Foti has been pouring his all into creating a sick auditory experience for you.

Now, he is teaming up with Product Productions to create an awesome visual experience with all of your help! Not only will you be donating to our video specifically, but you will be apart of Parker Foti's future career! 

Take a look at Product Production's first short film "Checked Out"  https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=oQMwLw1rJq4

Meet The Crew!

Allison Copquin is a Senior at Ithaca College studying Television and Radio. She has a concentration in media production, with a heavy interest in documentary. Allison has produced 2 short fiction films including Product Production's "Checked Out", and directed two non-fiction short documentaries including "Toy Stories" and "Something About Brazos". Allison used to produce music videos for fun and is really excited to be producing and managing this project! -PRODUCER/PRODUCTION MANAGER-

Justin Snow is a senior Television Radio major, at Ithaca College in New York. He concentrates in media production, and audio production as well. Justin has written and directed four short films, including Product Productions: "Checked Out." Justin also worked with Viacom and Smart Entertainment in Los Angeles last summer, and cannot wait to go back! He is also pumped to work with Parker Foti and Product Productions on this amazing video! - DIRECTOR/WRITER-


Ben is a junior at Ithaca College studying Film and Photography with a legal studies minor.  Ben has worked on several school films in various positions such as producer, director, gaffer and director of photography.  This past summer Ben worked with a photographer who specialized in car shows and weddings. This summer he plans on studying in LA through Ithaca College where he will be interning and taking classes. -DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY-

Ian is a senior at Ithaca College studying Television Radio with a concentration in Media Production and a minor in Philosophy.  Ian has directed, produced and been crew on a number of student films.  Ian spent his summer in Los Angeles working at National Picture Show Entertainment, a development and production company in Santa Monica.  There he helped to produce multiple films and television programs for major networks and international audiences. -PRODUCER/WRITER-

For the past eight years, Victoria Kohl has been committed to film–always eager to learn new aspects of it and develop her own individual style. A current junior at the University of Miami, she's majoring in Motion Pictures and minoring in Music Business, Electronic Media, and Marketing. She hopes to master media beyond filmmaking, breaking into the industry as a media specialist one day–creating inspiring and uplifting content in the process.- PRODUCER/LOCATION SCOUT-

Wendell is a senior at Ithaca College studying documentary studies and production. 

He recently interned at Robert Kenner Films in Los Angeles and plans to continue working in the documentary field after he graduates. Wendell is excited to be editing this music video and working with the rest of Product Productions.

story:
ED MONDO:


Diana Tejera -cantautrice- (dianatejera.com) ed Ersilia Prosperi -trombettista ed ideatrice di OU (oumusic.org).
Ed MONDO è la comunanza di fluttuazioni emotive e psichiche che ha permesso ai nostri ,apparentemente inconciliabili, mondi sonori e creativi di unirsi in un nuovo, fresco, autentico, unico e compatto universo: ED MONDO.

Le canzoni che faranno parte del disco sono 10 stagioni interiori ispirate agli eventi appena passati e alle cronache funamboliche di quotidianità vissute durante la scrittura degli stessi.

ED MONDO è più di un progetto musicale

è un laboratorio per la ricerca e la promozione di 10 elaborazioni resilienti di:


1.   ossessività
2.   frustrazione/megalomania
3.   monotonia/noia
4.   omologazione/vanità
5.   eccesso di delicatezza/insicurezza
6.   struggimento/mancanza
7.   ibriditudine/omologazione
8.   gelosia/poliamore
9.   frustrazione sessuale
10. eccesso di entusiasmo/maniacalità

Consigliamo la co-produzione di questo disco per poter ritemprare la coscienza collettiva attraverso le 10 stagioni di ED MONDO.



PER REALIZZARE QUESTO OBIETTIVO ABBIAMO BISOGNO DI AIUTO.
ABBIAMO DECISO DI REGISTRARE IL DISCO CON LA COLLABORAZIONE DELLA NOTA POLISTRUMENTISTA, COMPOSITRICE E PRODUTTRICE AMY DENIO (THE TIPTONS, KULTUR SHOCK, OU) A SEATTLE.
PERCIO' L'AVVENTURA DI ED MONDO TRASLOCHERA' MOMENTANEAMENTE  OLTREOCEANO.

CON IL VOSTRO AIUTO POTREMO FINANZIARE LA REGISTRAZIONE, IL MIX, IL MASTERING, LA STAMPA E PARTE DELLA PROMOZIONE PER L'USCITA DEL DISCO.

CI SONO DEI PREMI PER VOI!

CARI AMICI DI ED MONDO PER RICAMBIARE IL VOSTRO SOSTEGNO ABBIAMO PENSATO ALCUNI SIMPATICI PREMI TRA CUI POTETE SCEGLIERE IN BASE AL VOSTRO CONTRIBUTO. LI TROVATE NELLA PAGINA DEI "PERKS".

CO-PRODURRE E' FACILE: BASTA AVERE UN CONTO PAY PAL COLLEGATO ALLA PROPRIA CARTA DI CREDITO O ALLE CARTE PREPAGATE. APRIRLO E' FACILE: (https://cms.paypal.com/it/cgi-bin/marketingweb?...)

story:
What this is...

The Summers Case is a chamber opera in one act, with a corresponding after-school residency that focuses on using opera to teach literary, critical thinking, self-awareness and problem solving skills to elementary aged children. The workshop will be ran by a small group of conservatory musicians, and will be brought to different locations in the Boston metro area. 

The opera’s plot highlights issues related to the American foster care system—its crumbling infrastructure and racial and gender inequality. The residency will take place in the spring of 2016, followed by a full performance of the chamber opera at the New England Conservatory (NEC) in May of 2016.

Both the the music and libretto are written by Sonnet Swire, a current senior studying composition with Michael Gandolfi and John Heiss, with a concentration in Music-in-Education, at the New England Conservatory in Boston. At age 21, Sonnet has had her work performed in the U.S., Canada, and Europe, in locations ranging from community outreach programs at public libraries to top tier American orchestras.

Sonnet's introduction to music was through the selfless acts of music lovers who volunteered their time to teach music basics to third graders through maracas and tambourines. Without this, Sonnet wouldn't have pursued her interest in music into middle school where she played tuba of all instruments. The diligence, work ethic, and critical thinking skills that came with learning an instrument transferred to Sonnet's other studies, and within a year she was reading at grade level after struggling with reading up until this point. 

This is why musical outreach is so important to Sonnet; she believes music is a versatile tool for not only enjoying music, but also teaching other subjects and life skills.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of $1,500 will go towards...

  • Supplies like paper, pencils, and a boombox for the children taking part in the residency
  • Props for the performance
  • Printing of the score, parts, posters, and programs
  • Technical and audio expenses like recordings of the performance and photography of both the opera performance and residency process

As a thank-you for your contributions, check out the perk section where gifts are listed for each amount that is donated!

The Impact

Your contribution will help the Boston community by...

  • Exposing underprivileged children to the versatile craft of music
  • Bringing awareness to the American Foster System, a system that is neglected and forgotten by the general populace
  • Teaching experience for young music professionals about to enter the work force

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, we get it, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this project by using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Support your local musicians and music education programs!

story:
UPDATE AUGUST 12: 

Facebook Event
Discord Link

The crowdfunding campaign for our forthcoming BluRay/DVD ends in just a few days and we reached the goal! THANK YOU, WE DID IT!!! We want to celebrate this success with you by using Discord, where we can talk with you and give you the opportunity to ask us questions! 

The event starts at 8 PM CET on the 16th of August!


UPDATE JULY 30: 


UPDATE JULY 27:

This week we have been very busy and we have something very exciting to share with you. Here is the first artwork concept for the release from our designer. It is important to note that this is not the final version and can be subject to major change.

Also, it is important to note that the release is not titled “Live”. We still have not decided on the title yet. We are open to your input, so feel free to add your suggestion and/or your thoughts about the concept art in the comment section on the campaign site! 

UPDATE JULY 16:

Already nearing 25%, in one day, wow!! Thank you everyone! Also, we've got messages asking about the shirt sizes, we offer S to XXXL! This way we hope to make everyone happy! Also we will mail everybody after this campaign with a survey to give their preference in shirt size and also version of the release (BluRay or DVD). If you have any more questions, please reach out to us and we will help you asap!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Hello there! We're Circus Maximus, a progressive metal band from Norway. On February 6th of 2016 we celebrated the release of our latest studio album 'HAVOC' with a party at the famous Rockefeller in Oslo, with a live production that involved pyrotechnics, sparks, and a really big light rig.

We invested a lot into this show to make it one of the most memorable nights in Circus Maximus history. We want to share this night with the world so we recorded it with multiple high definition cameras for a high quality release both on BluRay and DVD, together with 2 CDs.


However, due to all the investments and money needed to do everything this, we want you to join us in this journey to bring out our first proper live release. This is why we’re launching this crowdfunding campaign, to make this live release a reality and to give you all exclusive extras and nice goodies in return. We plan to add special extras like behind-the-scenes footage of the show, our latest music video and hopefully more as this campaign progresses!

We know that the prices are relatively high, especially if you live outside of Europe. However, as we have to handle shipping from Norway, the costs are also very high., we hope to compensate for the price with all the extras we provide and through your participation in this project you’ll get to see this coming to fruition with us. we want everyone to be equal and have shipping included in all the prices, so people from other regions won’t pay nearly twice the amount for shipping. We’re all one big family anyway!



PERKS

*With the meet and greet and after show passes, travel and tickets are not included.


SETLIST


PROGRESS

So where are we currently in the project and when do we plan to release it to all of you and ship everything? As the show was in February, we've had some time to already work on this live release. Audio mix is currently in progress and we are also looking to create a 5.1 audio mix. On top of that video editing will start soon. The song from our next studio album is also being recorded in these weeks and will be prepared. This means that we want everything surrounding this project be finished at November at latest, to give us some space to optimize and work out the small kinks. Then the release date we are looking for February 2017. This is to give the distributor (Frontiers Records) the time to produce and distribute the release in time and to give some time for marketing and promo. We are trying to get everything to you, as funders, earlier than the release date.

BUDGET

We’re very aware that you’re putting your own hard earned money into this project, so we believe you deserve to know what we will do with the money. Above you can see how the money that is contributed will be spent.. Most of the money goes to video editing, as editing high definition video from multiple cameras is not only a huge undertaking in terms of size but also requires a lot of meticulous work to achieve the best result. Together with audio they are the biggest parts of this project as they make up the core of the product and we want to release something of high quality, which is also the least you all deserve.


most of the other costs go towards the production of the physical product and also the specific unique and exclusive perks meant for all of you. As the campaign continues and after it ends, we will reveal more and more of final designs and more on everything and how things are going in general. However, of course, if we reach our goal quickly, we will come up with stretch goals!


TOUR DATES

(more dates to be added)


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Of course a project of this magnitude comes with its challenges and risks. The first and maybe most important would be that the money might run out. However, with our experience releasing 'Live In Japan' and having the team of Pagan's Mind supporting us, whom successfully crowdfunded their own live BluRay/DVD, we are confident we can get through this without too many hiccoughs . Other than that there are possibilities of delays, unexpected errors, data loss and other things we try to minimize as much as we can even though we can never have 100% control over it all. We will do our best and if something happens we will be open and transparent about it and let you all know, but let's hope that will not need to happen!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the means to join this campaign but still want to support us, you can of course share this campaign with your friends and people you think can help us reach our goal. Feel free to get in touch with us, even if you ideas or critiques, we would love to hear it, as we only want to learn and to improve so we can give the best result we can deliver to all of you to enjoy.
story_txt:
UPDATE AUGUST 12: 

Facebook EventDiscord Link

The crowdfunding campaign for our forthcoming BluRay/DVD ends in just a few days and we reached the goal! THANK YOU, WE DID IT!!! We want to celebrate this success with you by using Discord, where we can talk with you and give you the opportunity to ask us questions! 
The event starts at 8 PM CET on the 16th of August!

UPDATE JULY 30: 



UPDATE JULY 27:

This week we have been very
busy and we have something very exciting to share with you. Here is the first
artwork concept for the release from our designer. It is important to note that this is not the final version and can
be subject to major change.

Also, it is important to note that the release is not titled “Live”. We still have not decided on the title yet. We are open to your input, so feel free to add your suggestion and/or your thoughts about the concept art in the comment section on the campaign site! 


UPDATE JULY 16:
Already nearing 25%, in one day, wow!! Thank you everyone! Also, we've got messages asking about the shirt sizes, we offer S to XXXL! This way we hope to make everyone happy! Also we will mail everybody after this campaign with a survey to give their preference in shirt size and also version of the release (BluRay or DVD). If you have any more questions, please reach out to us and we will help you asap!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hello there! We're Circus Maximus, a progressive metal band from Norway. On February 6th of 2016 we celebrated the release of our latest studio album 'HAVOC' with a party at the famous Rockefeller in Oslo, with a live production that involved pyrotechnics, sparks, and a really big light rig. 
We invested a lot into this show to make it one of the most memorable nights in Circus Maximus history. We want to share this night with the world so we recorded it with multiple high definition cameras for a high quality release both on BluRay and DVD, together with 2 CDs.  




However, due to all the investments and money needed to do everything this, we want you to join us in this journey to bring out our first proper live release. This is why we’re launching this crowdfunding campaign, to make this live release a reality and to give you all exclusive extras and nice goodies in return. We plan to add special extras like behind-the-scenes footage of the show, our latest music video and hopefully more as this campaign progresses! We know that the prices are relatively high, especially if you live outside of Europe. However, as we have to handle shipping from Norway, the costs are also very high., we hope to compensate for the price with all the extras we provide and through your participation in this project you’ll get to see this coming to fruition with us. we want everyone to be equal and have shipping included in all the prices, so people from other regions won’t pay nearly twice the amount for shipping. We’re all one big family anyway!







PERKS








*With the meet and greet and after show passes, travel and tickets are not included.
SETLIST





PROGRESS
So where are we currently in the project and when do we plan to release it to all of you and ship everything? As the show was in February, we've had some time to already work on this live release. Audio mix is currently in progress and we are also looking to create a 5.1 audio mix. On top of that video editing will start soon. The song from our next studio album is also being recorded in these weeks and will be prepared. This means that we want everything surrounding this project be finished at November at latest, to give us some space to optimize and work out the small kinks. Then the release date we are looking for February 2017. This is to give the distributor (Frontiers Records) the time to produce and distribute the release in time and to give some time for marketing and promo. We are trying to get everything to you, as funders, earlier than the release date.

BUDGET




 We’re very aware that you’re putting your own hard earned money into this project, so we believe you deserve to know what we will do with the money. Above you can see how the money that is contributed will be spent.. Most of the money goes to video editing, as editing high definition video from multiple cameras is not only a huge undertaking in terms of size but also requires a lot of meticulous work to achieve the best result. Together with audio they are the biggest parts of this project as they make up the core of the product and we want to release something of high quality, which is also the least you all deserve.
most of the other costs go towards the production of the physical product and also the specific unique and exclusive perks meant for all of you. As the campaign continues and after it ends, we will reveal more and more of final designs and more on everything and how things are going in general. However, of course, if we reach our goal quickly, we will come up with stretch goals!




TOUR DATES
(more dates to be added)



 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES


Of course a project of this magnitude comes with its challenges and risks. The first and maybe most important would be that the money might run out. However, with our experience releasing 'Live In Japan' and having the team of Pagan's Mind supporting us, whom successfully crowdfunded their own live BluRay/DVD, we are confident we can get through this without too many hiccoughs . Other than that there are possibilities of delays, unexpected errors, data loss and other things we try to minimize as much as we can even though we can never have 100% control over it all. We will do our best and if something happens we will be open and transparent about it and let you all know, but let's hope that will not need to happen!


    Other Ways You Can Help 

If you don't have the means to join this campaign but still want to support us, you can of course share this campaign with your friends and people you think can help us reach our goal. Feel free to get in touch with us, even if you ideas or critiques, we would love to hear it, as we only want to learn and to improve so we can give the best result we can deliver to all of you to enjoy.

story:
From The Beginning

The Fusion Foundation started in 2014 and was founded by members of the local Columbus, Ohio community. In its first year the non-profit offered several internships, scholarships and launched its biggest event of the year, Fashion Meets Music Festival. This year's festival has a new location and an edgy lineup of musicians plus fashion designers. The festival was created to help support both local and national musicians, fashion designers, models and all students interested in pursuing a career in the arts.

Why We Need YOU To Join Our Movement

Let's face it, there are many hidden issues that students in the arts face. Four of the biggest ones include time, talent, networking, and money. The Fusion Foundation is a non-profit that relies on donations to help provide scholarships, grants, internships, equipment, fabric and several other necessities for those trying to make a name for themselves in "the industry". This year we are looking to double the amount of scholarships and internships we have given in the past but in order to do so we need your help getting there. Did you know the average cost of Art School is $42,000 a year? That's twice the cost of tuition at some state schools and it doesn't include room and board, supplies, books or other school related fees.

How Will The Funds Be Spent

We Want To Reward YOU With Good Music For Helping Us Reward Students: 2017 FMMF Lineup

 

Internship & Scholarship Opportunities

Are you interested in an internship or scholarship opportunity with The Fusion Foundation? If so please join our mailing list and visit our website fusionfoundation.us for more information. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find that you can't contribute financially, you can still help! Please consider spreading our movement and campaign virtually with your friends and family, through Twitter, Instagram and Facebook. Anything you can do to share our story would be greatly appreciated.

story:
Hello...

We're Porch Light Apothecary, a 4-piece indie/rock/americana band from Raleigh, NC. It's been quite a journey since the release of our first studio album in 2016. 

Along the way we've had many ups and downs. The ups have been great, but it seems that the past two years have brought us great struggles within our families and as world citizens. Through those difficult times of darkness we've been able to find light and positivity through writing, shaping, playing and re-shaping new songs. A lot of emotion has been wrapped up in them and we hope that you, too, will find the spacious place to sit with these songs and let them help you to lift whatever weight may be on your heart. 

We recorded the 12 songs for Weight of the Heart with Jeff Crawford at Arbor Ridge Studios in Chapel Hill, NC earlier this year. We were extremely grateful to have some of the area's most talented musicians lend their services on the album. Anne-Claire Niver added vocal accompaniment on three tracks and Autumn Brand played violin on Dark was the Night. Jeff Crawford also added bass and upright bass to a couple tracks, as well as backing vocals on House Burned Down. 

You can help us speed towards our goal by adding a limited-edition screen printed poster by George Hage, a shirt, stickers, buttons, and more. We are very excited about the way this album sounds and can't wait to share it with you.

Porch Light Apothecary (Photo by: Jakob Lagerstedt)

What You Get for Supporting Us

The album is available as a digital download or in CD format. We also have new t-shirts, stickers, and limited edition screen-printed posters designed by George Hage. Keep scrolling for previews and examples! 

George designed the album artwork.  He is still working on the poster design, but they will be 12.5 "x 19" hand screen-printed on quality French paper. We're excited to see it and will update this page when we have an image to share. Here are some examples of his other posters from his website.

Some of George Hage's posters

We've got a new logo! So, we have t-shirts, buttons, and stickers! Leeann Hynes designed the logo, shirts and things which stick.

We're looking forward to seeing this moth out in the wild.

In addition to the items above, we are also once again offering:

  • an original sketch by Brent Jordan,
  • an opportunity to have us come play a show for you,
  • and the opportunity to have us write a song for you.

We had two people purchase the song option during our last campaign and both of those songs (Rachel's Song & Scatter the Dark) made it on this album. No guarantees, but...

Our Bottom Line

Thanks so much for any help you can provide. This album is happening either way, whether we reach our goal or not, but we would prefer to avoid the debt route and have everything paid for up front. If we happen to go beyond our goal, those funds will be used towards our east coast tour following the release and towards additional marketing and publicity to help get these songs out to the world.

We have been able to pay for a large portion of this project with money we've saved from shows and merch sales. But we're running out of funds and need your help to complete this project. We've been able to pay for the recording, mixing, mastering, and artwork, but here's what we still need:

  • CD Production - $1,250
  • Marketing/Publicity - $1,000
  • Indiegogo/PayPal Fees - $250

Our Sincere Gratitude 

Thanks so much, from the bottom of our hearts, to everyone that contributes and supports us in any fashion along this journey down the river...

Please help us by sharing this page

And please, most importantly, be sure to love... love you neighbor, each and every one...

Thank you and we love you all,

Porch Light Apothecary

story:
Introduction

Music is a powerful tool of expression! Music defines us!  Using music in charities isn’t a new concept but a proven successful way of reaching out to a larger audience; to send a message to change the world for the better. With ‘Breaking The Chains’ our message is clear: We will not stand for any kind of child abuse!

Album Teaser


Follow My Way - single video (lyrical video)


Valley Road

 

Our Story

Breaking The Chains (BTC) is an album that unites over 40 of the biggest and best Dutch rock musicians from the 70’s decade through today (Within Temptation, Epica, Ayreon, Delain, Elegy, Kayak, Picture, Textures, Stream of Passion, Vuur, Pain of Salvation, Neal Morse Band, Place Vendome, Patrick Rondat, Asrai + more).

All profits of this amazing album will support the efforts of Bikers Against Child Abuse (B.A.C.A.), who work directly with abused children, to offer them comfort and empowerment when they need it the most. These children need to feel safe again, regain their self-confidence and overcome trust issues. Our goal is to promote awareness for B.A.C.A.’s mission by placing this worthy cause into the spotlight. There are some really big-hearted bikers out there fighting the good fight. B.A.C.A. provides public information on how to be observant for signs of child abuse in your own surroundings; and they are always a call away to help and protect those who cannot help and protect themselves. No child deserves to live in fear!

Our Goal

In order to complete this project we need to raise around €6.500 to cover the production costs of the albums and merchandise. All musicians, producers, photographers and our project team have volunteered their time and talents.  B.A.C.A. is a non-profit organization, so all money will be utilized directly to help the children.  The more we get, the more we can help!  Help us, help them!

What’s in it for you?

We can't do it without you, our beloved fans, so we have many special treats in store for our supporters: Naturally, the album will be a world class rock-album and is already quite unique with all these renowned musicians participating on it. We also offer some very special merchandise and supporter perks that will only be available via the crowdfunding. All supporter’s names will be added to the album artwork and thank-you video at the conclusion of the Crowdfunding.

Risks and challenges

The goals for this project are very realistic and obtainable so we anticipate very low risk as to why this project would not be completed as planned. If we exceed our goal, we can do even more for the children and offer more rewards to you, our supporters. Keep spreading the news and engage everyone around you to join us!

Alternative and additional donation options?

  • On our homepage (www.breakingthechains.nl) we have additional merchandise for sale, ready to be shipped to your home. This merchandise can be purchased via PayPal or bank transfer.
  • Want to support the mission but don't need a perk? Use the "Back It" button to donate an amount of your choice.
  • Use the Social Media-buttons to share and spread this Crowd Funding to all your friends. The more the merrier.
  • We will launch an auction in March with some very unique, one-off music memorabilia such as signed albums, photographs, t-shirts and even an electric guitar signed by all artists. Please return often to our home page and social media for more details and updates about the auctions.
  • You can also support your local B.A.C.A. chapter directly via their home page: www.bacaworld.org

Help us help them!
Together We Are Breaking The Chains of Abuse!

www.breakingthechains.nl

www.facebook.com/breakingthechainsnl

www.twitter.com/BTC-Projects

www.Instagram.com/breakingthechains

story:
The main goal of this project is to record at least 15 or 20 covers of video game soundtracks and upload them to YouTube, Soundcloud and other media sharing sites. That doesn't mean that the main goal is to only do those, after achieving this goal I will continue recording.

In the "why?" of this description you can check the link to my soundclound page, there I have uploaded some covers I made before starting this project. Some of them will be recorded again to improve the overall sound quality of the songs.

What I want is to record songs, but if the funding is enough, I will do my best to record myself in video performing these covers.

Why?

I started recording around 2-3 years ago, but without the proper equipment. Just a cheap audio interface and an electric guitar. You can hear some of the covers I have made in my soundcloud profile. I dont make only video game music covers I have been interested in anime soundtracks lately too.

What I need?

Currently I don't have more than what I started with some years ago. To make this project I will need new instruments like a bass, acoustic (and/or classical) guitar, a midi controller, studio related hardware and software like a microphone, audio interface (and/or mixer), amplification, etc.

Even if the goal is not accomplished I can still work in this project obtaining the essential stuff to work.

What I want?

I have several goals with this project, these are the main goals:

  • Improve as a musician.
  • Invite people to work in their musical projects.

Extra

For other musicians or anyone interested, I work with my arrangements mainly in Guitar Pro 6. I added a perk to get the files I will work with. If you don't have the software, I can export the tracks and send them to you in PDF format.

So, if you like music, video games, both, or just want to see it happen, you are welcome to help me with this project. Also share it with your family and friends. Spread the word and let's make this happen.
:)

story:
The Reason Why We Need Your Help

The cost of game development is expensive, especially for brand new indie studios. We're porting and translating to other regions at the moment but the main barrier is the cost of getting our game rated and also fees to put onto distribution services too. We can either wait until sales pick up on the North America version, but payouts are far out in between, OR we could come to IndieGoGo and have a chance to get it out much sooner and reward people who are interested! 

We are hoping the latter works out so that we can bring PING 1.5+ onto Wii U for EU and Germany. If the funding goes above what we ask for, we could look into other smaller regions or adding new content depending on reception.

We're also working on our Steam Greenlight campaign: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=380660400

Don't forget to peek at the gallery for video and image goodness: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ping-1-5-wii-u-to-europe/x/9804292#gallery

Explanation of Perks

By helping fund this way, you get a chance to have your name featured as a founder in our Founder's Room inside the game! You'll be permanently remembered in PING history as someone who helped us out. Here are a few example pictures of what that looks like.

Accolades

"With 12 worlds filled with puzzles and bosses, there’s never a dull moment-" 8/10 Nintendo World Report 

"Ping 1.5 + is incredibly addictive, has good replay value for completionists, and is hugely satisfying!" 8.5/10 Pure Nintendo 

"If failure was a form of currency then our apartment would be filled with failure currency." 7/10 The Ranting Robots 

"Each level always has something fresh and new to offer that you’ll want to keep playing just to see what kind of curve ball the game will throw at you next." - 8/10 Nintendo Enthusiast 

"PING 1.5+ looks like a Lite Brite™ possessed by an Atari 2600™. And it’s as awesome as it sounds." CGR Undertow 

"I really, really like PING 1.5+. This is the kind of an app like game that works masterfully on the Wii U." - 84/100 Family Friendly Gaming 

"Here is my support and total recommendation for Ping 1.5+!" Fuzzy Wuzzy Games (Armillo) 

"There, I did your review. Now let me have my daughter." 7.5/10 ZyroXZ2

Risks & Challenges

No risks! We've delivered a game already! It's just helping get it into your area!

Share On Social Media

The best way to help us out, besides helping fund our campaign, is sharing on Facebook and Twitter. People respect your opinion the most.
story_txt:
The Reason Why We Need Your Help The cost of game development is expensive, especially for brand new indie studios. We're porting and translating to other regions at the moment but the main barrier is the cost of getting our game rated and also fees to put onto distribution services too. We can either wait until sales pick up on the North America version, but payouts are far out in between, OR we could come to IndieGoGo and have a chance to get it out much sooner and reward people who are interested! 
We are hoping the latter works out so that we can bring PING 1.5+ onto Wii U for EU and Germany. If the funding goes above what we ask for, we could look into other smaller regions or adding new content depending on reception.
We're also working on our Steam Greenlight campaign: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=380660400
Don't forget to peek at the gallery for video and image goodness: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ping-1-5-wii-u-to-europe/x/9804292#gallery

    Explanation of Perks By helping fund this way, you get a chance to have your name featured as a founder in our Founder's Room inside the game! You'll be permanently remembered in PING history as someone who helped us out. Here are a few example pictures of what that looks like.




Accolades

"With 12 worlds filled with puzzles and bosses, there’s never a dull moment-" 8/10 Nintendo World Report "Ping 1.5 + is incredibly addictive, has good replay value for completionists, and is hugely satisfying!" 8.5/10 Pure Nintendo "If failure was a form of currency then our apartment would be filled with failure currency." 7/10 The Ranting Robots "Each level always has something fresh and new to offer that you’ll want to keep playing just to see what kind of curve ball the game will throw at you next." - 8/10 Nintendo Enthusiast "PING 1.5+ looks like a Lite Brite™ possessed by an Atari 2600™. And it’s as awesome as it sounds." CGR Undertow "I really, really like PING 1.5+. This is the kind of an app like game that works masterfully on the Wii U." - 84/100 Family Friendly Gaming "Here is my support and total recommendation for Ping 1.5+!" Fuzzy Wuzzy Games (Armillo) "There, I did your review. Now let me have my daughter." 7.5/10 ZyroXZ2

    Risks & Challenges No risks! We've delivered a game already! It's just helping get it into your area!
    Share On Social Media The best way to help us out, besides helping fund our campaign, is sharing on Facebook and Twitter. People respect your opinion the most.

story:
TO ALL THE MISFITS:

Ever since I was a baby drag queen I never obsessed over the usual suspects of pop princesses and divas.  Instead I was fascinated by a strange cross-dressing, sweet transvestite mad scientist, a German punk rock transsexual, a crazy foul mouthed larger than life drag queen from Baltimore.  This album has been years and years in the making.  It is finally coming to life, but I need you!  I promise you a album full of love, glitter induced sweat and raw emotion.  I'm going to lay myself out on this album- bare. 

I named this album THE FIRE because of the experiences I've been through.  I lessons I've learned about not retreating from fear, to turn those negative energies into fuel to propel yourself from a safe place into a place unknown.  To turn your burnt battle wounds into badges of honor and to be reborn, much like a phoenix.

I dedicate this album to all of you who have stuck by me and believed in me when it otherwise was a dark work.  You are THE FIRE that shined a light when it was otherwise dark.  I am beyond thankful.

-Mimi

BIG RISKS, BIG BUDGET!

Because we are not using computer synth stuff on this album and its is all real live musicians, the cost sky-rockets:

  • Every musician has to be paid
  • Studio sessions are more expensive
  • It takes a lot more time to do it real and right.

BIG REWARDS

However, because we are doing this 100% real- the sound of the music is so much better!  You're going to experience real in your face music full of emotion and personality.

    WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS GO TOWARDS:

    Here are just some of the examples of how your money is being used!  I've already spent about 15,000- but need another 10,000 to make it come to life!

    • Studio Time
    • Musicians time and talent
    • Creating actual physical CDs
    • Hiring a publicist so we can get the word out
    • Making a music video to help promote the album
    • AND much more!

    All of that- before I even can think about making money from this.  I am doing this for my love and my gut telling me I must do this!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Give what you can, and what you are comfortable with!  EVERY dollar is valuable!

    IF you can't give right now.  Its totally okay.  Your support can be shown just by sharing this campaign!  You might not be able to give, but maybe someone you know can!!!

    I CAN NOT SAY IT ENOUGH.  I AM BEYOND THANKFUL!  THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!!

    LETS MAKE MUSIC!
    -mimi
