story:
Three Sentences.

Music, musicians and listeners are what we call our community and inspiration. We believe that without any of those three, our art does not exist. We are thankful and excited that through the support of our community and YOU, we will accomplish our dream!

Three Stories.

Garrett Croxon, Seattle native, has been drumming for over 20 years. Showcasing clubs long before he was of age, Garrett often had to wait outside until showtime. Swagger, pinpoint accuracy and intense focus have made him a hot commodity in Seattle. He has played with the likes of Fleet Foxes, C'est la Mort, Erik Blood and The Little Penguins. 

On bass we have Jeff Anderson, also from Seattle. Jeff and Garrett held down the rhythm section for the celebrated pop group Tea Cozies. With experience over a wide spectrum of different genres, Jeff employs a real wisdom on the low end. He recently peeled the frets off his Jazz Bass, embracing the direction of the new album. 

Jon Atkins grew up in Riverside, California. He is the songwriter, singer and guitarist for Moon Dial. He brings with him to Seattle the stories and songs of a life in debt to his art. Jon has been blessed to write and perform original songs for over 15 years. His gift for crafting music and poetry is unquestionable, and his writing is prolific. His lyrics often carry a message of confronting the past, redemption in love and, of course, feeling like a crazy person. Within a few months of moving to Seattle in 2013, Jon met Jeff and Garrett, who have helped him bring his vision to a new level.

Write. Perform. Record.

"Jon is a brilliant lyricist who, for being such a fantastic songwriter with a commanding voice and special presence, is one of the most humble and self-aware musicians I've ever met."  -Ahn Quach, Seattle promoter

We hold each other's stories and talents in high regard. This mutual respect has made the last year and a half of playing together a real joy. The hang is strong and the songs are strong. For us, playing music is a gift. We show our gratitude by pouring every drop of passion into creating the best album we can make. 

"Moon Dial represents three facets of Capitol Hill’s music scene at this moment in time: Impassioned art-making, the importance of connections and fresh roots in the city’s changing landscape...[Jon's] receptivity reflects in the songs he pens for Moon Dial through cerebral lyrics and open-faced jazz aches." -AJ Dent, Capitol Hill Times

Here's how we make a great album: Start with great songs (Jon). Embellish them with beautiful arrangements (Jeff, Garrett). Discover a meaningful narrative and express it thoughtfully throughout the album (Jon, Jeff, Garrett). Find a stunning, romantic space to capture the record (The Unknown Studio in Anacortes, WA). Hire a recording genius to produce the album (Nicholas Wilbur). Then we will have a great album: an honest, original, beautiful work of music. 

"Moon Dial’s twists and turns inspire the listener to pay attention, feeling the way the road changes while listening intently to every word." -Jessica Price, City Arts Magazine

Now remember: our mission is to write, perform and record great music. We're almost there.

What We Need. What You Get.

Let's look at the costs of making and distributing a record:

  • Tracking/Mixing (our producer)                                                                                $3000
  • Publishing (Seattle PR)                                                                                                 $3000
  • Visual Arts (Ulysses Curry and Alex Reynoso, for the hours                                      of hard work they spend to make everything pretty)                                         $1300
  • Merchandise (the perks!!)                                                                                            $1200
  • Mastering                                                                                                                           $1000
  • Studio Musicians (playing instruments we can't)                                                  $500
  • All Together Now!!                                                                                                      $10,000 

This is a great time for you to take a minute to review the wonderful array of 'perks' we have prepared on the left side of the screen. Also check out the gallery tab at the top of the page for images of the 'perks.' We are not trying to sell you stuff. We want to say thank you with a gift for your support. Every perk has been filled with our love and thankfulness.

The Challenge.

We understand that there is a possibility that we may not meet all of our goals. Regardless of how much support we accept, there are three essential steps that we will accomplish:

1. Recording

2. Mixing

3. Mastering

Every other goal is essential to distributing our music to our community, to you.

Thank You.

Don't have the ends to throw down? We're musicians, we get it. However, if you are moved by our efforts there is a cost-free way to help: share our campaign with your family, friends and everybody else you know. Much love and respect,

-Jeff, Jon and Garrett

story:
(Italian)

Sono passati più di 2 anni dall'uscita di "LEARN TO LOVE" ora è il momento di pensare ad un nuovo album! Il terzo e completiamo la Trilogia!

Per questo mio terzo album solista "autoprodotto" sto avendo l'onore di collaborare con grandissimi musicisti italiani e d'oltre oceano. Con la mia nuova band, gli "Hungry Bears", lo scorso Dicembre siamo andati una settimana a Pennabilli nell'alta Valmarecchia in Emilia Romagna, e rinchiusi tra le mura dello splendido Teatro Vittoria abbiamo dato vita a questa nuova creatura, coadiuvati dall'espertissimo Ing.re del suono Franco Fucili abbiamo registrato i 10 brani che faranno parte di questo nuovo album, un album con brani & sonorità totalmente diverse dai miei precedenti prodotti, un album elettrico, pimpante, chitarristico, dove la giusta dose di distorsione si rivelerà l'arma in più del futuro nato in casa Waldon! Ora rimane solo l'ultima fase, una delle fasi più importanti nella realizzazione di un disco, il mixaggio ed il mastering finale. Anche questa volta, come precedentemente per "Learn To Love", sarà Kevin Salem a seguire mixaggio & mastering finale di questo disco, direttamente dal suo studio di Woodstock (New York), l'ennesima garanzia di qualità & professionalità!

Entrando a far parte di questa campagna con un contributo a vostra scelta, mi aiuterete nel portare a termine quest' ultima ONOROSISSIMA fase, velocizzando e anticipando i tempi di realizzazione del disco!! 

Con il vostro aiuto potrete così realizzare un mio sogno e farne poi parte in prima persona!!

___________________________________________________________________________

Che cosa si riceve partecipando al progetto

In cambio del vostro pre-ordine e del vostro contributo economico io vi fornirò aggiornamenti dallo studio di registrazione, anteprime ed informazioni. Inoltre, vi farò avere il mio nuovo album alcune settimane prima del suo lancio ufficiale e dell'emissione delle copie nel mercato internazionale.

Ho anche alcune ricompense esclusive per voi, come il CD autografato o una menzione speciale nel booklet dell'album con un mio ringraziamento.
Se può interessavi un concerto live in casa vostra per un numero selezionato di amici intimi, c'è poi anche un pacchetto disponibile per questo progetto speciale.

Come partecipare alla mia campagna di raccolta fondi

Si può contribuire iscrivendosi gratuitamente a IndieGoGo tramite l'indirizzo e-mail o l'account di Facebook. Per il pagamento si può utilizzare Paypal, se non disponete di un conto Paypal, cliccate su Paypal.com per ottenerne uno.

Matt W.

_____________________________________________________________________________
(English)

Now is the time to think about a new album!!

For this third solo album self produced , currently being recorded, I'm having the honor to collaborate with some of the best musicians in italy,and other important american musicians some of whom I admired for many years.

If you choose to be part of my project with a contribution of your choice, you will receive a VAST CHOICE OF BENEFITS, some of which HAVE NOT BEEN OFFERED YET by other artists.

This new album will be recorded in Italy and mixed in New York and its release date is scheduled for March 2017

With your help I'll make my Dream real, and you'll be a part of it!!

___________________________________________________________________________

What is in it for you when you contribute?

In return for your pre-order and contribution I will give you updates from the studio, previews and info. Also I will make sure you get the new album weeks before the rest of the world will get their physical copy.

I have also some special other items you can order with your contribution, like signed CD's, a special credit in my album booklet and a personal thank you note written by me. 

If you want me to play in your own living room for a select number of close friends, there is also a special package available for this special project.

How do you contribute to my campaign?

You can contribute by signing up at indiegogo with your email address or with your Facebook account. Payments are done by using your Paypal account. If you have no Paypal account, check Paypal.com to get one (or the one in your country ususally Paypal + country, Paypal.it, Paypal.co.uk etc)

Matt W.

story:
Short Summary

Meeting the entities:

Resulting from a horrific reincarnation of a regulator calico emerged mastermind, vocalist, guitarist, bassist Diggy Kat (Gemini), who also won 2013 Best Radio DJ Award from Artists in Music Awards.

Conjuring the image of guitarist, bassist, vocalist Bianx (Gemini) is a spell of mixing glitter with the feeling of smelling a blood red rose for the first time.

Born from the malevolent things in the enchanting forest where the rainbow glows came forth drummer Britt Daskey (Scorpio).

Vufcup has been working on our 7th album, music videos, a mini movie and soundtrack and will be submitting videos to more music/film festivals.

Vufcup has appeared in Santa Clarita Gazette, I'm Music Magazine, Killerbeat Mag among other outlets. Have had songs in rotation all over the world, including making the top 20 charts in Australia with 3 different singles. Our video for Home reached Semi-Finalist at LA Cinefest.

Our campaign is just as important to us as it is for all of our fans that have been supporting us. Continuously building steps to get to the next level, this campaign is an entire staircase for us, but what is a staircase without the proper support? A mess on the floor is the appropriate answer.

Each quirky perk you choose to pick and add to your life allows us one easier step further into world domination. We're all in this together so let us help you help us help you in this fun and creative exclusive experience designed to promote a healthy heart, increased circulation, improved mental capacity and being able to smell the color 9 (this one is not yet FDR approved, but Eleanor says it's all right)

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're starting with $1,000 as our goal with potential of exceeding it. These earnings will go into the recording,mixing,mastering,distribution of our 7th album and the 4 accompanying music videos, our mini movie and editing and accompanying soundtrack. 

To help us reach and exceed our goal we have provided 18 quirky perks that transport you directly in the Vufcup universe.

 

The Impact

Songwriting integrity is important to us, this is why Vufcup is relatable on multi-levels. Always on the forefront of expression, Vufcup shows no mercy when tackling subjects on spiritual growth, coping with grief, handling negative energies and shaking up the system. We strongly believe the more people we reach with our music the better mechanisms people will have to live life to their fullest. What is it about music that make people want to own and experience it? maybe it's the therapeutic tendencies.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you share with 5 people and ask each one to share with 5 people that love the type of music and entertainment we provide, we could spread this like wildfire. There's honestly something for everyone. Thank you for doing what you can to help us succeed =)

there's also the Indiegogo share tools at your disposal, so let not them get rusty!

Resulting from a horrific reincarnation of a regulator calico emerged mastermind, vocalist, guitarist, bassist Diggy Kat (Gemini), who also won 2013 Best Radio DJ Award from Artists in Music Awards.
Conjuring the image of guitarist, bassist, vocalist Bianx (Gemini) is a spell of mixing glitter with the feeling of smelling a blood red rose for the first time.
Born from the malevolent things in the enchanting forest where the rainbow glows came forth drummer Britt Daskey (Scorpio).
Vufcup has been working on our 7th album, music videos, a mini movie and soundtrack and will be submitting videos to more music/film festivals.
Vufcup has appeared in Santa Clarita Gazette, I'm Music Magazine, Killerbeat Mag among other outlets. Have had songs in rotation all over the world, including making the top 20 charts in Australia with 3 different singles. Our video for Home reached Semi-Finalist at LA Cinefest.
Our campaign is just as important to us as it is for all of our fans that have been supporting us. Continuously building steps to get to the next level, this campaign is an entire staircase for us, but what is a staircase without the proper support? A mess on the floor is the appropriate answer.
Each quirky perk you choose to pick and add to your life allows us one easier step further into world domination. We're all in this together so let us help you help us help you in this fun and creative exclusive experience designed to promote a healthy heart, increased circulation, improved mental capacity and being able to smell the color 9 (this one is not yet FDR approved, but Eleanor says it's all right)
 

What We Need & What You Get
We're starting with $1,000 as our goal with potential of exceeding it. These earnings will go into the recording,mixing,mastering,distribution of our 7th album and the 4 accompanying music videos, our mini movie and editing and accompanying soundtrack. 
To help us reach and exceed our goal we have provided 18 quirky perks that transport you directly in the Vufcup universe.
 
The Impact
Songwriting integrity is important to us, this is why Vufcup is relatable on multi-levels. Always on the forefront of expression, Vufcup shows no mercy when tackling subjects on spiritual growth, coping with grief, handling negative energies and shaking up the system. We strongly believe the more people we reach with our music the better mechanisms people will have to live life to their fullest. What is it about music that make people want to own and experience it? maybe it's the therapeutic tendencies.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you share with 5 people and ask each one to share with 5 people that love the type of music and entertainment we provide, we could spread this like wildfire. There's honestly something for everyone. Thank you for doing what you can to help us succeed =)
there's also the Indiegogo share tools at your disposal, so let not them get rusty!

story:
HELLO FRIENDS, SUPPORTERS OF ART AND MUSIC!

Artists these days (maybe always?) have a difficult time making a living - but we believe what we do is important. Do you? The sensitivity of collaboration, the beauty of air through a reed or a bow on a string, the poignant translation of a traditional text set to melody, a belief in the power of sound. This is what we do as AALLOTAR. 

We hope you will help us fund the final steps of ' Ameriikan laulu ' album. If you are unfamiliar with our work, please watch the video or listen to our 2014 'In Transit' album available on our Aallotar website. We believe 'Ameriikan laulu' represents us even more and we are excited to get it in your hands! (Read more about Aallotar below)

WHY MAKE AN ALBUM?

I suppose you know that 'average' artists make next to nothing from streaming services. Like, we see almost NO money. And we do this for a living. As Aallotar, we love to perform live for audiences, and generally, audiences want to take our music home with them. So we make CDs so they can sit in a chair, listen to the studio album, read the lyrics, have their own experience in private. And we make more money to pay our rent. That's why! 

SO...

Pre-order the album to help us finish the album! To mix, master, print, and promote. We think and hope the album will inspire, soothe, transport. Could you regret that?

Thank you / Kiitos!
Sara & Teija

P.S. If you don't have funds right now to contribute, no problem! But please share with those who do - use the Indigogo share buttons to the right of the video above.

 

ABOUT AALLOTAR

"Extra elusive appeal, its lightness of touch and melodiousness of repertoire matching the skill of the musicians." fRoots. 

'Fresh, skillful and imaginative playing.' Kansanmusiikki (Finland)

Aallotar is a transatlantic collaboration (Sara Pajunen, violin & voice & effects / Teija Niku, accordion & voice) that uses Finnish and Finnish-American music as a starting point for an original 'chamber-folk’ style.

Ancestors of Sara Pajunen and Teija Niku lived within hours of each other in western Finland - speaking the same language, playing the same music, living the same culture. In the late 19th century, Pajunen's ancestors emigrated to northern Minnesota; Niku's family remained in Finland. Today, they explore a common heritage in Finnish folk music, even as they create new sounds that reflect their contemporary cultures and various interests. Pajunen is a violinist, and Niku and accordionist; their lithe instrumentals and beautiful vocal harmonies in both Finnish and English demonstrate how gracefully traditional and modern folk music can speak together. 
Aallotar has performed throughout the United States and at European festivals, including Kaustinen Folk Music Festival and Sounds of the North in Gdansk, Poland. They released their debut recording 'In Transit' in 2014 and will release 'Ameriikan laulu' in spring 2018.

story:
I want you think for a second. Think back to that moment or moments in your life's story, to where you were at the end of your rope. Maybe your marriage was on the rocks or you had to figure out how you were gonna pay to fix your car, or maybe you had  been fired from a job.  

What happened? 

Or, perhaps maybe the more pertinent question is: 

How did God provide?  

  In the Old Testament, the people of Israel would erect these monuments called "Ebenezer stones", as a symbol and  as a reminder of how God provided or came through for them. 

We all have "Ebenezer stone" moments in our own lives that we can look back on and be reminded that God is faithful, and that reminder causes us to be thankful.  

This is the journey to the heart of worship. 

 

 The Story  

Hi, My name  is Erik and I'm here to talk about the "Join The Song : vol 2" worship album Project. 

This album will be the second installment of a 2-part worship project that I have been doing in conjunction with Brothers McClurg and Old Bear Studio.  

We produced part one back in the fall of 2016 and released it early 2017, with great success and building momentum.  

Our Purpose for creating this worship project was to write songs and music that spoke to the churches in my area (Upstate NY and the Northeastern US) in such a way that would focus on connecting with the unique culture of its people.  

As a people/culture, us northerners tend to lean on the aggressive side as far as our approach to life and other people. We are generally a sarcastic and intelligent people, who take pride in our academics, health care, manufacturing and research. We are a overly practical people. 

Most people in the Albany NY area go to church not necessarily for the purpose of going to "worship" but more so to hear a speaker, in the hopes of getting something "applicable" out of the message. They seem to have either forgotten the purpose of corporate worship, or they are in need of material that meets them where they're at.  

So we thought, 

"How do we write a worship project for this type of social climate?"  

Our answer to that question is by writing/creating material that perhaps is a little more blunt, or in your face as far as its application  and reference to real life.  

Our goal with these songs is that they would instigate an attitude of reflection upon what the Lord has done for us and his people throughout scripture, as well as what He as done in our own life stories thus far. Through this mindset of reflection, people will be spurred to a response (or reflex) of thankfulness and adoration. This cultivates a habit and culture of thankfulness which is the foundation of worship. 

THE PLAN 

Our goal is to produce 8 songs, two of which will be recorded in the end of august for a digital release early this fall. The rest will be produced in February 2018 with a estimated release in late March early April 2018. 

We have calculated the necessary production budget for "Join the Song: Vol 2"will be $10,500. If we should receive more than this set amount, all other monies will go towards creating more project videos and song materials for churches.  

Risks and challenges

The main challenge with undertaking the "Join The Song: vol 2" album project is the potential of not meeting our indiegogo goal. This is the challenge that has previously prevented us from doing a formal crowd funded project before now.

Indiegogo is an online platform for funding creative projects. We have 60 days to raise at least $10,500. Your contributions will go towards paying for professional session musicians, producers, studio time, graphic design and video, and the manufacturing of this album.

The songs are mostly all written and ready for the production process. All that's needed is the rest of the funding to come in via this platform, to wrap up the logistics. We can then move forward into production

story:
Pre-order Naughty Clouds’ debut album, Everything’s Hard!

The vigorous rock duo Naughty Clouds, led by Alexis Moon and Ray Kubian, is ready to record but we need our friends’ and fans’ help to release our debut album Everything's Hard.  We could use your help with funding...

  • Mastering our music.
  • Creating digital download packs.
  • Distribution and licensing fees.
  • Press and publicity.

 

With just a little help from our friends...

...we could release an album of which we are proud.  Making a great album up front will help us get tours, radio play, and representation in the long run.  

With your pre-order and/or donation up front, we will get the much needed funds that will help us get the ball rolling.

 

What’s in it for you?

At the Fans’ level, you will get a chance to pre-order the very first Naughty Clouds full length album.  However, there is also lots of extra fun stuff for those that contribute a bit more, such as ...

  • Signed, limited edition copies of an Alexis Moon chapbook of poetry!
  • A chance at a free voice or drum lesson from Alexis Moon or Ray Kubian!
  • The opportunity to host Naughty Clouds in your very own living room for an acoustic concert!
  • The opportunity to gain a production credit on our album!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that money is tight for all, and it is especially tight for our communities of fellow artists.  (That’s part of why we’re naming our album Everything’s Hard.)  So, if you cannot contribute or pre-order during the time of this campaign, won’t you please consider...

  • Sharing this on your social media pages to help spread the word!
  • ”Like” our status updates to keep this campaign very visible!
  • Look out for our official release and RELEASE PARTIES which we will be planning for early spring 2018.

Thank you for making Everything’s Hard just a little easier!

story:
Aug 20:  We have very exciting news to share:  our new, totally remodeled store is now open at our new space at 2444 Durant in the Sather Gate Mall, up toward campus from our old space. 

We invite everyone to come see us, and want to send out a special thanks to all of you who made this possible thanks to your financial contributions, volunteer work, and support.  STAY TUNED FOR OUR GRAND OPENING SCHEDULE IN SEPTEMBER!






Aug 15:  We also want to encourage everyone to DONATE NOW at igg.me/at/RevBooksNYC to Re-open Revolution Books NYC in Harlem!  Our sister store, Revolution Books New York, is a beacon for revolution and wide-ranging, critical engagement nationally.  It has signed a lease for a new storefront and is making a big move to Harlem. Now the fight is on to ensure that the most radical bookstore on the planet re-opens in September.  RB NYC has raised 34 percent of its $30,000 goal, with 10 days remaining.  The funds are going towards the immediate expenses of renovating its new space at 437 Malcolm X Boulevard (Lenox Avenue).  Go to igg.me/at/RevBooksNYC to learn more about why this “Bookstore for the World Is Coming to Harlem:  What It Is …Why It Matters…How YOU Can Help Make It Happen,” including video statements from Eve Ensler, Edwidge Danticat, and Ngugi Wa Thiong’o.


Renovating Revolution Books New York's new space in Harlem 

We made it! 

Thanks to everyone who donated and spread the word, we were "trending," "in demand," and raised $20,027 by midnight Monday, surpassing out goal!  We consider all of you now part of the Revolution Books Berkeley community.  We've now painted the new space and today finish installing a new $6,000 plus floor!  Lots more work - lights, furniture, electrical, and new stock - to go to move in by August 1, so more collective fundraising, promotion and discussion ahead, which we'll keep you posted about.    The campaign is still open, and donations are still very urgently needed. TO DONATE: Click on the pink box on the right side of the page that says SELECT A PERK. And you can always donate at www.revolutionbooks.org.   Best, from the Revolution Books Staff and supporters.

Revolution Books Needs Your Support to Move, Renovate & Revitalize

Revolution Books Berkeley has been at its current space for 27 years – a center of the revolution, a “Berkeley institution” as poet Bob Hass put it, and one of the “Top 20 Bay Area independent bookstores.” (SF Chronicle).  The bookstore has hosted hundreds of author events, political forums, artistic performances, and provided a unique and cutting edge revolutionary book selection in Northern California. 

Now Revolution Books has the need – and opportunity – to move into a new space at 2444 Durant in Berkeley by August 1.  Your support will make it happen!

Revolution Books is where people from around the world come for the books and the engagement about why the world is like this and how it could be radically transformed through revolution - there is a way out. It's a bookstore marked by a morality and strategic approach to fighting for a world that is overcoming all forms of exploitation and oppression… grounded in the re-envisioned communism of Bob Avakian, and with big arms to engage the wide spheres of cultural and intellectual life that must be a part of fighting for a new world.

The times are changing....There’s a new spirit of resistance spreading across the country - from Ferguson to Baltimore and beyond, and intensifying outrages from attacks on women’s rights, to a new escalation in Iraq, to one police murder after another.  Big questions are being posed about the future of humanity and the planet.  All this makes a vibrant and financially solvent Revolution Books more needed than ever.

$20,000 is needed now for this move and transformation.  Your donations will pay for: 

  • Installing a new floor
  • New electrical wiring and lighting
  • Patching and painting
  • An expanded stock and a Point of Sale system

The result:  a new and revitalized Revolution Books Berkeley...and a real contribution to human emancipation.

“It's not your old grandpa's communism -- It's something else. It's a deep, spirited analysis. I grapple with these guys all the time, from another point of view, but I love em and respect them and they need your help. And if you want independent thought, independent books, independent ideas to exist you have to step up. You have to help.”  Peter Coyote, author, actor, Zen Buddhist Priest

After this move, Revolution Books will launch a Fall fund drive of special author events to complete its re-launch and expand its literature selection, its events, its work and its reach and impact.

Other Ways You Can Help

Revolution Books has an all-volunteer staff -- and you are invited to join it!  Also needed: big & small donations; people to work on fund raising; social media geeks; designers and artists; carpenters; and authors, poets & performers to work with us on this exciting project.

Call 510-848-1196 or email us at revolutionbooks@sbcglobal.net.

Humanity needs revolution, revolution needs Revolution Books, and Revolution Books needs you.

Call 510-848-1196 or email us at revolutionbooks@sbcglobal.net.

Humanity needs revolution, revolution needs Revolution Books, and Revolution Books needs you.

story:
Who Are YOU???

Why, we're Hyrrokkin, an instrumental avant-rock band from Yellow Springs, Ohio! Since forming in 2011, we've played all over the country. In the past, we did all of our traveling in the "comfort" of our big, bad, beautiful 1984 GMC full-size diesel van. We've taken this beast on several cross-country tours, we drove it to record our first LP at Seizures Palace in Brooklyn, we drove it on brief weekend forays, we drove it to record our collaboration with Merzbow up at Key Club Studios in Michigan, and we drove it to our mastering session at Chicago Mastering Service in (duh) Chicago. 

This beast has history, It was once responsible for spiriting our previous band, Kuan, across the country, and it has carried our friends in the William Hooker Trio, Haitian Rail, and many more… 

Tell Me More About Your Van!

We drove this van through the desert in the Summer, without A/C, when the temperatures were so high we couldn't even open the windows; we drove it through the snow, with diesel fumes and cold air seeping in through massive, rusted holes in the chassis. We spent countless nights sleeping in it, or next to it under the redwoods, or sometimes on top of it. One of us straight up lived in it for several months. We've spent hundreds of hours repairing, reworking, and tweaking things in the name of functionality… 

Late last year, we drove the van out to Boston (incidentally, where we all met more than ten years ago), to play a great festival called the Boston Hassle Fest, with Horse Lords, Brandon Seabrook, Body/Head, and a bunch of other fantastic bands… Unfortunately, as we pulled into Boston, the transmission in our old friend started slipping… We had no choice but to leave our fallen friend behind.

Woah, That Sucks! What Now!?

The time has come for us to replace our van, so we're launching this campaign, to play on your generosity, to harness your sympathies, so that you may choose to enable us to come rock you. 

We're generally pretty thrifty humans, but this is a definite period of transition for our band. We're reeling from the loss of our van, and we'll also be losing our practice space, where we've been for almost 6 years, at the end of this month. 

Maudlin Sentimentality Abounds!

We're not looking for something brand new… We just need something serviceable, reliable, and with wheels, that we could drive to see our friends in faraway places like New York, Chicago, St. Louis, Detroit, and Boston… but more practically, something we can drive to gigs with friends in Dayton, Columbus, Louisville, and Cincinnati, for example. If they'll still have us, I mean. 

Anything you can contribute would be a huge, huge help. It would basically keep us from selling our stuff to get back on top. Sure, maybe it is stuff we don't use, but you know… We have new music we're working on, and we're gearing up to hit the road for weekends in the very near future. Let's make this happen!

So, Friend, What's In It For Me?

We have a ton of stuff up for grabs… We want to reward you for supporting our quest to make tunes and burn up some tarmac… We have plenty of our own music available; special t-shirts and posters we'll be screening; dozens of badass releases from Ed's outstanding label, New Atlantis Records; more t-shirts; a personalized release of custom cover songs; personalized solo CDRs; live performances wherever you are; maybe a miserable tattoo from one of us; and more… 

What Do You Want From Me, Stranger?

We're shooting for $5,000, and if we don't make our goal, we will certainly make do.  That said, if we surpass $5,000, we will be able to put the resources towards soundproofing a small shed that we'll use as a practice space. It'll be nice!

I'll Tell You What You Can Do With Your Crowdfunding...

We do realize these fundraising campaigns get thrown around a lot…  Hopefully we are offering some interesting perks that will make this whole thing worthwhile. We greatly appreciate your time, and we wish you all the best... We recognize that no one wants this stuck in their newsfeed every day, but this is going to run for 30 days. Then we're ghost! 

If you can contribute... great! If not, no sweat, we will still love you for who you are.

What Is This Campaign For, Again?

Put some wheels underneath us so we can come be loud for you, and maybe put some insulation in our shed so we can not freeze and sculpt new tunes for you.

Please tell your friends, and your family members, and let's do this thang.

With grace, love and peace.

HYRROKKIN

Paul G. Larkowski 

Brett Q. Nagafuchi 

Edward D. Ricart
story_txt:
Who Are YOU???
Why, we're Hyrrokkin, an instrumental avant-rock band from Yellow Springs, Ohio! Since forming in 2011, we've played all over the country. In the past, we did all of our traveling in the "comfort" of our big, bad, beautiful 1984 GMC full-size diesel van. We've taken this beast on several cross-country tours, we drove it to record our first LP at Seizures Palace in Brooklyn, we drove it on brief weekend forays, we drove it to record our collaboration with Merzbow up at Key Club Studios in Michigan, and we drove it to our mastering session at Chicago Mastering Service in (duh) Chicago. 
This beast has history, It was once responsible for spiriting our previous band, Kuan, across the country, and it has carried our friends in the William Hooker Trio, Haitian Rail, and many more… 

Tell Me More About Your Van!
We drove this van through the desert in the Summer, without A/C, when the temperatures were so high we couldn't even open the windows; we drove it through the snow, with diesel fumes and cold air seeping in through massive, rusted holes in the chassis. We spent countless nights sleeping in it, or next to it under the redwoods, or sometimes on top of it. One of us straight up lived in it for several months. We've spent hundreds of hours repairing, reworking, and tweaking things in the name of functionality… 
Late last year, we drove the van out to Boston (incidentally, where we all met more than ten years ago), to play a great festival called the Boston Hassle Fest, with Horse Lords, Brandon Seabrook, Body/Head, and a bunch of other fantastic bands… Unfortunately, as we pulled into Boston, the transmission in our old friend started slipping… We had no choice but to leave our fallen friend behind.

Woah, That Sucks! What Now!?
The time has come for us to replace our van, so we're launching this campaign, to play on your generosity, to harness your sympathies, so that you may choose to enable us to come rock you.

With grace, love and peace.

Paul G. Larkowski 
Brett Q. Nagafuchi 
Edward D. Ricart

story:
คนตรีปา – Music Forest

A mountain workshop, a fine studio, a spirited home in the north of Thailand – An Indiegogo fundraising effort to help me get my new workshop up and running.

Both a simple and natural next step and a marvellous new life adventure, I have begun a new path which is already starting to pack itself down and just needs a little boost from my friends! 

I am here to ask, 'Would you like to help me get there?'.

The financial goal for this Indiegogo fundraising is $2000 and my full funding goal is $10,000. 

My name is Catherine Thompson and I am a Canadian musical instrument maker, musician, composer & visual artist. 

Between 2011 and 2012, for three spring/summer seasons, I traveled on my own by horseback for 2500 km meandering through the southern Canadian prairies linking together as much diminishing native grassland as possible. Native grass... the beautiful old growth forest of the plains!

I have been living a somewhat nomadic existence for 13 years now, mostly in the west of Canada, and my rides were a sort of culmination of this in-motion existence. During my rambles through the open plains, I found myself pondering the thought that it might soon be time to become a little more settled and I wondered if I might find such a place during the rides. A little place tucked in a Saskatchewan coulee perhaps; in the forests of the Porcupine Hills perhaps. 

It turns out that I did indeed find a place during that time. Interestingly and perhaps even strangely, that place is an old wood house nestled in the forest high up in the mountains to the east of Chiang Mai in northern Thailand. I find myself in full amazement of how a journey, travelled with an open heart, can take a person to unexpected – morphing to familiar – places. So here I sit now camped in my big cotton tent in the open prairies of SW Alberta, writing this after years of travelling, working towards being in one place, soon to be set up in a high tropical jungle. November 1, 2014 is the day that I make my move. My shift.

This purpose of this คนตรีปา – Music Forest Indiegogo campaign is to help me set up a small instrument making and music composing/art studio. All funds raised will go towards getting my workshop set up and running and a beginning start on gathering the materials that I will need to get my studio to function as a self-sustaining entity for years to come. My plan is to sell the instruments that I make through the internet, word of mouth and via connections that I am presently establishing with instrument dealers in North America.

Spending my days quietly making instruments is something that holds great appeal to me at this moment of my life, now in the later half of my 50's. The sense of peace and contentment that I find while building instruments is a wonderful thing. It is clearly where I must now go. Because the instruments that I make tend towards the unusual, I have found it impossible to fully do my work and survive here in Canada. And so, in part, it was from a financial aspect that pulled my thoughts towards the idea of setting up a home in rural Thailand. But then an almost magical thing happened. I discovered that I loved my time in Thailand; that I love Thailand and her people; that I felt more at home there after a few short months than I do in my home country; that the ways of the people I met in my daily life resonated with my own, in ways that I could never have expected; that to leave was wrenching in ways that I had not experienced before. To leave and to move has been the reality of my existence for a long time up to now. It is apparently time to now leave and to pause.

I was initially drawn to Thailand a few years ago to help my mom, who now lives in Bangkok, to settle down there. Soon after arriving, I was loving my time in this intriguing nation and it wasn't long before the thought of living there myself presented itself. What I cannot possibly afford to do in Canada turns out to be quite feasible in rural Thailand. Though what I am trying to raise in this Indiegogo campaign is not a massive amount, it is for me, significant. The money that I raise is going to change my life in the most profound ways possible. The $2000 that I have set as my Indiegogo goal is what I will need to get a basic workshop going. Enough to help me to live simply and to start creating my studio in that place where the air is thick with the sounds of insects in the evening. A small donation will go a long long way. All funds raised in excess of my goal will go towards bringing my studio to a more complete state, acquiring fine tools, a bank of wood and other materials for future instruments. I expect this move to be long term. 

As I mentioned at the beginning, my full funding goal is to raise $10,000 before I leave to Thailand on November 1, 2014. As I write this I am already half way towards that $10,000 goal and just need a little help to get there. Enough to get me to Thailand; minimally set up with my studio and home and started with instrument making and allow me a year to get my name out there and a clientele together. In addition to this Indiegogo campaign, I am gathering funds working with horses - trimming, a bit of training - and doing other jobs as they come along in SW Alberta. Another amazingly beautiful part of the world.

Where will your donation go?

• I have a big list of things to get together for the workshop. I will be purchasing some tools in Canada and some in Thailand. Money will go towards work benches, measuring devices, chisels, planes, saws, glues, clamps, drill bits, scrapers, building materials etc, having them delivered to my place as well as the need to get my work space to a functional state will include some minor house construction. In my work, I will be using hand tools for the most part but will likely purchase a couple of electrical ones too such as a power drill/drill press, a bandsaw and sander if funds allow. A major focus in my studio is that it can easily function with no electricity at all if need be. I much prefer the contemplative nature of hand-work to the noise of machines but one or three electrical tools does make life a little easier at times.

Perks

• The Sun & The Wind USB Flash-Art Stick perk is a collection of audio and video files, images from my three years of long rides and a 43 page pdf of some of the writings that came out my grassland rambles all placed on a 4GB USB flash drive that you can access with your computer packaged with a lovely signed thank you card with a photo from the ride.

• I will have one Tsugaru Shamisen, two Gourdudus and one Kora available and ready to be shipped. 

        • I have an Igil (my own version of a Tuvan horsehead fiddle) made with a gourd, bloodwood, a deerskin sounding surface, horse hair strings and a lovely bow made from Bloodwood, deer antler and horsehair from the tail of my beautiful horse Dakota (now in a lovely new home!).
 • The other instrument perks are 6 of each of the Kora and Shamisen due one year after the end of the campaign. These perks function as what you might call an instrument pre-order.

• I've decided to put up as a perk a gorgeous fur hood that I made a few years ago. Made from beaver, chinchilla, seal and wolverine furs, deerskin and some of the finest porcupine quill work that I have ever done. Absolutely wearable and toasty warm, this magnificent piece would make a beautiful display piece as well. 

Impact

Any contribution that you wish to make is huge. A small amount goes a long long way, a large amount can take me to a new level altogether.
My life work is to search for a deep connection to nature. I often think of Wendell Berry's words (& I paraphrase) that nature must always be our exemplar, our beginning and our end. In that, he was specifically talking about farming but I think that he would agree that it truly applies to everything in our lives. One day in the early fall of 2005 I sat by the French River in northern Ontario and pledged my life to attempt to search for a path to balance and understanding within the wild, natural world. I still live this daily and my music and art is where I make my own small contributions to finding a new and full way to be on our earth.

The fact of this struggle, I know, resonates with many people today. It is a difficult, trying and perhaps even despairing time. I think perhaps that soon, the balance will turn where the majority will demand a finer path in our relationship with nature. To me this turning cannot happen too soon. 

I am accustomed to bringing all of my projects and explorations to fruition and this project may well be the most exciting yet. I try to be as true to myself when I embark on my projects, I am fully aware that a small statement can have a great impact that reverberates a long way. My rides taught me this most eloquently. 

Challenges

I do seem to like 'em. 
Some of the challenges ahead are obvious: a new language, a new culture, missing my close Canadian friends, the land.

A big part of this shift to Thailand is that my mom, Madeline and brother, Michael live there. Indeed, it was from visits with her and Michael (who is soon to start a teaching adventure in China), that I discovered my affinity to SE Asia. It was really by chance that my brother was there and then my mom went to visit and fell in love with the country and then, travelling with her, I also fell in love with the country.

These challenges are met with the love of family, of new Thai friends already becoming old friends, of the joy of learning to speak and read and write a completely different tongue which I practise daily and manage to make myself and others laugh with great gusto and also with the support and understanding of my loved ones here in Canada. I have discovered that these challenges are essential to my very existence.

I have followed through with every publicly-assisted funding project I have embarked upon.

Other Ways You Can Help

If it turns out that you are not able to contribute financially but would like to help out in some other way, please pass this on to people that you think will be intrigued by my project and for that matter, a kind word or two of encouragement and thoughts will take me miles!

story:
Who are WE?

Troy Tones was founded in 2002, and ever since we've been taking both USC and California by storm! We are dedicated to putting on extraordinary performances and are known for outrageous costumes at our concerts. Troy Tones has travelled all over the U.S. touring, workshopping with schools, and competing in the International Championship of Collegiate A Cappella. TT members have been featured in both Pitch Perfect movies, the Sing-Off and on the Oprah Winfrey Network's "Life with La Toya." 

However, the most important thing to know about us that we are a family that loves to sing together. That's why we are so excited to share our self-titled album, TT, that we have been working on for the past 3 years!

TT.

This album will be a collection of some of our favorite arrangements and songs. Since releasing our last CD in 2011, so much has changed in terms of our sound and the A Cappella  scene as a whole. We're working with some of the best in the business of A Cappella to make this album the best it can be for the people that have been supporting us all along! This is a huge stepping stone for us as a group and a once in a lifetime holiday offer!

What We Are Asking For

We are asking for the bare minimum to make what we believe to be a commercially viable LP for the group. The costs we we are looking at are as follows:

$500 - Microphone/Gear Rentals/Studio Time

$2000 - Vocal Editing

$3000 - Mixing

$1000 - Mastering

$500 - Packaging/Distribution

ADDITIONAL FUNDING - Music Video and BONUS recordings

We've been recording most of the album in our homes and have been careful to make it as cost efficient of a process as possible. Our hearts are in this project and all we want is to make the album accessible to as many people as possible. However, we can't make it happen without your help!

Other Ways to Support Us!

Can't donate at this time? That's okay! You can still help us out by sharing our project with your friends and family. Spread the word! We thank you in advance and can't tell you enough how much this means to the 16 of us! FighTT On!

story:
(Please check below for English)

>>>>> Notre histoire <<<<<

Futsu est une carte postale du triangle des Bermudes…un éclat pop rock brut qui vous emporte dans un voyage hypnotique, romantique et aventureux. 

Né des cendres du projet solo acoustique de Mike Marques, compositeur multi-instrumentiste australien, le groupe renaît sous sa forme Indie rock/Freak pop en 2014. Composé de six personnalités musicales contrastées, la formation évolue dans un univers frais et décalé fait de mélodies entêtantes
et de rythmes percutants.

La concrétisation de 'Body Island,' passé d'un rêve fou à la réalité donne au groupe un élan fantastique. La sortie de ce premier opus pop-acoustique, constitué  d'une collection de titres composés sur une période de trois ans, dont la moitié est financée par son public sur cette même plateforme à 110% en 2013, encourage Mike à poursuivre l'écriture et à jouer régulièrement en live avec son nouveau line-up. Le groupe se produit alors dans divers espaces culturels ainsi qu'au Bus Palladium et au Comedy Club et compose de nouveaux titres marquant une vraie évolution dans le son : Le prochain Futsu sera un electro-shock !!!


>>>>>Notre but <<<<<

Enregistrer un E.P ! Oui mais pourquoi ?
Aujourd'hui, le groupe est dans une démarche différente et ne veut pas attendre pour partager son nouveau son avec vous : les morceaux choisis, fruits d'expérimentations electro-rock de ces six derniers mois ont été "roadtesté" en live, prémaquettés en résidence et n'attendent qu'une seule chose : prendre forme sur ce que constituera un nouvel E.P explosif. 
Tout comme les (96!) contributeurs de notre précédente campagne, apportez votre pierre à l'édifice de la musique actuelle. Du petit caillou au gros rocher peu importe : Chaque grain de sable a son importance lorsqu'on investi
dans la musique en laquelle on croit !

Si 'Body Island' a contribué à développer plus encore sa relation avec son public,
le prochain E.P permettra au groupe de consolider la relation amorcée avec les professionnels.


>>>>> Contreparties <<<<<

En contribuant à cette campagne, non seulement vous nous rapprochez de notre objectif de manière significative mais vous accédez en retour à des exclusivités imaginées par le groupe spécialement pour l'occasion : nouveaux goodies, reprise d'un titre de votre choix  leçon skype, cocktail party, apparition dans un clip, avantages VIP…nous avons été encore plus loin pour vous gâter et vous surprendre!
En supplément de notre futur EP, vous aurez un choix exhaustif de contreparties pour l'accompagner !!

Jetons un oeil sur quelques contreparties proposées en image :
Let's take a look at a few of our perks:

--------- T-Shirts ---------

"Goddess" NEW!

Disponible pour homme et femme sous demande. Toutes tailles sous demande.

"Mermaids"

Selon les stocks disponibles.

T-shirts inclu dans le pack 'Get the look Coco!' (50€)

---------Tote bag & Mugs ---------
Devenez l'heureux propriétaire d'un Tote bag "Goddess" et d'un mug "Futsu" (votez pour votre préféré en fin de campagne sur notre page Facebook!) et allez à cette occasion faire vos courses ou boire un café avec un des membres du groupe !!!

Le tote bag est inclu dans le pack 'Let's go shopping!' (100€)
et le mug dans le pack 'Let's have a drink!' (150€)

--------- Un rôle dans un de nos clips ---------
Transformez-vous le temps d'une journée de shoot ! Vivez le tournage de l'intérieur avec le groupe et laissez une trace sur Youtube.

Rôle inclu dans le pack 'Be in our music video!' (250€)

--------- Un cours de musique sur Skype ou dans Paris ---------
Vous rêvez d'un cours de violon avec Mélissa, d'un cours de guitare avec Julien, ou d'un cours de percutions avec Dave ou tout simplement de parler de la pluie et du beau temps ? Le pack Skype est fait pour vous !


Cours inclu dans le pack 'Skype you, Skype me!' (200€)

--------- Ta chanson ---------

Mike compose, interprète et enregistre en .mp3 une chanson rien que pour toi
avec, si tu le souhaites, tes idées mélodiques et tes textes !

Inclu dans le pack 'Write me a song!' (400€)

>>>>> Répartition du budget <<<<<

Jettons un oeil à ce dont vont nous servir vos contributions.

2820€ Capturer notre son
800€ Manufacturer notre CD
380€ Copyrighting
400€ Frais Sacem pour toute production musicale

>>>>> Aide non financière <<<<<

Vous ne pouvez pas contribuer ?! Partager cette campagne au maximum est tout aussi important. Faire découvrir notre musique, inviter des amis et des collègues à nous voir en live est tout aussi significatif qu'une aide financière! 
Quelques astuces pour nous aider :
>> Utilisez le hastag de la campagne #FutsuCrowdfunder pour partager cette page, nos sons, nos photos ou vidéos mais surtout celles que vous prenez
qu'on puisse les voir :) !
>> Invitez votre entourage à contribuer (http://igg.me/at/futsu2015).
>> Venez faire la fête avec nous à Campus (Paris Bastille) le 26 Septembre et lever des fonds pour vaincre la mucoviscidose à l'occasion des Virades de l'espoir à Saint Germain en Laye le 27 Septembre  !

---------------

Un grand merci d'avoir pris le temps 
de passer par ici ! À très vite !!!
************************************************************************


>>>>> OUR PAST <<<<<

Futsu is a postcard from the Bermuda Triangle…a burst of pop rock noise that  takes you on hypnotic, romantic adventure.

What started off as a solo acoustic project by singer-songwriter Mike Marques, was developed into a full band by the Australian born multi-instrumentalist in 2014. Comprising of six members with diverse musical backgrounds, the line-up has solidified into a group blending twisted melodies and punchy dance rhythms with tight arrangements they label Indie rock/Freak Pop.

The realisation of their debut album ‘Body Island’ made a crazy dream reality and gave the band a huge push. Their full length mutant pop, rock, folk release, consisted of a collection of songs written over a 3 year period whoes recording was financed by a campaign in 2013. This encouraged Mike to continue writing and playing live with this line-up and the band spent the following month promoting and performing the album to a hungry audience in venues ranging from The Bus Palladium to the Comedy Club in Paris: The next Futsu release is going to be an electro-shock!

>>>>> OUR FUTURE <<<<<

Why we want record an EP?

Today, the band is moving in a new direction musically and we can’t wait to share this new sound with you: the songs we’ve selected to record are the fruits of 6 months of experimenting with a more electro-rock sound which we’ve been road testing live and demoed during a residency. Now these tracks are only waiting for one thing: to take shape in what will be an explosive EP.

We ask you once again to join us in this adventure and help finance recording and production of our EP.

If ‘Body Island’ helped develop and solidify a relationship with our fans. 

The next release will allow us to reach out further to industry professional and continue to develop our career.


>>>>>  GOODIES <<<<<

By contributing to this campaign, not only will you help us reach our objective but you’ll also have access to a whole range of exclusive perks, created by the band exclusively for this event. New goodies include: EP Listening Party, staring in pur next music video, cover songs, remixes, behind the scenes videos, Skype lessons to name a few. We’ve gone even further this time to spoil you with some surprises! In addition to our future EP, you’ll get a huge range of perks to go with it.

--------Tote bag & Mugs --------


Become the proud owner of our new tote bag ‘Goddess’ and a new ‘Futsu’ mug (to be voted for at the end of the campaign on Facebook) and do your weekly shopping or have a cup of coffee and chat with members of the band!

The tote bag is included in the 'Let's go shopping!' pack (100€) 

and the mug in the  'Let's have a drink!' pack (150€)

--------- A staring role in one of our music videos  ---------

Get a feature role in our next music video and get your name in the end credits! Hair and make-up will be provided plus you’ll get your own armchair to relax in between takes.

Role included in our 'Be in our music video!' pack (250€)

--------- A online lesson with one of the band on Skype or in Paris ---------

Have a private 1 hour Skype lesson with a member of the band. Learn one of our songs, get some tips on the drums, violin or guitar! If you’re not a musician, one of the guys will chat to you about your favorite subject (philosophy, cooking, supernatural, how amazing  the new Twin Peaks’ will be?)

Lesson included in the 'Skype you, Skype me!' pack(200€)

--------- Write me a song!---------

Mike will write and record a song for you in the style of your choice. It can be instrumental or with vocals/spoken word. You can write the lyrics or give him a theme you’d like the song about and then you’ll get it as an mp3. We cannot wait to hear these songs!


>>>>> BUDGET BREAKDOWN <<<<<

Here’s where your contributions will be going.

2820€ Studio & equipment rental, recording, engineering, mixing and mastering
800€ Manufacturer CD
380€ Copyright

>>>>> NON-FINANCIAL HELP <<<<<

Can’t contribute? Sharing this website link and our campaign video is also important and help us get the message out there. Play someone one of our songs, invite your friends to one of our concerts is just as significant as a financial contribution.

Some other tips on how you can help:

>>Use the campaign hashtag  #FutsuCrowdfunder when sharing this page, our music, photos or videos but especially those pics and videos you take so we can see them! :)

>> Invite you friends & family to contribute http://igg.me/at/futsu2015

>> Come and party with us at one our next shows: le 26 September and Virades de l'espoir à Saint Germain en Laye le 27 September!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 

SEE YOU SOON!!!

********************************************************************

IMPORTANT NOTE - SHIPPING: PLEASE ADD $7 to your total contribution for U.S. and Canadian orders, ADD $13 for all orders outside of the U.S. and Canada

story:
We are CHUNK, a 9 piece funk rock/fusion band from San Luis Obispo. We started as a jam band in the summer of 2012 and have since grown into a full blown musical force with a horn section 4 members deep. 

For the past 8 months we have been recording our first album at Speak Studios. Hundreds of hours of composing and practicing, and many long days of recording and mixing have produced an album that we are proud of and want to share with the world.  

Here's where you come in - we need your help funding the publication of our album. Many of us are fresh out of college (Burlie is still there) and don't have much expendable income. We've managed to cover the costs of recording and production. This campaign is crucial to our ability to provide CDs and other tangible merchandise to our fans.

What's in it for you?

If you contribute $10 or more then you have purchased a copy of our album. You can think of it as a presale purchase. We are also offering signed merchandise at higher contribution tiers. See the "Perks" at the right for details. 

Not only does your contribution help us publish our first album, it also kickstarts our musical future. Help us spread the joy of feel good funk for many years to come. 

We really appreciate your contributions to CHUNK! Thank you so much for helping us out. 

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • Share this video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z_NMFdKYNAU&nbs... on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media
  • Like us on Facebook at facebook.com/CHUNKband
  • Come see us live!

CHUNK members:                                                                                                                       Trevor Carlson - Drums                                                                                                       Stephen Marshall - Bass                                                                                                                     Kyler Fischer - Guitar                                                                                                                           Robby Porovich - Guitar                                                                                                                       Burlie Fisher - Trumpet/Flugel Horn                                                                                               Eric Strohm - Trombone                                                                                                                     Kyle Fooks - Alto/Tenor Saxophone                                                                                               Austin Cade - Tenor Saxophone                                                                                                       Eru - Auxiliary Percussion                           

We have released the first song off the album to Soundcloud. To hear it go clink on the link below:

https://soundcloud.com/chunk-music/funke

story:
Uncle Riffkin - band of teachers

If you don't know us already, our story began 5 years ago at a school in San Francisco where 4 of us met as teachers and co-workers. Over the course of several years we realized that we were all musicians looking to perform and write music. As we began rehearsing and writing in Mike's garage, things started to develop and we began performing as Uncle Riffkin, which led to our first recording effort that we did entirely in our school's sound booth. In the last two years we have added a bassist and developed our sound, writing dozens of songs in the process. In that time we have also played gigs around San Francisco, the Bay Area, Northern California, Oregon and Michigan and hope to continue our passion for many years ahead. Did we mention that 4 out of 5 of us are working teachers as well? Yes, it's true, we find time in our busy schedules to make this band a priority, and we have a lot of fun in the process. We are inspired, dedicated, and want to share more with our growing audience!

However, for our band and audience to grow we need more than our humble recording equipment and we want to get the best sound possible. To do this, we are asking for financial assistance in booking studio time, hiring a sound engineer, and creating a professionally produced album that we can share with our audience. We are already beginning our recording January 14th & 15th at Hyde Street Studios in San Francisco, and are confident they will give us the best possible product in the end. However, this will not be enough to complete our goal. That's where we need you! To help us cover the costs of studio time, mixing, producing, album creation, and CD release. We need your help!

We are grateful for any contribution you can make. Did we mention that we're teachers? Our funds are limited but we're passionate about what we do and excited for the opportunity that recording this album will present, and with your help we can make it happen! Thank you so much and keep listening, as more is to come...

-Uncle Riffkin

Tom, Seth, Mike, Kevin, and Dana

We are already beginning our recording January 14th & 15th at Hyde Street Studios in San Francisco, and are confident they will give us the best possible product in the end. However, this will not be enough to complete our goal. That's where we need you! To help us cover the costs of studio time, mixing, producing, album creation, and CD release. We need your help!
We are grateful for any contribution you can make. Did we mention that we're teachers? Our funds are limited but we're passionate about what we do and excited for the opportunity that recording this album will present, and with your help we can make it happen! Thank you so much and keep listening, as more is to come...
-Uncle Riffkin
Tom, Seth, Mike, Kevin, and Dana

story:
Generator for the Blog Cabin Reunion

You know who we are. We are you. You are our family. We are yours. We have this awesome place that we've spent every cent of our money on, and every minute of our time building for the last seven years. We love the BCR, opening up our lives and doors to everyone so we can all be together and party for a week or so every other June. 

We want to buy a honda generator for this party, and for the longevity of our batteries......this is the generator... Honda 2000-Watt Super Quiet Gasoline Powered Portable Companion Inverter Generator.  It's the fancy one. We want it to be quiet, and reliable. It will hopefully last a decade or two. I'm a fan of this, I used one on a farm in CA and it ruled. 

We had to replace our solar batteries (the bulk of the cost of having solar power), and are pretty strapped for cash. We would love to not worry about partying all night long, and this generator will make that happen! We have already bought a PA for the party, so we're half way there to having EVERYTHING we need. 

We need the cash. We don't have it, do you?  

If everyone throws us some bucks, that would rule. 

Perks include: Partying without the worry of a broken Solar Power System (drained batteries). 

PLESE HELP US COME UP WITH THE FUNDS YOU WILL MAKE THE BCR SOOOO MUCH EASIER! 

Extra funds? Beer, trash bags, grass seeds for the repairing of trampled land... Please contribute and pass on the link. We drop so much cash on this.. sorry to be spanging on the web.. but i guess thats just what we're gonna be doin'. XOOOOOOXXX love you all.

PS: we are going to try real hard to get a good one off craigslist for less. CROSS YR FINGERS!!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi Folks My Name Is Art Mulcahy. I am a Singer, Songwriter, and Entertainer From Sacramento California.
I grew Up with The Love of Music, I traveled The world, I served My Country In The USMC. Now Being a Disabled Veteran, Father of Two Beautiful Kids, Husband and Full time Music Man. I have been Chasing Nashville For The Past 5 years. With a lot Of Blood, Sweat,and Tears I sacrifice Sleep, and Time with My Wife Chasing My Honkytonk Dream!! I have the Love and Full support Of My Family and Friends. With their Support I believe All things are Possible and with Your Help My Dream Can Be a Reality.

I have raised quite a bit Of Money On My Own and Now I am Throwing A wish and a Humble Please Help Into The Universe. I need to raise $800 to finish Up My goal to record My first single In Nashville. All who Help Me Reach this goal will get a copy of My single for free and a Signed Autographed Photo. Thank all Of You In advance For Believing In Me and Helping Me live My Dream.

story:
The Al Joseph Group

Jam Track Central
  • After earning a prestigious spot on "Jam Track Central's" artist roster in 2013, Al Joseph released his debut solo record "Out In The Open". This EP has proven to be a hit with fans all over the globe and now The Al Joseph Group plans to go into the studio and track this record together!
  • The AGJ group plans to release "Out In The Open - Reprise" by the end of the year, just in time for the Winter NAMM Show in Anaheim, CA. 
  • They later plan to go on the road bringing the finished product to YOU!

    What We Need & What You Get


      1. Studio Time - As professional musicians we pride ourselves of getting the very best takes we possibly can. However, this takes loads of time and we are charged by the hour. A single song could take and entire work day costing thousands of dollars.
      2. Mixing - After recording a full-length it is important to make sure everyone in the band is sounding great. This is where the mixing engineer comes in. On average it takes a mixing engineer about 20-30 hours to mixing just ONE SONG! Yikes!!!!
      3. Mastering - Given the album was mixed properly, it is then sent over to a "Mastering Engineer" who sits in a high-tech sound treated room and makes final adjustment to our song as a whole. Although this sounds like a simple process, it too take shouts to master and often times costs more then the previous stages to accomplish.
      Proper Studio Time Is No Joke!!!
        • The fact that just about 95% of successful bands don't just have this kind of money lying around explains why so many bands end up in hundreds of thousands of dollars in debt to various record labels.
        • By donating you help us avoid this hopeless situation, encouraging entrepreneurs like Kenny Eaton to provide professional service at a fair price.  
        • Not only do we want to put this finished product in your hands, we want to use this campaign as a opportunity to connect with our fans. To do that we offer a great deal of prizes and one-on-one interaction as well!

          Your Impact!!!

          • Al Joseph has already recorded an entire album with many other successful artists such as Guthrie Govan (The Aristocrats), Marco Sfogli (James LeBrie), Andy James, Martin Miller, and Jack Thammarat to name a few. If AJG's goals are met, you will also put them on the road with these world renown virtuosos as well.
          • We under stand that the age of "The Internet" are upon us. However, the Al Joseph Group believes in real live interaction. We want to bring this finished product where you are. Helping us accomplish this stage of the creative process will free us up to plan a national tour, which is our most favorite way to interact with our fans!
          • Merchandise - We plan on pressing hard copies of "Out In The Open - Reprise" in both CD Format and Vinyl. Not to mention provide T-shirts, Posters, Hats, and other essential paraphernalia. We want to literally put this process in your hands!

            It Isn't Easy...

            Al Says,

            "Despite my career accomplishments so far, myself and my band 'are still just guys with day jobs and many other financial responsibilities. We need to eat, travel to and from the studio, and pay our bills. Part of the challenge here is maintaing a normal lifestyle while funding a dream. 

            Our fans help us do this by donating. YOU become instant shareholders in turning simple people into a success and a dream into a reality! We thank you and send our love in advance for your contributions and we promise your efforts will not be in vain!"

            Spread The Word

            • We appreciate all who participate and understand that not all have the means to donate their money. You can still help!
            • Spreading the word about our campaign increases our outreach to those who can donate. So feel free to share the link via Facebook, Twitter, or any other social platform. This campaign runs for a limited time so lets get the word out together!

            We thank you for your contributions in advance and will see you on the road soon!

            -The AJG

story:
Who / Qui

Hey! We’re a Montreal based rock and roll band called Café Racer. We’re teaming up with Montreal burlesque darling, Lavender May, to make a music video for our song called “Circus Girl”. Our good friend Chris Rob at Dasme Productions is producing the video. We’re very excited to be working with him again; you can see the first music video we did together here.

Bonjour ! Nous sommes Café Racer, un groupe de rock and roll Montréalais. On travail collaboration avec Lavender May, une artiste burlesque connu à Montréal afin de tourner un vidéo de musique pour notre chanson "Circus Girl". Un de nos bons amis Chris Robichaud de Dasme Productions sera en charge de la production.  Nous sommes content de travailler avec lui de nouveau et vous pouvez écouter la première vidéo qu'on a créé ensemble ici :


Why / Pourquoi

For our next music video we want to combine elements of three different performing arts that Montreal is known for: music, circus performance and burlesque dance. We want to bring together creative minds and artistic abilities to highlight some of Montreal’s vibrant, diversified talent. Normally, when you go out, you see either a rock show, circus performance or burlesque show, we want to combine all of these into one debaucherous three minute visual experience.

Notre vision pour ce projet est de mélanger les éléments de trois formes d'art et de spectacle différents. On vise à rassembler des gens créatifs et des différents habiletés artistiques pour promouvoir les talents diversifiés de Montréal. Normalement il faut choisir entre un spectacle de musique, de burlesque ou de cirque mais notre projet réunira les trois ensemble pour offrir un spectacle unique et excitant.


What we need / Nos besoins

We need your financial assistance to rent the venue to shoot the video and extensive lighting equipment. We also need a large group of outrageous costumes and stage decorations. Money that is donated will also go to compensating all the circus performers and burlesque dancers involved.

Nous avons besoin de votre support financier pour la location de la salle où nous allons tourner notre vidéo et pour l'équipement d'éclairage. De plus, nous avons besoin de diverses déguisements et des décorations pour la scène du tournage. La plupart de l'argent que vous contribuez à notre projet ira à récompenser les artistes, performeurs et danseuses burlesques qui seront impliqués dans le vidéo.

Breakdown

  • $500 - Circus Performers / artistes du cirque
  • $400 - Burlesque Dancers / danseuses burlesque
  • $350 - Venue & Lighting Equipment / location de salle et équipement d'éclairage
  • $250 - Costumes & Stage Decorations / déguisements & décorations

Check out the perks we have to offer to thank you for your support in a perks section to the right.

Regardez les récompenses qu'on est prêt à vous offrir pour vous remercier de votre soutien.

Thanks so much! Merci beaucoup !

–Café Racer + Lavender

story:
"Alle Menschen werden Bruder"

L'Inno alla gioia è originariamente un componimento del poeta e scrittore tedesco Friedrich Schiller. « L'uomo è per ogni uomo un fratello! Che tutti gli esseri si abbraccino! Un bacio al mondo intero! »

Questa Sinfonia porta nel mondo il messaggio di fratellanza. Vogliamo rendere la nostra esecuzione la migliore possibile e dedicarla a tutti. Per far questo abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto ! 

L’Orchestra Antonio Vivaldi

Attualmente consta di una sessantina di elementi, selezionati tra i più promettenti giovani musicisti del panorama italiano. Ha all'attivo più di quaranta concerti sinfonici, tenutisi in importanti teatri, quali la Sala Verdi del Conservatorio di Milano, Teatro dell’Arte di Milano, il Palazzo della Gran Guardia di Verona, il di Vicenza, il Teatro Manzoni di Monza, il Teatro Civico di Tortona, il Teatro Sociale di Como e il Teatro Juan Bravo di Segovia (Spagna).

Il repertorio dell'Orchestra Antonio Vivaldi spazia dalla musica barocca a quella romantica, sino ad abbracciare la musica contemporanea. L'orchestra è da sempre stata interprete e dedicataria di brani in prima assoluta dei compositori Piergiorgio Ratti e Antonio Eros Negri. Per il concerto di capodanno 2015 di Verona, il maestro Andrea Battistoni ha scritto un brano dedicato all'Orchestra eseguito presso il Palazzo della Gran Guardia.

Direttori d’orchestra di calibro internazionale e musicisti di fama mondiale, quali José Luis Gomez, Francesco Manara, Giampaolo Pretto, Giuliano Sommerhalder, Francesco Tamiati e Leonora Armellini hanno collaborato con l’Orchestra.
La giovanissima direzione artistica dell'orchestra è composta da Lorenzo Passerini, direttore musicale, Piergiorgio Ratti, compositore in residenza e Olga Introzzi, segretario artistico.


L'Inno alla gioia alla Basilica di San Zeno, Verona

Il primo giugno metteremo in scena la nona sinfonia nello scenario splendido della Basilica di San Zeno. 

Vogliamo rendere questo concerto splendido e poterlo donare a tutti gli amanti della Musica, dell'Italia e della Fratellanza Universale.
Abbiamo già il piccolo contributo di uno sponsor per coprire parte dei costi della realizzazione dell'evento, ma occorre anche il tuo contributo per rendere questo evento realizzabile.
L'intero contributo sarà esclusivamente destinato a:
  • compenso per orchestrali
  • compenso per coristi e solisti
  • spese di allestimento per l'evento
  • costi del service
Vogliamo inoltre realizzare un DVD che regali le stesse emozioni a quanti non potranno essere a Verona fisicamente con noi !

Vogliamo farlo insieme a te e per questo abbiamo pensato a tante ricompense per dirti GRAZIE:
  • Grazie di averci dato fiducia
  • Grazie di aver permesso la realizzazione di questo sogno
  • Grazie di essere con noi.
Un eventuale eccedenza rispetto al contributo prefissato andrebbe a coprire le spese della realizzazione della Stagione 2015/2016 dell'Orchestra Antonio Vivaldi, che sarà inaugurata il prossimo 5 ottobre 2015. Sarà composta da una ventina di concerti, condotti in tutto il territorio europeo.

Perché contribuire ?

Chi educa alla musica prepara un artista ad affrontare il pubblico, chi educa con la musica prepara un uomo ad affrontare la vita.

Contribuire significa permetterci continuare nel lavoro che stiamo svolgendo dal 2011. Contribuire significa opportunità per tanti altri ragazzi di unirsi a noi. Contribuire significa creare un mondo migliore.

Unisciti a noi !




Come puoi aiutarci ulteriormente ? CCC !

Contribuire !

Condividere !

Consigliare !

Condividi sulla tua pagina facebook, sul tuo profilo twitter e con la posta elettronica.

Consiglia a tutti di venire ad ascoltare l'Orchestra Antonio Vivaldi.

Contribuisci alla campagna e scegli la tua ricompensa !
