story:
Music, Celebration, Microcredit and More!


WE ARE INCREDIBLY EXCITED TO ANNOUNCE THAT WE WILL BE PROVIDING 2 SCHOLARSHIPS FOR POTENTIAL WOMEN FARMERS AT THE MUSIC FESTIVAL!

Plain and simple we are using music and celebration to empower women farmers and fund microcredit loans for women around the world. Come join us!

While stories of chemical ridden pesticides and GMOs fill the headlines, putting your support in the right places can begin the change we all need to not only create a sustainable future, but a thriving one!

1% For Women and the Farmers Femme have come together to create a music festival celebrating Women in Agriculture.

On June 5th and 6th in Buena Vista, CO, thousands will gather to listen to incredible music, dance in the mountains and show their support of women around the world whose work is healing their families, their communities and the environment.

Help us bring this festival to life by raising the $18,000 needed to pay the incredible bands that will play all weekend.

The festival will include a farm to table dinner with a private concert on Friday night and then jump into the larger celebration on Saturday. The music lineup for Saturday includes Wendy Woo, Angie Stevens, Megan Burtt, Paper Bird and several others who are yet to be announced. Along with incredible bands we will have a seed sale and swap to kick off the Colorado growing season, yoga, foraging walks, farm tours, live farm demonstrations and incredible vendors selling their beautiful artwork and sharing more information on ways to get involved supporting women farmers everywhere.

1% For Women is excited to combine their knowledge of helping women around the world, and running large scale events with that of the Farmers Femme. The Farmers Femme is an organization of women farmers and ranchers from around Central Colorado. They bring first hand experience to share with existing and budding agriculturalists.

These two organizations are coming together to bring awareness to the importance of supporting women in agriculture, through music and celebration!

When women earn a steady income 80 - 90% of this money is spent on nutrition, housing and education for their families. These women are raising happier, healthier children who have the skills to change the future for the betterment of humanity.

1% For Women works with businesses who commit 1% of their net profits to microcredit loans for women around the world. Through their partnership with Kiva.org they have funded loans in 7 countries, creating ripples that are breaking the cycles of oppression and poverty that still affect so many.

See more at www.OnePercentForWomen.com

Supporting this festival equates to empowering women farmers in the US and helping fund these microcredit loans to women in agriculture around the world.


Through a weekend of music, dancing and celebration we will all actively participate in creating healthier global communities and a healthier planet.

So, take a look at our incredible perks and come join us for the Sweet Roots Festival on Friday, June 5th and Saturday, June 6, 2015 in Buena Vista, CO.

Why We Need Your Help!

There are many costs involved with bringing  a music festival to life. 1% For Women is using our own resources to cover whatever isn't raised toward the overhead of the event. While we make this commitment out of our deep desire to raise awareness, we also know that whatever money we use toward the festival ultimately limits the dollar amount we are able to put to funding loans as an organization. While both the loans and the educational component are equally important to us, we greatly appreciate any donation you can make to help us cover these costs. Anything raised above and beyond the festival costs will go directly toward microcredit loans for women around the world.

Where Do Your Donations Go?

Your contribution will go directly to funding the festival. The first round of money raised will pay for the musical talent at the festival. If we reach this goal we will look for additional assistance for the sound, staging and all of the logistics involved in bringing the festival to life.

The proceeds from the festival will be spent on ensuring the festival happens again in 2016 and to funding microcredit loans for women in agriculture around the world through 1% For Women.

That means that the more money we raise toward overhead, the more money we have available for the loans that will uplift and empower women and create healthier communities.


Help Us By Selecting A Perk!

So, here is what we have for you! Our perks include tickets to the event, tickets to the Farm to Table dinner, t-shirts and much more.

Pick your perk and we will happily send them along to you! The t-shirt and bumper sticker designs are mock-ups and may change a bit before they go to print. We promise that they will look great!

Bumper Stickers

T-Shirts

Farm to Table Dinner

Music Festival Tickets

Or Become A Sponsor!

Another option is to have your business, organization, family, whomever become a sponsor for the festival and be featured in all of our marketing and promotions.



Why Women? What Difference Will it Make?

1% For Women takes great pride in funding microcredit loans for women around the world.

We frequently get asked why we are only loaning to women when there are men and boys that are in equal need of support. Here is our brief answer to that question.

Economically empowering women and girls will help decrease poverty through the generations.

For every dollar a woman earns, she invests .80 to .90 cents into her family, compared to .30 cents by men.

Studies have shown that when women earn a steady income, the money is more likely to be spent on nutrition, medicine and housing moving toward healthier, better educated children.

These children are then capable of making a positive impact in their local and greater communities. Investing in mothers is an investment in their families. Investing in children is an investment in the future of humanity and our planet.

By investing in women, we are taking great strides toward alleviating the poverty and oppression that still impacts so many today.

Microcredit is an incredible way to both empower and uplift women around the world.

By partnering with the Farmers Femme, we increase the local impact from the festival as well. Educating others on the importance of supporting women who are nurturing the land is crucial.

Risks & Challenges

Starting a new festival takes time and considerable planning. Laurie Benson, the founder of 1% For Women started the Collegiate Peaks Music Festival in 2006 and ran the event for 5 years. She took the festival from a vision to a thriving event that pulled thousands of people to Buena Vista, CO every year. She is no stranger to the trials and tribulations of large events.

The greatest challenge is going to be spreading the word. People will flock to a festival in the mountains where they can dance the day away in the sunshine, we just need to let them all know it is happening.

Our greatest risk is taking on the incredible expense associated with the festival. The less money we raise through this campaign, the less money we are able to put directly toward microcredit loans.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people simply don't have the ability to financially contribute, here are some other ways to help:

  • Make some noise!! Help us spread the word by inviting your friends on facebook
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Lineup!

These musicians will be a part of the festivities. Right now we are happy to announce the following bands as part of the festival: Angie Stevens, Wendy Woo, Megan Burtt and headlining the weekend is Paper Bird! We will add more as we hear back from other talented artists. Stay tuned!







Thank You To Our Current Sponsors!

story:
WHO am I?

Windmills, a "moody indie swoon pop" artist based out of Vernon, BC, Canada. I've been touring and recording for the past 4 years all over Western Canada and most recently completed two cross-Canada tours in the span of one month in the Spring. This year finds me in British Columbia's PEAK Performance Project, Canada's largest radio contest and artist development program, giving me an opportunity to spread my message and my music to an even bigger audience than ever before.

Over the past 2 years I've been working tirelessly on this album and have finished "Measures", a collection of 10 tracks that are essentially 10 versions of myself. These songs deal in the extremes in our lives, and the measures we take to deal with them, either joyous or heartbreaking, positive or negative, yin or yang. Is the glass measured half-full? Or is it half-empty?

There are a few kinks left to sort out and then the album will be released, October 13th, 2015, everywhere. I want to do whatever it takes to get this album in your hands, and let you hear these new songs. But I'm adding a little twist to it, something bigger than just me and my music: A chance to give back.

What am I doing?

I'm running this campaign to finish the final steps in the album process:
- pressing costs
- mastering
- promotion
- distribution
I'm so close to finishing it all, but I'm also running this campaign to raise funds and awareness for the Jessica Eaman Ski Scholarship Fund, or, J.E.S.S. 4 KIDS (http://www.sovereignlake.com/2015/04/24/jess-4-...), who I have partnered with to raise money for their organization. Since 2012 they've been helping kids who would not otherwise have the chance to get out cross country skiing or snowshoeing, by getting them out on the slopes, and teaching them core fundamentals about themselves. Let's see what we can do as friends, music listeners, and as a community to rally behind a truly amazing cause.

Alongside this campaign I will be throwing a benefit concert and fundraiser for J.E.S.S. 4 KIDS and the Sovereign Lake Nordic Club to raise both awareness and funds for their cause, getting young skiers on the snow. 25% of all money raised will go directly to the fund, or $2.50 for every CD sold, digital download, early demos, or $5 for every lyric book. Just think what you can contribute for a Windmills bundle, or a house concert? You have the peace of mind knowing that you supported both an independent musician with his dreams, and a beautiful organization with theirs.

What This Means To WINDMILLS

I'm Norwegian, and Canadian, which means winter dominates a lot of what I identify with, and I grew up on the ski hill from the age of 7 onwards. There is such a quiet brilliance in cross-country skiing, the notion that you are out there alone surrounded by this massive scope of nature, at peace with it all. For me it has been one of the most connected experiences with our planet I've had.

To be able to give this experience to the youth in my community that may never get the chance is almost overwhelming. It's my hope with this campaign and benefit in honour of J.E.S.S. 4 KIDS that we give this kids an opportunity to get out in the wild, explore the hills, and find out something about themselves.

Maybe you can't contribute, but that's not to say you can't help in different ways. Simple donations outside of this campaign are more than welcomed, and I would be just as grateful if you shared this campaign with your friends anywhere and everywhere to help get the word out, even if it is just your family. This is a cause worth knowing, and at the end of the day, it's about our community, growing together and helping each other, no matte the cost.

windmills keep moving.

story:
What are we doing here?

Hey, I’m Maya, an independent singer and composer from Jerusalem, and I’m asking for your help funding my debut album.

 

My album-to-be includes 10 original compositions of poems by three female Hebrew poets - Lea Goldberg, Rachel Shapira and Arianna Haran - each from a different period in the short Israeli history, each leading in her time, each dealing with issues of femininity and masculinity within the Israeli-Jewish society, from both a personal and a sociological perspective. Each of these women tell a different story. Together, they provide a unique and touching perspective to the lives of Israeli women and the Israeli life.

About this project

This project started years ago, when I was studying in Jerusalem Music Academy. As a female musician who was always interested in poetry, it almost seemed inevitable. It began as a one-time project, and grew into much more.

Back then I’ve started this work on my own, and eventually it became a joint project of myself and six other musicians, all of whom good friends of mine, coming from different musical backgrounds, and bringing their own personal angles to the music. We’ve performed with this project dozens of times, each time perfecting it, along with the help of my ensemble.

 

And finally, we are producing an album. With myself as the lead singer, guitar by Ronnie Wagner, bass by Shay Hazan, violin by Tomer Einat, drums by Oded Levi, flute by Hagai Ashdot and Yaron Eigenstein on the accordion and produced by one of the leading producers in the Israeli music industry, Zach Drori, we are hoping to turn this years-long project into a professionally produced album, combining each of the musicians’ attitudes - from classical, through jazz, Irish folk music, oriental music and all the way to funk music.

Who am I?

A bit about myself: I’m Maya, 30 years old and living in Jerusalem with my husband and his three children. Music has been a big part of my life for as long as I can remember.

I grew up with my parents and three brothers in a small village in the Western Galilee. My family and I used to travel as often as we could, whether within Israel and abroad. In these trips I’ve learned a lot on how to listen. Listening to voices coming from different people and different cultures, I have developed my own voice, inspired by all of them and individual nonetheless. From early childhood I’ve had classical musical education, a journey I’ve continued in the Music academy in Jerusalem.

 

I’ve been living in Jerusalem for almost a third of my life. I am in love with this beautiful, diverse and difficult city, which is like a living being of the fabric of humanity itself. This diversity is always present in my music, and in my life approach.

 

These days I am conducting choirs for children with special needs and managing the leading Israeli chamber choir, of Jerusalem Music Academy and teaching vocal pedagogy. And, of course, trying to produce an album.

 

How can you help?

Now, I need you to make this dream come true. Every donation counts, really. If you cannot donate, you can help tremendously just by sharing this project, or forwarding it to your friends.

I thank you dearly for being here. Hopefully, together we can make something amazing.

story:
The members of Boxing Day are: Ogden Basye, who sings, plays guitar and writes the songs; Olorin Jaillet, who plays the drums; and Carson Nitta, who plays the bass. Together we make loud melodic power pop, inspired by an eclectic mix of rock bands such as Pavement, Big Star, Rush, and The Police. We recently released our debut single "Groupie", which you can hear—and watch—above.

With our debut EP, Boxing Day's goal is to create a product of an incredibly high caliber. However, recording and performing at this high level of quality is a very expensive process. As we released our debut single less than two months ago, we have not yet developed a large fanbase or amassed enough money from music streaming and sales to feasibly finance the project ourselves. We play shows often, and though we get a fair amount of gigs with impressive attendance rates, the amount of money we actually get—as a young band who are new to the business—is currently negligible. And that's where you come in.

Our EP will include five original compositions, including "Groupie". We plan to record them with Alan Jones, who also produced our debut single. The project will then be mixed and mastered by Bob Stark. If you donate to our project, you can preorder a digital copy of the EP with liner notes that are not available with the iTunes download. We also have T-shirts with our customized logo, and an option to appear in our next video!

One of our goals as a band is to inspire more teen artists to commit to music as a professional career. The members of Boxing Day are extremely committed to their craft, with incredible ambition and a work ethic to match. We hope that any success we have will inspire and motivate other artistically inclined teenagers. We encourage you to contact us if you know of an opportunity to perform at a school or an event pertaining to the musical education of youth!

You can support us by coming to our shows, and following us on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter. Email us at gitfiddlemusic@gmail.com and we will add you to our newsletter where you can be notified of upcoming Boxing Day-related events!

story:
Summary

Founded in the fall of 2008, Clef Hangers is the premiere mixed a cappella group at Illinois State University. All current members of the group come from a variety of musical backgrounds and areas of study. 

This is our second year competing in ICCA and we really hope to show the hard work and dedication that has been put into creating this year's new set. We are coming back strong and don't want our efforts to be wasted just because we cannot afford the cost of travel. Any amount would be a huge help to us!!

 

What Your Money Goes To:

  • The ever-rising cost of gas
    • We have to take 3 separate cars to accommodate all of our members. We can't all squish into one car! We're musicians...not clowns!!
  • 1 night in a hotel 
    • Our quaterfinals are at Dekalb High School (about 2+ hours away) and it will get over pretty late. We would like to be able to afford a hotel to avoid dangerous late night driving back to ISU. 
  • Unexpected expenses! Oh no!
    • Emergencies and accidents happen. We would like to have a safety net to make sure everything runs smoothly at this year's ICCA! 

The Impact

The Clef Hangers have poured our hearts and souls into creating an experience that can only happen when competing at ICCA. We would like a chance to show the audience, the judges, and YOU how much passion and heart we put into every note sung in our set. 

 

Any little bit helps! 

"Maybe LOVE is the reason why!!"

Love, love.

-The ISU Clef Hangers
story_txt:
Summary
Founded in the fall of 2008, Clef Hangers is the premiere mixed a cappella group at Illinois State University. All current members of the group come from a variety of musical backgrounds and areas of study. 
This is our second year competing in ICCA and we really hope to show the hard work and dedication that has been put into creating this year's new set. We are coming back strong and don't want our efforts to be wasted just because we cannot afford the cost of travel. Any amount would be a huge help to us!!
 

What Your Money Goes To:

The ever-rising cost of gasWe have to take 3 separate cars to accommodate all of our members. We can't all squish into one car! We're musicians...not clowns!!

1 night in a hotel Our quaterfinals are at Dekalb High School (about 2+ hours away) and it will get over pretty late. We would like to be able to afford a hotel to avoid dangerous late night driving back to ISU. 

Unexpected expenses! Oh no!Emergencies and accidents happen. We would like to have a safety net to make sure everything runs smoothly at this year's ICCA! 



The Impact
The Clef Hangers have poured our hearts and souls into creating an experience that can only happen when competing at ICCA. We would like a chance to show the audience, the judges, and YOU how much passion and heart we put into every note sung in our set. 
 
Any little bit helps! 
"Maybe LOVE is the reason why!!"
Love, love.
-The ISU Clef Hangers

story:
Like A Child

Hey! I appreciate the time you're taking to get a better view of my heart and my project! I can't make this happen without you. :) My name is Marcus Akins and I am a worship leader, singer, songwriter and musician from Washington DC.
God gifted me with music at a very early age. I've been playing the piano since the age of 4 and I've been singing since before I can remember. My parents have always been intentional about instilling music inside of me. In high school, I began writing songs and once I graduated, I developed a love for music and writing that I've never let go. I absolutely love music and love communicating to others the songs that God has given me.
Three years ago I released my debut EP "The Pursuit of Hope". God allowed that album to open a lot of doors for me and to touch people worldwide. I have so many testimonies of how those songs gave unwavering hope to the listeners. My prayer is that God will use this new album to go even further and touch even more hearts. My heart's desire is that this record of 11 songs will release hope, joy and faith that will shift atmospheres and change lives.
Please consider sowing into this project. Anything you are able to give will help make my dream of seeing lives changed forever a reality.


What We Need

I need about $12,000 to fund this project. That amount includes: 
  1. Studio Costs-Tracking, mixing and mastering.
  2. Production-Additional production and arrangement in the studio.
  3. Musicians-Honoring those who play/sing on the record.
  4. Duplication/Online Distribution-Making physical copies of the album and distributing via iTunes, Amazon, Google Play, etc.
  5. Promotion-Album covers, design, branding, flyers, etc.

Rewards!! :)

This is the fun part!
  • CD (physical/digital) before the release!
  • Detailed story behind every song!
  • Videos of my creative process!
  • Songwriting tips!
  • Exclusive videos and performances!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Blasting this campaign EVERYWHERE! :)
  • Checking in on the campaign to see how its doing!
  • Praying that God would make all this happen
  • Blast. This. Campaign. EVERYWHERE! :)
For any other questions or details, please shoot an email to marcusakinsmusic@gmail.com.

T H A N K  Y O U !!!!

story:
2 for 1: Live video and single recording

  • Chasing Ebenezer is about music, community, and inspiring others to create.
  • We want to give you more music and a rockin' video.
  • As music fans, we love to watch videos from our favorite artists.

In this culture, videos open doors for more music. When we apply to perform at festivals and high profile venues, the first thing they want is a live music video to get the truest sense of our performance. Since we're recording a video, we figured, “Why not give our fans a high-quality single at the same time?”

It takes a team to fill the world with art, & we want to include you in our journey.

Many of you have been gracious in your support of us and our music endeavors, whether that's been financial help or volunteering your time and skills. It’s not easy for us to ask, but because you’ve been so supportive already, we feel encouraged to let you in on our goals. Our projected cost to bring you a high-quality live recording and companion video is $2,500, and we have a special perk for every giving level. Giving to this project will help us achieve our music dreams, and every contribution will be deeply meaningful to us.

About the Music

Chasing Ebenezer has a storehouse of music waiting to be recorded, as well as new songs in the works that we want you to hear. We chose to record "Say" because its folk-rock vibe is full of energy. We think you'll enjoy blasting it in your car.

Risks & Challenges

Creating quality music isn't cheap. We also care about using finances wisely, and for that reason, we don't take out debt to make our music. This also means we need help. You see, we really like to eat food and pay our bills, and we want to keep doing music, which is why we are asking for your support. If all our regular followers pitched in a few bucks, that would finance this project. So that's what we're doing. Not demanding, but humbly asking if you'll help us continue to create. Regardless of what comes in, we plan to complete this project, but we have learned that asking, giving, and receiving are vibrant essentials to community life.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't what it's all about. Here are other ways you can be part of the Chasing Ebenezer story:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Share about our debut album Outcasts & Refugees and other merchandise available on our online store.
  • If you know of a coffee shop, church, or venue that would like to host a concert, a songwriting clinic, or an art event, hook us up! Contact our manager/percussionist Bryan Atkinson at bryan@chasingebenezer.com

New to Indiegogo? 

If you have questions about backing or perks, please message us. Each perk has a limited supply, so lock in and select your perk of choice today!

Thanks for caring about music, and for caring about us. 

 

*Just a reminder that your generous donation is NOT considered a charitable deduction.

story:
Welcome to our mid-century mod full length vocal album!!!

 

After 19 albums, the Martini Kings, one of LA's most loved mid-century, mod bands, are heading into the studio in November to record the first full length vocal album featuring vocalist, actor, writer, Kate Campbell.  Kate has been the vocalist for the Martini King for the past several years!

 

Our 20th CD will feature a variety of bossa novas, ballads and swingin' original tunes written by band leader, Tony Marsico.

Our instrumentation leans on the retro classic 50's / 60's sound.

Our band consists of vocals,vibes, piano,upright bass, drums, percussion and horns. All funds raised will cover the full productions costs , engineering, producing, and studio rentals.

And if you can't pledge, no problem! Please take a moment to share and spread the word!!!

 

We appreciate your support!!! And we're so excited to share these original songs with you!!!

story:
My Story!

I've been singing for as long as I can remember. Music has always been my greatest passion and a light in the darkest times of my life. Songwriting began for me in 2009, when I was diagnosed with Crohn's Disease. I spent all of a year in and out of the hospital, and wasn't well enough to leave my home. I began writing music as a distraction and a way to process my emotions, and I've continued ever since. In 2014, I was lucky enough to meet two incredible musicians on the app Vine, and we formed the band Dear Ears. Since then, we have released one album, four music videos, and began working on a second album for this coming year. I am so fortunate for the experience this band has given and continues to give me—Without it, I wouldn't have the skills or the courage to release anything on my own.

 

Which brings us to my current goal! I have always dreamed of recording a solo album, but I lacked the experience, the knowledge, and the confidence to go out on a limb by myself. I wanted to be sure that I knew my own sound so that I could create something that felt like an extension of myself. My love of folk music undoubtably stems from my southern upbringing, and I wanted to combine that with other genres I find myself drawn to: Americana, psychedelia, blues, etc. Through researching, writing, and losing sleep, I was able to uncover the artist I want to be.

 

So now, I'm ready. I am going to achieve this dream, and I cannot thank you enough for supporting me along the way.

How You're Helping!

You are an ANGEL for helping me make this dream a reality! By pre-ordering this EP, you are helping make it happen. Here is what your pre-order money is going towards:

  • Studio time
  • Production and instrumentation
  • Mixing and Mastering
  • Additional recording of my first Single 'I Don't Feel Anything' 
  • Music video for 'I Don't Feel Anything' 
     

Other Ways You Can Help!

You don't have to pre-order! You can also help by:

  • Spreading the word about 'For Ghosts'
  • Sharing the pre-order link
  • Believing in me!

And that's all there is to it. Thank you again. So so so much. I love you.

story:
My Mission and Appreciation

Music has been in my life for as long as I can remember in one way or another.  I grew up singing in choirs, playing in concert bands and orchestras, and eventually recording and touring the world with rock bands.  It is probably how I know many of you.

Over the last few years music has taken a backseat in my life, but at the start of 2020 I decided that this would be the year I would return to it.

I purchased a bunch of equipment and began making collaborations with friends from all around to help build up my musical confidence, ability to write, arrange, and perform.  

I didn't know it immediately, but this was a preparation for my true calling which is to make an album - an album that represents me as an individual.  Music means everything to me and I enjoy all styles; I have an appreciation for the art. 

This record will take all of my influences and put them together in a way that encapsulates my true being, as music is who I am.

I believe that creating music is the reason I am here.  It is probably what I am best at, and for me putting together this record is a dream.

I'll be occasionally documenting my process throughout and I am making a promise to myself that creating this record will be the most worthwhile project of my life.

Thank you in advance for helping me, and contributing to one of my life's goals.

It means more to me than words can ever truly express.

story:
Hello, my name is Iain Howie. I'm a 26 year old producer-singer-songwriter from Vancouver, B.C.  I've been making music for eleven years.  I have an amazing and loyal local fan base that I'm grateful for.  I've released EP's on a number of international indie labels including London's Needwant and Berlin's Rhombus. Here are some reviews of my music: 

"A gorgeous new EP " - XLR8R  

"A love for songwriting and brooding beats runs in the family" - Vice 

“Unmistakenly modern dance music, bursting at the seams with melancholic despair” - ADSR Collective

"A highly-polished and very individual brand of minimal deep house.” - Georgia Straight

WHY CROWDFUND? 

Two years ago, after nearly a decade of producing dance music, I shifted my focus to songwriting. As the result of hard work and some good luck, I was recently offered recording contracts by a couple notable labels. While flattering on the surface these deals were less kind to my independence as they required me to sign away 50-100% of my copyrights.  Still, I'm fortunate to be making music in an era where amazing technology and artist friendly platforms (Ableton, Bandcamp, Indiegogo, etc) give me a fighting chance to define success on my own terms. This is a privilege that most musicians before me did not have and one which I wholeheartedly pursue. Your funding will allow me to launch my solo career while retaining 100% of my art.

ABOUT THE ALBUM

Patterns is the result of my exploration into songwriting.  While the themes in my music are all extremely personal, I believe a lot of them are universal. I’m writing about what it’s like to be a young person in today’s world. I’m 26, addicted to my phone and social media while living in the midst of a pandemic. It’s easy to feel anxious and depressed. I know I’m not the only one going through this. I hope my songs can provide some sort of solace for people that feel the same way. People need to know that it's okay and that we will get through this. 

HOW WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION HELP ME? 

Your contribution will: 

1 - Help me to finish recording my debut album, Patterns.

2 - Help me to release it world-wide with an impactful, realistic marketing campaign.

3 - Launch the career of a proud Canadian artist on to the international stage.

What I Need

My funding goal is broken down in to five steps. Each step builds upon the previous one and has been strategically selected by my management team. Together (and on their own) these steps will create the most impactful release campaign within the given budget.  

What You Get

When you contribute any amount to my campaign you become part of a community that believes in supporting independent creators.  You'll be added to my Indiegogo mailing list and receive regular updates, including the same marketing plan that my team and I use. You'll receive behind the scenes video footage and regular updates from the road.  You also get a cool perk :) 

PERKS - HOW THEY WORK

1. You buy a perk.

2. Your money is deposited in to my Indiegogo account.

3. My team and I use this money to fund each marketing initiative (aka each step).  

There is a perk for all budgets. For $5 you can pre-stream my singles Patterns or Leaf Syndrome (a full two months ahead of release). For $20 you can pre-order the Patterns album + pre-stream the Patterns single. For $250 you can throw a livestream party with me as your personal DJ.  Perks also make a great gift for family and friends. No matter the size or cost of the perk every dollar will be put to good use.

Your Perk Will Help To Fund The Following: 

 

STEP 1: ART DIRECTION & PHOTOGRAPHY

Artwork - Akiko Nakayama 

Art Direction for the campaign features original work by Akiko Nakayama.  Akiko is quickly becoming one of Japan's most acclaimed visual artists. She has agreed to create a series of original pieces to be used across the Patterns campaign. This includes artwork for three singles, the album and two music videos. 
 

Photography - Trevor Brady 

    Acclaimed fashion photographer Trevor Brady will shoot the stills for the campaign. His work has been featured in Cosmo, Dazed, Glamour, Harper's Bazaar,  ID, Interview, Nylon, Vanity Fair, Vice, Vogue and Wallpaper.  Celebrity clients include Tegan & Sara, Lily Allen, Brad Wilk, Tiera Skovbye, Lights and more. I hope to never release an album without him.  Both Akiko and Trevor have offered their services for well below their day rates. I'm forever grateful for their generosity and support. 

      COST: $2,500 

       

      STEP 2:  COLLEGE RADIO 

      College Radio is the building block of any successful indie artist. It's where many alternative artists first find national exposure.  I'm thrilled that Frontside Promotion has agreed to champion my debut album at college radio across the US/Canada.  Geoff and his team  choose to only work with artists that they feel have a legitimate chance of finding college support. Sadly, this is not the industry standard.  James Blake, Finneas, Flume and Grimes are just some of the acts that Frontside works with.  I could not ask for a more credible introduction to the tastemakers at college radio. 

      COLLEGE RADIO SCHEDULE 

      April 23, 2021 - Patterns + Leaf Syndrome 

      June 11th, 2021 -  Patterns full album 

      COST (Phase 1/2): $3,500

       

      STEP 3: MUSIC VIDEO x 2

       

       

      A compelling music video can help propel a song to new heights and this is the plan with the videos for Shift and Patterns. Both will feature the "Alive Painting" technique perfected by Akiko Nakayama.

      The video for Shift,  (the album's only non-vocal track) will feature a magical, pulsating performance of paint, light and sound. The Patterns video will feature footage of myself set within Akiko's visual world and will blur the boundaries between art and performance.  The top image was taken during a proof of concept test. 

      The videos will be delivered to YouTube, VEVO, TIDAL, Apple Music and Facebook by Symphonic Distribution.  My management team will focus on promoting the video to music websites, blogs and journalists.  They will also look to partner with a media partner for the exclusive premiere of each video. 

      Shift video: April 23rd, 2021 

      Patterns video: June 18th, 2021

      COST: $3,500

       

      STEP 4: DIGITAL CONTENT 

      Funding for this step will go toward the creation of original shot short form video content. The talented team at Sybuk Media (producers of my Indiegogo video) will create a total of ten short-form (:15 - :60 sec) videos.  These will be used to drive awareness around each single release and to create a deeper visual world for the album.  They will be multi-purposed for use across social media, streaming + video partners, newsletters, press and college radio. 

      COST: $2,800

       

      STEP 5: DIGITAL MARKETING 

      Found.ee is used by the likes of St.Vincent, Flying Lotus, Zola Jesus, Denzel Curry and most record labels.  It's a powerful, clever and budget friendly music marketing platform which my team will get my music/videos in front of the right people at the right time (those in search of music ie. who opt in)  The majority of funding for this step will pay for the purchase and placement of "Streaming Banner Ads" on highly influential music blogs including Pitchfork, Rolling Stone and NME.

      COST: $2,500

       

      MY TOTAL FUNDING GOAL:

      $16,500 CAD 

       

      EXECUTION - MY TEAM

      To quote Steve Jobs, "Ideas are worth nothing unless executed".  My funding campaign will be executed by the very capable team at Block Sound Mgmt headed by my manager, Daniel Cutler, co-founder of Arts & Crafts.  Daniel has helped launch the careers of indie rock royalty (Broken Social Scene, Feist, Stars) and has led major label marketing campaigns for the likes of Daft Punk, Chemical Brothers and David Bowie.  On the distribution front, the incredible team at Symphonic will handle my digital distribution and will pitch my songs/videos directly to Spotify, Apple and other major digital release partners.  Symphonic has offices in NYC, Denver, Nashville, Tampa Bay, Sao Paulo and Bogota. 

      Risks & Challenges

      There's no denying the music industry is full of risk. Music, like most art, is a purely speculative endeavour and there's no shortage of talented artists vying for your attention.  As uphill as this sounds, I find hope in a piece of advice my brother Tom once gave me: “Focus on the music and everything else will fall into place.”  

      Last but not least! If you're not able to make a financial contribution, you can still help by sharing this campaign on social media such as Instagram, Facebook, Twitter. You can use the handy Indiegogo share tools available on the top of this page.

      Thank-you for your support, it means the world to me :)

WHY CROWDFUND? 

Two years ago, after nearly a decade of producing dance music, I shifted my focus to songwriting. As the result of hard work and some good luck, I was recently offered recording contracts by a couple notable labels. While flattering on the surface these deals were less kind to my independence as they required me to sign away 50-100% of my copyrights.  Still, I'm fortunate to be making music in an era where amazing technology and artist friendly platforms (Ableton, Bandcamp, Indiegogo, etc) give me a fighting chance to define success on my own terms. This is a privilege that most musicians before me did not have and one which I wholeheartedly pursue. Your funding will allow me to launch my solo career while retaining 100% of my art.
ABOUT THE ALBUM

Patterns is the result of my exploration into songwriting.  While the themes in my music are all extremely personal, I believe a lot of them are universal. I’m writing about what it’s like to be a young person in today’s world. I’m 26, addicted to my phone and social media while living in the midst of a pandemic. It’s easy to feel anxious and depressed. I know I’m not the only one going through this. I hope my songs can provide some sort of solace for people that feel the same way. People need to know that it's okay and that we will get through this. 
HOW WILL YOUR CONTRIBUTION HELP ME? 
Your contribution will: 
1 - Help me to finish recording my debut album, Patterns.
2 - Help me to release it world-wide with an impactful, realistic marketing campaign.
3 - Launch the career of a proud Canadian artist on to the international stage.

What I Need
My funding goal is broken down in to five steps. Each step builds upon the previous one and has been strategically selected by my management team. Together (and on their own) these steps will create the most impactful release campaign within the given budget.  
What You Get
When you contribute any amount to my campaign you become part of a community that believes in supporting independent creators.  You'll be added to my Indiegogo mailing list and receive regular updates, including the same marketing plan that my team and I use. You'll receive behind the scenes video footage and regular updates from the road.  You also get a cool perk :) 
PERKS - HOW THEY WORK
1. You buy a perk.
2. Your money is deposited in to my Indiegogo account.
3. My team and I use this money to fund each marketing initiative (aka each step).  
There is a perk for all budgets. For $5 you can pre-stream my singles Patterns or Leaf Syndrome (a full two months ahead of release). For $20 you can pre-order the Patterns album + pre-stream the Patterns single. For $250 you can throw a livestream party with me as your personal DJ.  Perks also make a great gift for family and friends. No matter the size or cost of the perk every dollar will be put to good use.
Your Perk Will Help To Fund The Following: 
 
STEP 1: ART DIRECTION & PHOTOGRAPHY
Artwork - Akiko Nakayama 

Art Direction for the campaign features original work by Akiko Nakayama.  Akiko is quickly becoming one of Japan's most acclaimed visual artists. She has agreed to create a series of original pieces to be used across the Patterns campaign. This includes artwork for three singles, the album and two music videos. 
 
Photography - Trevor Brady 


Acclaimed fashion photographer Trevor Brady will shoot the stills for the campaign. His work has been featured in Cosmo, Dazed, Glamour, Harper's Bazaar,  ID, Interview, Nylon, Vanity Fair, Vice, Vogue and Wallpaper.  Celebrity clients include Tegan & Sara, Lily Allen, Brad Wilk, Tiera Skovbye, Lights and more. I hope to never release an album without him.  Both Akiko and Trevor have offered their services for well below their day rates. I'm forever grateful for their generosity and support. 

COST: $2,500 
 
STEP 2:  COLLEGE RADIO 


College Radio is the building block of any successful indie artist. It's where many alternative artists first find national exposure.  I'm thrilled that Frontside Promotion has agreed to champion my debut album at college radio across the US/Canada.  Geoff and his team  choose to only work with artists that they feel have a legitimate chance of finding college support. Sadly, this is not the industry standard.  James Blake, Finneas, Flume and Grimes are just some of the acts that Frontside works with.  I could not ask for a more credible introduction to the tastemakers at college radio. 
COLLEGE RADIO SCHEDULE 
April 23, 2021 - Patterns + Leaf Syndrome 
June 11th, 2021 -  Patterns full album 
COST (Phase 1/2): $3,500
 
STEP 3: MUSIC VIDEO x 2


 


 
A compelling music video can help propel a song to new heights and this is the plan with the videos for Shift and Patterns. Both will feature the "Alive Painting" technique perfected by Akiko Nakayama.
The video for Shift,  (the album's only non-vocal track) will feature a magical, pulsating performance of paint, light and sound. The Patterns video will feature footage of myself set within Akiko's visual world and will blur the boundaries between art and performance.  The top image was taken during a proof of concept test. 
The videos will be delivered to YouTube, VEVO, TIDAL, Apple Music and Facebook by Symphonic Distribution.  My management team will focus on promoting the video to music websites, blogs and journalists.  They will also look to partner with a media partner for the exclusive premiere of each video. 
Shift video: April 23rd, 2021 
Patterns video: June 18th, 2021
COST: $3,500
 
STEP 4: DIGITAL CONTENT 

Funding for this step will go toward the creation of original shot short form video content. The talented team at Sybuk Media (producers of my Indiegogo video) will create a total of ten short-form (:15 - :60 sec) videos.  These will be used to drive awareness around each single release and to create a deeper visual world for the album.  They will be multi-purposed for use across social media, streaming + video partners, newsletters, press and college radio. 
COST: $2,800
 
STEP 5: DIGITAL MARKETING 

Found.ee is used by the likes of St.Vincent, Flying Lotus, Zola Jesus, Denzel Curry and most record labels.  It's a powerful, clever and budget friendly music marketing platform which my team will get my music/videos in front of the right people at the right time (those in search of music ie. who opt in)  The majority of funding for this step will pay for the purchase and placement of "Streaming Banner Ads" on highly influential music blogs including Pitchfork, Rolling Stone and NME.
COST: $2,500
 
MY TOTAL FUNDING GOAL:
$16,500 CAD 
 

EXECUTION - MY TEAM

To quote Steve Jobs, "Ideas are worth nothing unless executed".  My funding campaign will be executed by the very capable team at Block Sound Mgmt headed by my manager, Daniel Cutler, co-founder of Arts & Crafts.  Daniel has helped launch the careers of indie rock royalty (Broken Social Scene, Feist, Stars) and has led major label marketing campaigns for the likes of Daft Punk, Chemical Brothers and David Bowie.  On the distribution front, the incredible team at Symphonic will handle my digital distribution and will pitch my songs/videos directly to Spotify, Apple and other major digital release partners.  Symphonic has offices in NYC, Denver, Nashville, Tampa Bay, Sao Paulo and Bogota. 

Risks & Challenges
There's no denying the music industry is full of risk. Music, like most art, is a purely speculative endeavour and there's no shortage of talented artists vying for your attention.  As uphill as this sounds, I find hope in a piece of advice my brother Tom once gave me: “Focus on the music and everything else will fall into place.”  

Last but not least! If you're not able to make a financial contribution, you can still help by sharing this campaign on social media such as Instagram, Facebook, Twitter. You can use the handy Indiegogo share tools available on the top of this page.
Thank-you for your support, it means the world to me :)

story:
Cara e caro amante della musica, dierbare muziekliefhebber, dear lover of music,

 

il mio nome è A.J. Lamaker, nome d'arte Bart Watt. Sono un cantante olandese ma vivo in Italia da più di dieci anni. Ho cominciato, come tutti, reinterpretando brani dei miei artisti preferiti, per poi passare alla scrittura, soprattutto negli ultimi anni, di molte canzoni originali. Durante il lockdown dovuto al coronavirus ho deciso di voler lasciare una traccia tangibile del mio lavoro e questo mi ha spinto a contattare Davide Martiello, musicista e compositore fiorentino. Sono lieto di aver cominciato questa collaborazione. “A Violet Dark” è il primo frutto di questo incontro. Anche Rosa Mulder, una cantante olandese, parteciperà. Nei prossimi mesi saremo impegnati con la registrazione dell’album, che verrà alla luce alla fine di gennaio 2021. L’album, dal titolo “Searching for Dolphins”, ispirato ad una canzone di Fred Neil, “The Dolphins”, è sia un autoritratto sia un documento sulle persone a cui mi sono legato, spesso a loro insaputa.

Chiedo gentilmente il tuo aiuto nella realizzazione di questo album. Il budget di cui abbiamo bisogno è di 4500 euro, con i quali copriremo i costi di produzione, di pubblicazione e di spedizione. Ti ringrazio anticipatamente per contribuire a realizzare il mio sogno.

Bart Watt su YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCS_1epSXTaTev8DVng695Tg

Davide Martiello su Soundcloud e Bandcamp: https://soundcloud.com/davide-martiello-385275407?ref=clipboard e  https://davidemartiello.bandcamp.com/releases

 

mijn naam is Bart Watt. Ik woon al meer dan tien jaar in Italië en zing al meer dan vijftien jaar. In het begin speelde ik alleen nummers van mijn favoriete artiesten, maar de laatste jaren heb ik veel eigen nummers geschreven. Tijdens de lockdown als gevolg van het coronavirus heb ik besloten dat ik deze liedjes, die me door de jaren heen hebben vergezeld, wilde vastleggen. Dit heeft me ertoe gebracht om contact op te nemen met Davide Martiello, een Florentijnse muzikant en componist. Hoewel we pas sinds kort samenwerken, ben ik erg blij. Het nummer dat je op deze pagina kunt beluisteren heet 'A voilet dark' en is de eerste vrucht van onze samenwerking. Rosa Mulder, een zangeres uit Nederland, zal ook een bijdrage leveren aan sommige nummers. De komende maanden willen we het album opnemen en het zal eind januari 2021 worden uitgebracht. Het album gaat 'Searching for Dolphins' heten. Deze titel is ontleend aan een zin uit een nummer van Fred Neil, 'Dolphins'. Het album is voor een klein deel een zelfportret en voor een groot deel een document over mensen aan wie ik mij gehecht heb, vaak zonder hun medeweten.

Ik vraag u vriendelijk om uw steun. Het budget dat we nodig hebben is 4500 euro, waarmee we alle kosten voor de realisatie van het album (kosten voor de opname, productie, verzending, etc.) kunnen dekken. Bij voorbaat hartelijk dank voor je bijdrage en ik hoop je een mooi album toe te sturen.

Bart Watt op YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCS_1epSXTaTev8DVng695Tg

Davide Martiello op Soundcloud en Bandcamp: https://soundcloud.com/davide-martiello-385275407?ref=clipboard en  https://davidemartiello.bandcamp.com/releases

 

my name is Bart Watt. I live in Italy for more than ten years and have been singing for more than fifteen. At first I only played covers, but in the last few years I have written a lot of original songs. During the coronavirus lockdown I've decided that I want to record these songs that have accompanied me over the years. This prompted me to contact Davide Martiello, a Florentine musician and composer. Although we have only recently started working together, I am delighted. The song you can listen to on this page is called “A Voilet Dark” and is the first fruit of our collaboration. Also Rosa Mulder, a Dutch singer, will join us. In the coming months we will record the album that will be released at the end of January. The album will be called “Searching for Dolphins”. This title is taken from a phrase from a Fred Neil song, “The Dolphins”. The album is in part a self-portrait and in large part a document about people to whom I have attached myself to, often without their knowledge.

The budget we need is 4500 euros, with which we hope to cover all costs for the realization of the album (recording of the songs, the production, the sending, etc.). Thank you very much in advance for your contribution and I hope to send you a nice album.

 

Bart Watt on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCS_1epSXTaTev8DVng695Tg

Davide Martiello on Soundcloud and Bandcamp: https://soundcloud.com/davide-martiello-385275407?ref=clipboard and  https://davidemartiello.bandcamp.com/releases

story:
For the last two years the Naomi Ashley Band has been playing Last Wednesdays at Wire, a monthly residency in the intimate front bar at Wire in Berwyn, IL. It has become the highlight of my month, every month. At some point along the way Last Wednesdays turned into a way for band & audience to connect, laugh and partake in the soul-restoring power of music. I have always wished there was a way to bottle up the experience of those Wednesdays that I could share or just take out when I needed a lift. I think this live record is the next best thing.

LAST WEDNESDAYS LIVE is a lovingly produced selection of some our favorite originals & covers recorded at our Last Wednesday residency at over the course of 2018. Recorded by Michael Krayniak, mixed by Jon Smith, Retro Room, mastered by Blaise Barton, Joyride Studios with cover design by Cathie Van Wert. This great sounding record is a celebration of our collaboration with each other, the venue and our Last Wednesday audience. A gift for us that we can share with all of you!

We are doing a LIMITED RUN of CD’s, so the best way to ensure a copy is to PRE-ORDER. All pre-orders receive a download of an *Exclusive Bonus Track* not available on the record and free shipping within the USA!

Thank you for your support. See ya next Last Wednesday.

All the best,

Naomi

*****

The Naomi Ashley Band is:

Naomi Ashley - vocals
Andon Davis - guitar
Cathie Van Wert - fiddle
Michael Krayniak - bass
Paul Bivans - drums

story:
Who am I & What Am I Doing?

Hello All! You all may know me as “that Toronto flute girl”. My actual name is Alissa Skorik, and I have been playing the Native American Spirit Flute for just under 10 years. I began by learning the traditional methods of improvisation and calm meditative music. However, as I got older I noticed two things: 1) No one knew what instrument I was playing – not a single gig went by without someone complimenting my “recorder”. 2) My peers were not getting engaged by the instrument I was playing because the sound was to calm and fluid for their taste. Long story short – meditation music was not putting butts in seats at a club and the Native American Spirit Flute was being overlooked.

So, I decided to change that! I began to express myself through trance and dance music with the Native American Spirit Flute at the center of it all. “Lacuna” was a labor of love created from a place of personal healing and wanting to express feelings that cannot be verbalized. The result? Music which hopefully will help bring the Native American Spirit Flute into Canadas musical conversation from a whole new angle.*

As contributors to this campaign, you would be backing something simultaneously very personal, and very political. Lacuna represents not only my personal journey but also the diversity of a dying and wrongly forgotten core Indigenous Canadian instrument. Supporting this album is more than supporting the music or me as an artist – it’s about supporting and shining a light on a culture and music that has been so methodically destroyed by Canada's current and historical decisions.

So, what am I asking for and why?

Obviously, this is a crowd funder – so I am looking financial backing. However, not everyone can donate and that’s totally understandable! If you are unable to contribute, spreading the word would be greatly appreciated!

For those who would like to contribute, please find a layout of the budget below.

  • Digital distribution- 84.75$. This allows me to license the music and distribute it on platforms such as Apple Music, Spotify, Google Play and more.
  • Digital Cover Art – 200$. I don’t believe in ripping off graphic artists
  • Radio Tracking – 1500$. This allows my music to be distributed and played on air, allowing me to pay all the people who have thus far volunteered on this project free of charge. Some of these people include my producers and co-writers.
  • Indigogo fees – 5% or 89.25$
  • Total with fees = 1875$

In advance, I would like to thank everyone who shares and supports this campaign. I understand that there are thousands of Canadian music projects being crowdfunded at any given minute –  your choice to support this one does not go unnoticed or unacknowledged. In fact, it means the world to me.

 

Very gratefully and sincerely yours.

-Alissa Skorik.

 

*I would like to make a footnote and add that I do not identify as a member of the indigenous community.

story:
Hello my friends,

Hallo meine Freunde,
 

My name is Morgan Finlay and I am an Irish-Canadian singer-songwriter from Vancouver. Over the past fifteen years of my pro career, I have played over seven hundred shows internationally, released six full length albums, and travelled many thousands of kilometres.

Mein Name ist Morgan Finlay und ich bin ein irisch-kanadischer Singer-Songwriter aus Vancouver. Im Laufe der letzten 15 Jahre meiner professionellen Karriere habe ich auf internationalen Bühnen über 700 Shows gespielt und sechs Alben veröffentlicht. Außerdem bin ich tausende von Kilometern gereist.
 

In spring 2018, the path that has taken me from western Canada to southern Spain, will bring me to northern Germany to one of the world’s most exciting harbour cities; Hamburg! After the success of my last two albums, I feel like the time is right to create a very deliberate album in what will be my new hometown.

Mein Weg führte mich bereits von Westkanada nach Südspanien. Jetzt geht es weiter. Im Frühjahr 2018 komme ich in Norddeutschland, genauer einer der aufregendsten Hafenstädte der Welt, an: Hamburg! Nach dem Erfolg meiner letzten zwei Alben, habe ich jetzt das Gefühl, dass die Zeit reif ist, in meiner neuen Heimatstadt ein sorgfältig durchdachtes Album entstehen zu lassen.
 

To support the new album, and recharge my YouTube channel I also want to make an exciting video from one of the new songs, that will capture my first steps in the city, and help more music listeners to find my songs on the internet.

Nicht nur, um mein Album visuell zu unterstützen sondern auch, um meinem YouTube-Kanal mit neues Leben einzuhauchen, möchte ich ein hammer Video zu einem der neuen Lieder drehen. Es wird mich auf meinen ersten Schritten in Hamburg begleiten und darüber hinaus werden mehr Musikbegeisterte mit meiner Musik erreicht.
 

In order to make this happen, I need your support. To pay for the album and video, and professional promotion to spread the word, I need to raise 12,000€.

Damit ich all das bewerkstelligen kann, brauche ich Deine Unterstützung. Um sowohl für Album und Video als auch für deren professionelle Promotion aufzukommen, muss ich eine Summe von 12.000 € aufbringen.
 

The Plan Breakdown, and What It Costs

Einzelheiten und was es kosten wird
 

My plan is to write thirty demos, and give you the chance to vote for your favourites in March 2018. Then, two months later on May 1st, I will release a ten-song album with a seventy-five page album booklet— my biggest book yet! 

Mein Plan sieht folgendermaßen aus: Ich werde 30 Demos schreiben und Dir im März 2018 die Chance zu geben, für Deine Favoriten abzustimmen. Zwei Monate später, am 1. Mai, werde ich dann ein Album mit zehn Liedern und ein 75 Seiten starkes Album-Booklet veröffentlichen - mein bisher umfangreichstes Buch! 
 

From the ten songs that are voted to make the new album’s tracklist, I will choose one song that will be made into a feature video that will be shot and produced in Hamburg by an independent film maker, and released to my YouTube channel on June 1st. 

Aus den 10 von Dir gewählten Songs, werde ich ein Lied auswählen, zu dem ein Video entstehen wird. Dieses Video wird von einem freien Filmemacher in Hamburg produziert und am 1. Juni auf meinem YouTube-Kanal veröffentlicht. 
 

Breakdown of my 12,000€ budget:

Einzelheiten des 12.000€ Budgets:
 

recording studio/equipment rental - Miete für Studio und Equipment: 1,250€

players fees - Gage der Musiker: 1,500€

album mixing - Mixen des Albums: 1,000€

album mastering - Mastern des Albums: 500€

photography costs - Gage für Fotografen: 750€

graphic design - Graphische Gestaltung: 1,500€

booklet and sticker printing - Druck der Bücher und Aufkleber​: 1,500€

video production costs - Videoproduktionskosten: 2,000€

publicity and advertising efforts - Veröffentlichung und Werbemaßnahmen: 2,000€

Any money that is raised beyond my campaign goal will be put towards the video budget, and increased online promotion.

Alle Geldspenden, die über mein veranschlagtes Ziel hinausgehen, kommen dem Budget für das Video und eine bessere Vermarktung zugute. 
 

How To Get Involved

Wie Du dich beteiligen kannst
 

By purchasing a perk, you will be shaping the success of this milestone Hamburg album and video project! There is something for everyone in the perks list; from albums, to t-shirts and hoodies, to custom-written songs, house concerts and even the chance to own the Seagull guitar that I started my career on, and then brought to Europe on my first tour in April 2005.

Indem Du ein Dankeschön erstehst, kannst Du den Erfolg dieses hamburger Albums und des Videoprojekts entscheidend mit gestalten! In der Liste mit Dankeschöns ist für jeden etwas dabei; angefangen bei Alben, über T-Shirts und Hoodies, bis hin zu eigens für Dich geschriebenen Songs und Wohnzimmerkonzerten. Dieses mal gibt es sogar die Möglichkeit meine erste Seagull Gitarre zu besitzen. Mit dieser Gitarre begann ich meine Karriere. Ich brachte sie im April 2005 zu meiner ersten in Europa mit.
 

Everyone who buys a perk in the campaign will first receive a ‘perk certificate’ in the mail, as a confirmation of your support, and will also see their name written in the Hamburg album booklet. The perks that you purchase will then be delivered to you in the month of May 2018, with the album’s release.

Mit dem Kauf eines Dankeschöns aus der Kampagne, erhältst Du zunächst ein ‘Dankeschön Zertifikat’ als Bestätigung für deine Unterstützung per Post; Zusätzlich wird Dein Name in meinem Buch zu diesem Meilenstein-Album erscheinen. Die von Dir erstandenen Dankeschöns werden dann zum Veröffentlichungsdatum des Albums im Mai 2018 zu Dir geschickt.
 

If you order a perk as a Christmas gift for someone special before December 20th, a perk certificate will come in the mail in a special envelope that you can put under the Christmas tree!

Wenn Du noch vor dem 20. Dezember ein Dankeschön als Weihnachtsgeschenk für jemand ganz besonderen bestellst, schicken wir Dir das ‘Dankeschön Zertifikat’ in einem stylischen Umschlag, den Du direkt unter den Weihnachtsbaum legen kannst!
 

photo ©2017 Der Gestalter

The Difference YOU Make

DU machst den Unterschied
 

As you know if you’ve been watching my career in the last six years, people power is one of my greatest strengths. Since 2011, my team and I have run three successful campaigns; the first was for the ‘Latitude’ album and tour (113% funded); the second was to create the ‘Fault Lines’ album and pay for the following tour (161% funded); and most recently, in 2015 to create and record ‘New Harbour’, in Newfoundland (149% funded). 

Wie du sicher weißt, wenn du meine Karriere in den letzten sechs Jahren verfolgt hast, ist die gemeinsame Kraft der Menschen eine meiner größten Verbündeten. Seit 2011 haben mein Team und Ich drei erfolgreiche Kampagnen geleitet; die Erste finanzierte mein Album ‘Latitude’ incl. Tour (zu 113%); durch die zweite entstand das Album ‘Fault Lines’ und sie bezahlte die folgende Tour (zu 161% finanziert); und 2015 konnte Ich mein Album ‘New Harbour’, in Neufundland schreiben und aufnehmen (Finanzierung: 149%).
 

I couldn't have released these albums, or achieved these successes, without you. I don’t have a record label, and I don’t need one... because I HAVE a contract! And it is an unspoken agreement with you.

Ohne Dich hätte Ich diese Alben nicht produzieren können, auch diese Erfolge hätte ich nicht gefeiert. Ich habe keinen Plattenvertrag, ich brauche auch keins… denn Ich HABE bereite einen Vertrag! Es ist eine unausgesprochene Übereinkunft mit Dir.
 

Here are the terms of what I like to call a ‘fundamental contract’ that I promise to deliver to you, my supporter and listener:

Hier sind die Einzelheiten dessen, was ich als ‘grundlegenden Vertrag’ bezeichne. Er ist mein Versprechen, dass ich Dir, meinem Unterstützer und Zuhörer, gebe:
 

I promise to create and produce this Hamburg album and video, and to make every effort to bring together the best album and video that I can.

Ich verspreche, dieses Hamburgalbum zu kreieren und produzieren und alles in meiner Macht stehende zu tun, um das beste Album und Video hervorzubringen.
 

I promise to offer you the chance to vote on which songs you think are best, from the demos that I will write for the album.

Ich verspreche, Dir die Chance zu geben, für die Lieder abzustimmen, die Du für die besten hälst. Du wählst aus den Demos, die ich für das Album schreiben werde.
 

I promise to continue to arrange tours, to bring these songs out on the road and closer to you.

Ich verspreche, auch weiterhin auf Tour zu gehen, um diese Songs in die Welt und damit zu dir zu tragen.
 

I promise to give everything I have, every time I go onstage.

Ich verspreche, alles zu geben was Ich habe, jedes Mal, wenn ich auf die Bühne gehe.
 

There Are Other Ways You Can Help

Wie Du darüber hinaus helfen kannst
 

Whether you are able to support my Hamburg campaign or not, you can still help! Just by sharing the word on your social networks, or otherwise telling people about this campaign, you will be helping me to make this album and video project come true. The share buttons, to your favourite social networks, are easy to find directly under the video above.

Ganz gleich, ob du meine Hamburgkampagne unterstützen kannst oder nicht, du kannst mir dennoch helfen! Teile einfach dieses Crowdfunding-Projekt in den dir zur Verfügung stehenden sozialen Netzwerken, oder erzähle jedem von dieser Kampagne. Allein dadurch hilfst Du mir schon, dieses Album- und Videoprojekt wahr werden zu lassen. Die Share-Buttons zu Deinen Lieblingsnetzwerken sind leicht unter dem oben angezeigten Video zu finden.
 

More updates are coming, as the journey to Hamburg takes shape. Thank you so much for being there with me on this important new adventure!

Ich werde Dich mit Updates auf dem Laufenden halten, sobald die Reise nach Hamburg weiter Gestalt annimmt. Vielen lieben Dank dafür, dass Du dieses aufregende, wichtige, neue Abenteuer mit mir gehst!
 

Truly, Morgan

Euer Morgan
 

Photos ©2017 Michael Schiller except where otherwise marked

Alle Fotos © 2017 Michael Schiller außer wenn anderweitig vermerkt
story_txt:
Hello my friends,Hallo meine Freunde, My name is Morgan Finlay and I am an Irish-Canadian singer-songwriter from Vancouver. Over the past fifteen years of my pro career, I have played over seven hundred shows internationally, released six full length albums, and travelled many thousands of kilometres.Mein Name ist Morgan Finlay und ich bin ein irisch-kanadischer Singer-Songwriter aus Vancouver. Im Laufe der letzten 15 Jahre meiner professionellen Karriere habe ich auf internationalen Bühnen über 700 Shows gespielt und sechs Alben veröffentlicht. Außerdem bin ich tausende von Kilometern gereist. In spring 2018, the path that has taken me from western Canada to southern Spain, will bring me to northern Germany to one of the world’s most exciting harbour cities; Hamburg! After the success of my last two albums, I feel like the time is right to create a very deliberate album in what will be my new hometown.Mein Weg führte mich bereits von Westkanada nach Südspanien. Jetzt geht es weiter. Im Frühjahr 2018 komme ich in Norddeutschland, genauer einer der aufregendsten Hafenstädte der Welt, an: Hamburg! Nach dem Erfolg meiner letzten zwei Alben, habe ich jetzt das Gefühl, dass die Zeit reif ist, in meiner neuen Heimatstadt ein sorgfältig durchdachtes Album entstehen zu lassen. To support the new album, and recharge my YouTube channel I also want to make an exciting video from one of the new songs, that will capture my first steps in the city, and help more music listeners to find my songs on the internet.Nicht nur, um mein Album visuell zu unterstützen sondern auch, um meinem YouTube-Kanal mit neues Leben einzuhauchen, möchte ich ein hammer Video zu einem der neuen Lieder drehen. Es wird mich auf meinen ersten Schritten in Hamburg begleiten und darüber hinaus werden mehr Musikbegeisterte mit meiner Musik erreicht. In order to make this happen, I need your support. To pay for the album and video, and professional promotion to spread the word, I need to raise 12,000€.Damit ich all das bewerkstelligen kann, brauche ich Deine Unterstützung. Um sowohl für Album und Video als auch für deren professionelle Promotion aufzukommen, muss ich eine Summe von 12.000 € aufbringen. The Plan Breakdown, and What It CostsEinzelheiten und was es kosten wird My plan is to write thirty demos, and give you the chance to vote for your favourites in March 2018. players fees - Gage der Musiker: 1,500€
album mixing - Mixen des Albums: 1,000€
album mastering - Mastern des Albums: 500€
photography costs - Gage für Fotografen: 750€
graphic design - Graphische Gestaltung: 1,500€
booklet and sticker printing - Druck der Bücher und Aufkleber​: 1,500€
video production costs - Videoproduktionskosten: 2,000€
publicity and advertising efforts - Veröffentlichung und Werbemaßnahmen: 2,000€
Any money that is raised beyond my campaign goal will be put towards the video budget, and increased online promotion.

story:
Hello world! My name is Mary McAvoy, and I'm a singer-songwriter here in the beautiful city of Boston, Massachusetts.

I’ve been making music and performing around New England for the last several years:  pop arrangements on college campuses with my UNH A Capella group, classic rock, Motown and Top 40's songs at weddings, acoustic covers at local bars and sunset cruises, intimate acoustic jams in backyards and basements and original tunes at my release shows around Boston. After pouring everything I’ve learned into songwriting, into stories, into harmony, the only thing left is to share the new sounds in my head and my heart with all of you.

The material is ready, the musicians are waiting--this Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward creating my first-ever professionally produced studio album.

This campaign is raising funds for my professionally recorded album with Bryan Fennelly, a Boston-based producer, and engineer working with both established and up-and-coming musicians. Together, Bryan and I are digging into my original material, writing arrangements, and reaching out to local musicians to bring the songs to life.

We’ve been able to cover the costs of recording and producing one song, which is ready for you to check out right here on this page. This first song is called “Real,” and you can check it out below!

 

While we were able to fund the recording process for "Real" on my own, to create an album of songs of this quality, studio time costs add up quickly. With that said, this campaign can give us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together. Your donation will cover following costs of my project:

1. Pre-Production: This is where everything starts. Bryan and I will start crafting the arrangements for each of the songs that will go on the album. We’ll hold rehearsals to fine-tune the songs, arrangements, and talk through new and exciting ideas for how to approach the recording process.

2. Recording: This is when we enter the studio and start capturing the music and where the songs become what you'll hear on this album. This campaign will play a huge role in making sure we have enough time to capture great performances for every member of the band.

3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will get mixed to create the right balance between instruments, texture and color that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.

And what will you get for your generosity and support? So many awesome things!

We are so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity, We've put together a really exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign.

Check out some examples below and a full list to the right!

It's hard to express how much this project would change my life.

 Music has been a tool for me to connect to others on a deeper level. With some experience in writing, recording and performing under my belt, I am feeling more confident to share my true stories through my music and would like to connect even more honestly with more people.

Music has created an eclectic community for me--- my college peers in a cappella that supported and inspired me, my family who have always been my biggest cheerleaders and have given me a wide perspective on different types of music, fellow musicians in the local community that have supported my musical endeavors, and my closest friends that have given me feedback on new song ideas. The power of music lies in is its ability to cultivate deep personal connections when people can relate to the message, lyrics, or mood of a song or share a passion for music. One of my hopes is that this project helps me to reach more people that feel a connection to my songs. I hope to send the message that no one is ever going through anything on their own; There is always someone else that has felt a similar way or had a similar experience.

I've made music projects similar to this that I am very proud of, and each year I continue to learn and grow as a musician. In between projects and working with kids, I've been deepening my musical focus and practicing, practicing, practicing. With your support, I will channel that consistent work and experience into something unique will be able to reach new heights as an artist.  I'm pushing to make a career in the music industry and establish myself as an artist and songwriter. With your help, I can reach my goals!

If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink "Contribute Now" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts, and we’re so grateful for all your support.

If you've got folks in your network that would be interested in supporting us please help get the word out and make some noise! There are social media share buttons on this page, and please tell your friends how grateful I am for this support.

Thank you so much for checking out my campaign page. I can't wait to share this music with you!

story:
Keep it simple.

Be the first to support this project. 

Order your CD or LP.

Help us reach our goal.

Spread the word by sharing this campaign with music lovers everywhere.

If you are as passionate about this artist as we are join our team with your donations and platform.

All money earned will go directly to the printing of "The Fool, The Friend", and the music will come directly to you.

We need to reach our goal of $1250 to make this happen.

We appreciate your support.

Ric and Team

story:
MORF! When's your new music out?

Glad you asked, random person who I definitely didn't make up to ask that question!..

After the success of 2017s album featuring 'Driving Fast' I've decided it's time to make a new album, but not only make a new album; make it the best dam album I've ever made

To do this I am moving away from my home studio and moving into France's biggest entertainment production complex, hosted by a personal friend and his world-leading producer. This promises the best highest quality sound and high level production to really make this album shine. 

Coupled with that, given its a fully fledged entertainment complex; we will also be making cinematic quality music videos for all the tracks. 

Unfortunately, it's dam expensive. 

 

What I need help with

Well, as most of us know, the world is in a bit of a situation right now.

I had budgeted and prepared for this album, but what I needed to happen was street performances to be a possibility, and all the bookings I had lined up to go ahead.

Things happen; and the new outbreak of Covid19 has effectively cancelled all my bookings, and is now preventing us from forming crowds in public spaces; meaning busking is out.

This effectively means I cannot make any money, which means I cannot record this album.

Thats where you come in. You, the people. Those who want to hear my new music, and support my efforts as a humble unsigned musical troubadour 

What you get

I will be including a variety of 'perks' in this campaign. Perks are essentially things I will send you if you support a particular level of the funding process.

The standard perk will obviously be the signed CD upon final production; sent to your home with a big sloppy kiss (ok none of that, that won't help the virus spread...!) or a thank you message from myself and I. 

But there will also be other perks available, like credits, videos, and even guitars.

Check the side panel for details when you pledge :) 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk right now is financial position. 

Because I want this album to be amazing, not just good, I've decided to go to a world class production suite. This means the album will sound as good as any major album you spin on your Spotify playlists on the daily. But it also means I will be able to work alongside professional producers who can help me get the best sound and structure out of my work; making it more enjoyable for everybody. 

We will also be shooting music videos :)

This comes at a cost; a very high cost. And along with the material costs of producing the CDs, having in guest musicians, etc, the financial burden of this project is the largest challenge right now. Especially when im unable to perform to make the £££ to fund it.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want a CD or any perk; you can always pledge a small amount to support the fundraiser. Even £1 goes a long way when many people donate it.

You can share this fundraiser, along with some videos of my performances, if you really enjoy what I do and think the world should see and hear it.

 

2020 was going to be the year I work my hardest to get music to the whole world, and whilst there's been a big nail in the works thanks to this pandemic, I still want that to happen. So with your help, it can happen.

 

COST BREAKDOWN OF PROJECT:

7500 total

Recording - Studio France : 3500

​Mixing/ Mastering - 1000

Production of 2,000 CDs in fold case with leaflet - 2000

Costs for transport (to studio) + overnight accommodation during recording - 1000

 

Total: 7500

 

 

As always,

much love.

M
story_txt:

Glad you asked, random person who I definitely didn't make up to ask that question!..
After the success of 2017s album featuring 'Driving Fast' I've decided it's time to make a new album, but not only make a new album; make it the best dam album I've ever made
To do this I am moving away from my home studio and moving into France's biggest entertainment production complex, hosted by a personal friend and his world-leading producer. This promises the best highest quality sound and high level production to really make this album shine. 
Coupled with that, given its a fully fledged entertainment complex; we will also be making cinematic quality music videos for all the tracks. 
Unfortunately, it's dam expensive.
