story:
❤️ HELLO, EVERYONE! I'M RECORDING A VALENTINE'S EP! ❤️

Hi! My name is Sarah Whittemore and I am thrilled to announce my first solo project. For those of you that don't know me, here's a little more info. Born and raised in Greensboro, NC I grew up with a heart for performing. From youth choirs and madrigals, to jazz trios and musical theatre, music has always been my passion. For the past 15 years, I have been a professional in the music industry and made my living as a live and studio vocalist.  I currently live in the Central Florida area with my husband, Scott, and our two dachshunds, Wilbur and Wendy.

I am making a Valentine's EP. While a cappella music is a love of mine, (You may have seen and heard me in the a cappella groups Voctave, or at Disney World with The Voices of Liberty) my first love has always been jazz music. Ever since I can remember, it has been my dream to record a jazz record of my own. I'm here to make that dream come true.

Making music is not a solitary endeavor. There are many moving parts. From studio time, to paying for musicians, producing, engineering, mixing and mastering, marketing, licensing, etc., you can imagine some of the costs incurred. While I have set aside personal funds for this project, I need your help to fully fund this EP.

Will you take this next step with me?

I hope you will.❤️

❤️ PERKS ❤️

From digital albums, to coffee mugs, to your own private concert, there are lots of lovely perks for supporting this campaign. Be sure to check the sidebar of this page for all the details!

 

❤️ SHARE THE LOVE ❤️

If you have committed to backing this project, and are looking for other ways to support (or if you are unable to financially back this project), here are some other valuable ways you can support the EP!

  • Share our Indiegogo page on social media, but more importantly, share WHY you are supporting!
  • Can you think of someone who might LOVE  this EP? Tell them all about it!
  •  Follow me on Instagram! @swhittmusic
  •  Give a “like” on my professional Facebook page, Sarah Whittemore Vocals

 

 

❤️ THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION. ❤️

story:
I Wish It So

"I could always guess what was in the Christmas gifts under the tree when I was small, and this year was no different - I knew exactly what my gift was: the opportunity to create a solo show for my favorite time of year.  And I’ve loved unwrapping it - illuminating a family story or a fond memory with fantastic songs, working on Howard Breitbart’s delicious arrangements.  The response was incredible, and getting to record it gives me so much joy.  I Wish It So is a gift of love and hope and laughter. I can’t wait for you to open it." —Susan Derry

The album will feature holiday classics and unexpected gems including:

  • Home For Christmas
  • Winter Was Warm
  • Spring Will Be A Little Late This Year
  • New World Coming, and of course:
  • I Wish It So

The Project

Susan Derry's "I Wish It So" began as a holiday cabaret at Creative Cauldron in 2020, and was a stand-out hit of the season. There was such excitement around the project, and high demand that this special experience be recorded for people to enjoy as part of their holiday season every year, that we were determined to make it happen. 

  • ​Nevermore Records has produced 15 albums over the past 10 years. These albums have ranged from instrumental, to pop, musical theatre to bluegrass and rock. ​
  • We have known and worked with Susan Derry and Howard Breitbart, her brilliant accompanist and arranger, for over a decade, and believe this project is the perfect showcase for the important work of these artists.
  • With your help, we can share this experience, making this beautiful evening that moved so many available season after season.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $8,000 to make this album happen. Your generous support goes to the artists, technicians, organizers, and designers.
  • All levels at $25 and above will receive a digital download of the full album!
  • Perks range from a signed vinyl album of the recording to a champagne-and-Christmas-goodies Opening Night Party Box, and much more. *ALL PERKS IMAGES ARE FOR ILLUSTRATION PURPOSES ONLY: Final artwork is subject to change.
  • If we don't reach our goal here, we will still honor the donations raised and perks promised, and continue to find funding through other means to make this happen. 

The Impact

  • This show brought so much joy to so many at a difficult moment for our world.  the subsequent album will be a perennial holiday album favorite, creating longevity for these esteemed artists' work well into the future. 
  • Despite the financial troubles wrought by the COVID-19 Pandemic, we believe there is strong interest from those who viewed this amazing live show that the energy is there to bring the project to fruition within a relatively low financial goal. 
  • We plan to interactively share messages, progress, and completion of the project through various social media, email, and podcast platforms. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't afford to donate? NO PROBLEM! Help share the message of this campaign. Every little bit helps, and we're grateful.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools included in this page! That's how we make this happen!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools included in this page! That's how we make this happen!

story:
Exploring the past and expressing the present...

Dear Friends and Family, 

I've spent most of my life digging though a heritage obfuscated in a sea of time, family lore, and past generations. Through the beauty of music I have found a path blossoming in knowledge.  A very special research project collaboration with mentor Heikki Koskinen,  Manala (netherworld)  is a representation of that deep cultural rediscovery through the lens of music weaving the elements of jazz, traditional folk, and free improvisation inspired by the mythic prose of cultural liberation and identity found in the Finnish National Epic known as the Kalevala as well as the folklore of Northern shamanic traditions. 

This music has flung open the doors to the Finnish spirit I have always felt throughout my life. 
I am so grateful to the intrepid musicians who have made this new music project a reality:
Heikki Koskinen, Joshua Marshall, Gabby Fluke-Mogul, Tom Weeks, David Samas, Cheryl Leonard, Mark Clifford, Safa Shokrai, Max Judelson, and Timothy Orr.

Choice and the DIY Spirit

I've been producing music for myself and the community for over thirty years holding to the DIY spirit.  Heikki and I have invested time and resources to make this project a reality which is why I launched this release campaign. I'm not asking for a hand out. If you connect to the music embedded in this project I hope you'll consider supporting me.
In addition to the CD+digital release, I'm offering a rare DVD of our live debut from May 2019 at the Berkeley Finnish Hall. There are only 50 copies and no more will be pressed or sold through any retail outlet as it's only for this special campaign.
Also for those who are hard core in experiencing this project I have hours and hours of raw video/audio performances of Heikki and I with the Otherworld Ensemble performing various iterations of Manala in Finland available in a thumb drive media bundle. Also, we're scheduled to perform June 13-14 the San Francisco premier in June. (dependent on current health considerations)

Pass the word

If you're reading this your probably on the front lines or an advocate of the DIY spirit I've lived my life by.  if you can't contribute, please reach out and share our release with other kindred souls.  

with deep gratitude I thanks to you all...

-Rent Romus

story:
Who We Are

Tunes. Beats. Awesome. is an award-winning co-ed collegiate a cappella ensemble at the University of Toronto. Formed in 2003, TBA has since made a name for itself with its fresh sound, tight harmonies, and innovative arrangements. The group is now enjoying its fifteenth anniversary season and to celebrate, we are hoping to throw an amazing concert that will honour TBA's past, present, and future. With your help, we can turn this into an aca-party that will last for another fifteen years!

We hope you join us in celebrating 15 years of TBA!

What We Need & What You Get

As a collegiate group, our revenue streams are limited to university funding, external events and performances, and donations from wonderful people such as yourself! We're looking to raise $1000, which will go towards the various costs of producing a show, such as venue rentals and audio/visual equipment.

Any donation you make helps to bring us a few steps closer to our ultimate goal: to celebrate and share our music with our families and friends who have supported us over the years. Listed on the right are the "perks" you can receive when you donate - every little bit counts, and we sincerely appreciate your contribution!

Other Ways You Can Help

A donation to this campaign isn't the only way you can show your support!

  • Get the word out and share our campaign with your family and friends.
  • Find us on our social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube) and share our story on your own social media outlets!
  • Join us in person on Sunday, April 8 for an afternoon of terrific tunes, brilliant beats, and aca-mazing awesomeness!

Find and Follow Us

As mentioned above, feel free to follow our online presence to stay updated on this campaign, our concert progress, and any other future projects we have in store for you!

  • Website: http://tunesbeatsawesome.com
  • Facebook: /TunesBeatsAwesome/
  • Twitter: @tba_live
  • Instagram: @tba_live
  • YouTube: @TBAlive

Thank You!

On a final note (no pun intended), thank you so much for all your support, generosity, and love. We are so happy to be able to share our love for a cappella and our music with each and every one of you.

With love,

Tunes. Beats. Awesome.

story:
Backstory

How is music part of your life? Are you a musician? A fan? Part of the music industry/business? Maybe you're even multiple of those. If music is a part of your life in the Pacific NW, it's likely at some point you've wanted to make the trek to Austin for the South by Southwest (SXSW) conference. Or if you have been able to make it, you know it's difficult, expensive, and it's gotten so big recently, maybe it's not worth it anymore as it's so hard to stand out and make personal connections.

 

But what if...what if...We were able to start a music conference and expo right here in the NW? The NW version of what made SXSW so special in the past? How would that look? Who would it involve? How amazing would it be? There's nothing else like this in our region, yet the talent, history, and community passion for music here is world class.

 

And so, with this opportunity in mind, Northwest Music Experience (NWME) was born. It is underway. It is happening. This project has been in process for about 9 months now, with many, many hundreds of hours of volunteer time behind it already. We’re doing this for you and the larger NW Music Community we all are a part of. We have made tremendous progress, but are now at a critical stage where volunteer hours aren't enough. We must have an initial funding push in order to make this vision a reality and we are now asking for your financial contribution to help.

 

Here's the rest of our vision and details about how your contribution will move us forward...

 

Summary

Northwest Music Experience is a convention/expo for musicians and industry professionals to develop and promote performance, as well as inspire and connect in community.

 

Over a three day weekend (August 16-18, 2013) at Benaroya Hall in the heart of Seattle, NWME will provide an environment of collaboration and inspiration between musicians, music industry, and music fans. Musicians of every age, experience and skill level will find the tools they need to enhance their creativity, boost their productivity, hone their delivery, and find support in community. With keynotes, panels and breakout sessions as well as an industry packed expo floor during the day and performance showcases at local venues in the evening, NWME packs a lot into just a few days. Participants come to network, perform, learn, do business and enjoy the community of other artists and their fans. The goal is for this event to become an annual showcase of regional talent with a sprinkling of the best from the national and international music community, drawing speakers and attendees not only from the western region of the United States, but from around the world.

http://www.nwmusicexperience.org

 

Songwriters in Seattle is a non-profit organization with over 750 members that runs about 10 events for musicians every month throughout the Pacific NW region. Workshops, seminars, showcases, networking and business learning, collaboration, critiques, and informal jam sessions are all a part of the group’s dynamic calendar. Under the Songwriters in Seattle umbrella, NWME will be our flagship event bringing the amazing NW music community together to learn, grow and celebrate the talent of the region.

http://www.songwritersinseattle.com

 

What We Need & Why

This is obviously a big project, and this fundraising campaign will not finance the entire thing - it is, however, a critical first stage. Why do we need financial contributions before you can even buy tickets? Why not get sponsors? Volunteer hours can, do, and will continue to help, but we have very little working capital to actually put something big in motion. In order to get to the point where we can sell tickets and sponsorships to get the serious money necessary to run the conference, we have to pay for some professional services to get the ball rolling.
 
We are asking for $25,000 mainly to get our chosen professional event planning company (Varsity Communications) underway and pursuing larger sponsorships that will carry the financial longterm we have budgeted. While $25,000 is our target goal, our hope is to raise somewhere between $50,000 and $75,000 in order to give this event the smashing first year kick-off it deserves. Here are our campaign budget projections:
 

Budget:

$25,000

$35,000

$50,000

$75,000

Cost of Campaign

$2,250

$3,150

$4,500

$6,750

Cost of Incentives

$3,250

$4,550

$6,750

$8,750

Video Production

$1,500

$1,500

$1,500

$1,500

Be A Part Of Something Big

We want you to participate and we have lots of perks/incentives to give you as thanks for contributing. Starting at just $5, you can be recognized as part of the grassroots effort to launch this amazing event. Or go in with a group (or corporate sponsorship) and get the VIP treatment throughout the event at the $2,500 level and above.

 

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help - Please share this campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share tools or even just this campaign page link! This affects music communities from Portland to Vancouver, Spokane to Olympia to Port Angeles and everywhere in between (would love some representation from Idaho as well!). Get the word out!

 

You can also sign up as an event volunteer at http://www.nwmusicexperience.org

 

Thank you very much and hope to see you there!

 

FAQ

When and where is this event taking place?

We just announced it - August 16-18 at Benaroya Hall in downtown Seattle! See the updates for more info

 

What music genre(s) will be represented at NWME?

The Pacific Northwest music scene is so wonderfully diverse! Rock, folk, blues, hip hop, electronic, jazz, classical, country, and more all have lively scenes here. We will be involving as much of it as we possibly can. Join us and represent!

 

Can I just buy tickets? Are the larger contribution levels just buying tickets?

The sale of event tickets has not begun yet and tickets are not available for purchase. You are contributing to a fundraising campaign that will make this event a reality. All references to tickets as perks/incentives will require future registration for actual tickets when they are available. These rewards are easily transferrable if, for instance, you are a fan who would like to give your reward conference ticket(s) to a musician who would benefit from the conference and expo tracks, but you just want to go to the VIP party and performances.

 

Since Songwriters in Seattle (the group running NWME) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, is my contribution tax deductible?

The portion of your donation that does not pay for products or services (tickets, hats, CDs, etc.) as part of your incentive package should be tax deductible. The value of some incentives have not yet been determined, but Songwriters in Seattle will be happy to provide a donation explanation letter for your tax records upon request at the time when all associated values have been finalized. That being said, please consult a tax advisor for details and appropriate tax consequences in your specific situation.

 

In the perks/incentives list, there is reference to drawings for 1 ticket each to the conference and/or VIP party and 2 tickets each to the same. How is that going to work?

We will do two separate sets of drawings (VIP party and conference) for two pools of people. The drawings for 1 ticket will only include $25-$50 contributors. The drawings for 2 tickets will only be for $100-$500 contributors (so you've got a pretty good shot!). 3 total tickets for each of the VIP party and conference will be given away.
story_txt:
Backstory
How is music part of your life? Are you a musician? A fan? Part of the music industry/business? Maybe you're even multiple of those. If music is a part of your life in the Pacific NW, it's likely at some point you've wanted to make the trek to Austin for the South by Southwest (SXSW) conference. Or if you have been able to make it, you know it's difficult, expensive, and it's gotten so big recently, maybe it's not worth it anymore as it's so hard to stand out and make personal connections.
 
But what if...what if...We were able to start a music conference and expo right here in the NW? The NW version of what made SXSW so special in the past? How would that look? Who would it involve? How amazing would it be? There's nothing else like this in our region, yet the talent, history, and community passion for music here is world class.
 
And so, with this opportunity in mind, Northwest Music Experience (NWME) was born. It is underway. It is happening. This project has been in process for about 9 months now, with many, many hundreds of hours of volunteer time behind it already. We’re doing this for you and the larger NW Music Community we all are a part of. We have made tremendous progress, but are now at a critical stage where volunteer hours aren't enough. We must have an initial funding push in order to make this vision a reality and we are now asking for your financial contribution to help.
 
Here's the rest of our vision and details about how your contribution will move us forward...
 
Summary
Northwest Music Experience is a convention/expo for musicians and industry professionals to develop and promote performance, as well as inspire and connect in community.
 
Over a three day weekend (August 16-18, 2013) at Benaroya Hall in the heart of Seattle, NWME will provide an environment of collaboration and inspiration between musicians, music industry, and music fans. Musicians of every age, experience and skill level will find the tools they need to enhance their creativity, boost their productivity, hone their delivery, and find support in community. With keynotes, panels and breakout sessions as well as an industry packed expo floor during the day and performance showcases at local venues in the evening, NWME packs a lot into just a few days. Participants come to network, perform, learn, do business and enjoy the community of other artists and their fans. The goal is for this event to become an annual showcase of regional talent with a sprinkling of the best from the national and international music community, drawing speakers and attendees not only from the western region of the United States, but from around the world.
http://www.nwmusicexperience.org
 
Songwriters in Seattle is a non-profit organization with over 750 members that runs about 10 events for musicians every month throughout the Pacific NW region. Workshops, seminars, showcases, networking and business learning, collaboration, critiques, and informal jam sessions are all a part of the group’s dynamic calendar. Under the Songwriters in Seattle umbrella, NWME will be our flagship event bringing the amazing NW music community together to learn, grow and celebrate the talent of the region.
http://www.songwritersinseattle.com


 
What We Need & Why
This is obviously a big project, and this fundraising campaign will not finance the entire thing - it is, however, a critical first stage. Why do we need financial contributions before you can even buy tickets? Why not get sponsors? Volunteer hours can, do, and will continue to help, but we have very little working capital to actually put something big in motion. In order to get to the point where we can sell tickets and sponsorships to get the serious money necessary to run the conference, we have to pay for some professional services to get the ball rolling.
 
We are asking for $25,000 mainly to get our chosen professional event planning company (Varsity Communications) underway and pursuing larger sponsorships that will carry the financial longterm we have budgeted. While $25,000 is our target goal, our hope is to raise somewhere between $50,000 and $75,000 in order to give this event the smashing first year kick-off it deserves. Here are our campaign budget projections:

story:
Short Summary

I've recently decided to take my spoken word performances away from occasional gigs in Cornwall and put it on the road. I'm hoping to encompass Exeter, Bristol and London in particular, but will happily visit anywhere in my clapped-out V reg, Ford Fiesta.

I will be primarily supporting and advocating Railway Children, a charity designed to help tackle poverty suffered by children. My thoughts on poverty are made clear in the above video - a spoken word piece of mine. http://www.railwaychildren.org.uk/campaigns/help-make-the-invisible,-visible/

Any profits made will be used to feed myself and to pay for petrol, the rest will go to Railway Children. I will also only stay in hostels and will blog each morning about the hostel, and give it a rating.

I will perform ANYWHERE: houses, clubs, music venues, open mic events, even on the street with a megaphone. Suggestions welcome!

What I Need & What You Get

The funding will pay for petrol, food, making of t-shirts and handwritten books to sale at gigs - either non-profit or profits to charities

I will be delivering specific and unique perks if you fund me, including (but not limited to):
Limited Edition books,
Posters,
Tees,
Shout-outs,
Personal gigs,
Spoken word dedications.

If I don't entirely reach my goal I will either cut the tour short by the amount necessary or give the proceeds to Railway Children.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that it is not financially viable for everybody to fund this, or many other worthy causes, but you can still help by suggesting venues, sharing this page and spreading the word!

story:
Help us publish a Christmas song written and performed by people either homeless or at risk of becoming homeless.

 

Would you like to be involved in a music project that could change lives?

Would you like to celebrate people overcoming very real barriers to make great art?

Would you like to be involved in helping possibly bother the Christmas chart?

Hello,

We would like help with a music project with the potential to change lives.  

We’re releasing a Christmas single and we need your help to publicize it.

This won’t be the average pop-star Christmas song.  Our song was written and performed by a songwriter and choir brought together by the help they received through charities for people at risk of homelessness, or that are homeless. Particularly through the Mentoring scheme offered to volunteers at Crisis Skylight Newcastle.

Our single will be released in order to raise money for these charities, to help them carry on providing such important services. There have been several philanthropic Christmas singles in the past, but rarely do they feature the kinds of people that will benefit from the money, and we want to change that.

Most of the work is already done, by music professionals volunteering their time:

The song will be supported with work by music and video professionals from the North East of England; music studios, producers and film-makers have volunteered their time to record and video the single (more details below).

 

All of the recording and production is already scheduled in for this Autumn; we’ll have a high quality recording of a fantastic, seriously catchy song – with a full choir, violin section and sleigh bell jingles.  We’re hoping you find the idea as exciting as we do, because we don’t have any limit to ambitions when it comes to who we’d like to hear the song.


That's why we're looking to raise money to publicize the finished single:

We’d like the song to be:

* Played on the radio
* Written about in the press
* Shared on the internet
* Talked about at work
* Bought in thousands
* Everything else

We and you can help that to some extent, but we want to make sure a lot of work goes into doing those things. This is a song with an inspiring story behind it, and it needs to be heard. We'll have things in place so that this tune, with everyone’s help, could reach the Christmas chart.

Mostly, we’re hoping you are as keen as we are to see the success of people involved, who have overcame real disadvantage in the creation of this project.

For any of this to happen we need your help.

We’re aiming to raise funds to put toward publicity for the song and our target is to raise the money to pay a professional firm to work hard promoting the song over the festive period.  This is the only thing that we need to pay for.

Help us by putting in an advance order of the single, checking out our various perks, or telling your friends about this project:

If you’d like to help us, and help the people and charities involved, please consider a donation or an advance order of the single (which you will receive as a download or CD and Download ) as soon as its finished and released in the first week of December 2012.

We also have a number of exciting perks, like gig tickets in the North East of England, merchandise from bands on Tiny Lights Recordings, badges and stickers recognizing the vital help you've given us.
 
IF THE PROJECT BEATS ITS FUNDING TARGET WE'LL MAKE A MORE AMBITIOUS PRESS CAMPAIGN. FURTHER DONATIONS AND THE PROCEEDS OF THE SINGLE WILL GO TO STREETWISE CHOIR, AND TO CRISIS- THE NATIONAL CHARITY FOR SINGLE HOMELESS PEOPLE.

IF WE DON'T REACH OUR TARGET, WE WILL AIM TO USE WHATEVER WE DO RAISE FOR MORE COST-EFFECTIVE PROMOTION.
 

F.A.Q.s

HOW DO I DONATE?
Like shopping online, you choose your perk on the right hand navigation then pay safely and securing using your card details.

WHY DO I HAVE TO DONATE IN DOLLARS?
Almost all of the funding platforms only display amounts in dollars. it is automatically converted to the equivalent in sterling or your home currency. So please don't let it put you off! Donating 10 dollars will mean our campaign receives roughly 6 and a half pounds, but check exchange rates for accuracy.
 
 
If you have any questions about the project  PLEASE COMMENT!, or e-mail us at CHRISTMASSONGFORHOMELESSPEOPLE 'at'GMAIL.COM
WE'LL CREATE AN F.A.Q. WITH QUESTIONS RECEIVED.
 

Thank you so much for your time and help.
 


Learn More About The People Involved:

We're very lucky to have some really dedicated collaborators in the project, that are giving up their time for a great cause.


Alan Robson (Songwriter, Guitar, Singing and Arrangement):

Alan has a keen interest in art, painting and music, and this song came about through his signing up for courses in art at Crisis, and partnering with people that could help him through Crisis Skylight Newcastle's mentoring scheme.

He wrote the song and collaborated on the arrangements. He recorded the guitar and singing so quickly that he's developed a reputation as a 'one take wonder'.

As a now self-employed artist and musician looking for opportunities, a portion of the proceeds will go to Alan to help him develop his artistic ambitions.

Streetwise Choir Newcastle (Vocals) :

Streetwise Choir is the UK’s first choir involving people who’ve experienced homelessness, together with their friends. Singing everything from pop to jazz, folk and classical music, Streetwise Choir is run by the charity Streetwise Opera in artistic partnership with The Sage Gateshead.

Part of the proceeds from the single will be donated to Streetwise Opera.

Visit:
http://www.streetwiseopera.org.uk


Blank Studios (Recording and Production):

Blank Studios is ran by three producer-engineers in Newcastle. They have worked for organizations like the BBC, ITV, XFM and Amazing Radio, and have worked on recording and radio session production for bands like Willy Mason, Clock Opera, Ghostpoet, Beth Jeans Houghton and more. Blank Studios receive no compensation for their involvement and will not benefit from your donation.

Visit:
http://www.blank-studios.com

Melting Point Media (Music Video, Video Diary):

Melting Point Media have been making music videos since 2010, in that time they have won multiple awards for their work, which has also been broadcast on television.

They have worked with numerous bands all over the UK, from Newcastle to Southampton to the USA.

Melting Point Media receive no compensation for their involvement and will not benefit from your donation.

Visit:
http://www.meltingpointmedia.co.uk/

 

Tiny Lights Recordings (Record Label and Publishing):

Tiny Lights Recordings is a record label based in Gateshead and Newcastle that have spearheaded the music careers of local artists like The Lake Poets, Fantasy Rainbow and Natasha Haws. They are looking after the publishing, printing and delivery of the single. They will recieve no compensation for the project (except for covering costs of postage and similar costs to delivering your records) and will not benefit from your donations.

Visit:
http://www.tinylightsrecordings.com


Mick Ross (Producer):

Mick Ross is a musician and music producer based in Newcastle, who also works as an engineer at Blast recording studios, and plays guitar in the band Frankie & The Heartstrings. He has recently produced artists like Ajimal and The Lake Poets. He'll be helping to record in addition to Blank Studios. Again, there'll be no benefit from your donation and the work is as a volunteer.

Crisis (Benificiary):
Crisis is the national charity for single homeless people,  dedicated to ending homelessness by delivering life-changing services and campaigning for change.
They provide innovative education, employment, housing and wellbeing services to address individual needs and help people to transform their lives. They are a charity that can demonstrate success and does so with value for money.

Although not directly involved in the project, the song came about as a result of Crisis' mentoring service and their arts education programmes, so we aim to donate to them in addition to Streetwise Choir.

Visit:
http://www.crisis.org.uk

story:
We are Seattle rock band Omega Moo.  After 3 years of serious gigging, recording and gaining popularity through the Northwest; we are ready to finally release a full length album and take our music on the road to places we have never been.

We have recorded other short albums but only been able to afford 3-4 songs at a time.  We have received so many great reviews by local and national publications and the resounding feedback is that they want MORE.  Our latest releases have been played on locally supported radio stations as well as countless internet radio stations and podcasts.

This time we are going to release a full length album.  Complete with professional packaging and a promotional campaign to back it up.  Having worked with the right producer and recording studio it's only a matter of raising the funds.  Little things add up when making an album.  Just paying for the studio time and mixing will cost $400 per song.

Full Length Album Costs: $8100

  • $5200 Recording, Mixing and Mastering
  • $2200 Pressing Packaging 2500 CD's
  • $700 Marketing and Promotion 

    

When it comes to playing shows we don't mess around.  Playing nearly 100 shows in the last 3 years.  Touring the west coast and traveling all around our home state of Washington.  So tour is no stranger to us.  We don't need fancy accommodations as we usually couch surf, camp and check in at the occasional $50 motel if we are feeling glamorous.

We have toured the West Coast to great success but would like to branch out to other areas of the United States (and eventually beyond).  We are currently booking our 7 day tour of the Rockies.

Touring Costs: $1730

  • $1100 Gas and Van Rental
  • $600 Food and Lodging
  • $30 Stuffed Animals (We need tour mascots)

This music is our passion.  We just need help getting to our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give us money we understand.  Please share this with your friends and like us on Facebook or Follow on Twitter.  (Buttons below)

$2200 Pressing Packaging 2500 CD's
$700 Marketing and Promotion 
      
When it comes to playing shows we don't mess around.  Playing nearly 100 shows in the last 3 years.  Touring the west coast and traveling all around our home state of Washington.  So tour is no stranger to us.  We don't need fancy accommodations as we usually couch surf, camp and check in at the occasional $50 motel if we are feeling glamorous.
We have toured the West Coast to great success but would like to branch out to other areas of the United States (and eventually beyond).  We are currently booking our 7 day tour of the Rockies.
Touring Costs: $1730

$1100 Gas and Van Rental
$600 Food and Lodging
$30 Stuffed Animals (We need tour mascots)
This music is our passion.  We just need help getting to our goal.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't give us money we understand.  Please share this with your friends and like us on Facebook or Follow on Twitter.  (Buttons below)

story:
FIRST OF ALL

IF YOU CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE SURE TO GET YOUR "PERK". GET OUR NEXT BOARD FOR 110$, IT IS THIS MUCH AWSOME ! (EVEN IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL).

Please come back once in a while for some updates!

Send an email to info@rotulelongboards.com if you have any questions!

 

Rotule has been in the longboard business since 2008.

See OUR WEBSITE

Since 2008 Rotule has been making the most durable and most performance-oriented boards on the market. We were the first longboard brand to introduce the carbon/basalt sandwich construction. We have not cut a single corner in our production and we believe that you cannot put a price on perfection. Unfortunately, perfection does come with a price.

When we started this project, we didn't want to be just another company that subcontracted their products; we wanted to do it all ourselves. We wanted to learn everything and be able to say that we built our products with our own two hands. Our company grew surely but slowly due largely to lack of funding. We have the tools, we have the knowledge, we've even won business startup prizes:

But we have had no luck in finding banks and organizations to support us. We must admit our financial statements have not yet been good enough to convince any banks to lend us money. But four years into our business we are still here. We know our business model is working we just need to scale up. We won't make tons of money, but we will be able to live off it.

 

The Plan

We've decided to come up with our first "traditional-construction" board; an 8-ply, rock maple board. We will continue to build our previous models (were awesome and widely praised by the downhill longboard community). However, they were expensive and only targeted a small group of people, mainly the professional riders. Our new, "affordable" deck will retail for only 150$ and is designed for a wider market.

We designed this model to suit the current trends and demands of the community: a freeride/downhill deck with a kicktail. It offers our signature concave, which locks your feet in while being very comfortable. It also features our renowned 3D designs which we call "free form". It means that everythings in the shape has progressive and complex curves. In this manner, we have really adapted our concave to the human foot. This gives the rider, whether professional or amateur, confidence and comfort in any position they might want to place their feet on the board.

 

 

Yan holding a Desert Eagle in our shop.

 

What we need

Right now what we need more than anything is the capital to start production of this board! You can see this as a very awesome, ultra, turbo, pre-order deal! The truth is we have always had problems in getting our fresh release out on time and missing the begining of the season, in turn. So we need YOU to help US start our production and make this sublime deck available IN TIME !

So why can't we just start building them now? Currently, we don't have the money to buy the materials to keep the production going for more than a week. The winters are hard to survive in this business, so we make small runs of boards, sell them, them get money to build more! But now we need to be able to build non-stop until we have enough to release in the spring! That is the way it works right? And if we sell enough of these, we may get things right enough to grow to our true potential; more boards, more visibility, hiring people and build a team! Many have succeeded in this manner so why not us?

We are truly passionate in our sport, and we can assure you this deck will be as good as it gets. Jonathan, will be drawing the new graphic during the holidays, and we will try to make the sickest graphic we have ever made!

Not sure it will be that good? See for yourself!

 

Our Facebook Page

Our previous release, the Desert Eagle, has been picked in the TOP 10 products of the year 2011:

"This is another breakout into the future of our sport. A board that in a way will not only build on existing concepts in board building, but elevate common acceptance of high-end construction techniques. 

Our editors and skaters on the forums cite this rock solid topmount's expert combination of materials, multiple mounting options, integrated shape rail designs, intelligent drop, concave that fits the rider and the board and a razor sharp rail. We could rattle off the marketing terms that everyone has come to know and love but in the real world.

Riders make boards perform, not marketing and in the hands of the masses this board has a level of adoration that not many companies can hope for. This was another one of the most mentioned boards and for good reason.

With the Desert Eagle master building comes into contact with brilliant board design."

You can also follow the Desert Eagle thread.

If you would like to see Rotule release more boards and grow bigger, making a contribution here is the best place to start!  By helping us, you will be helping the community! Let's go!!

IF YOU CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE SURE TO GET YOUR "PERK". GET OUR NEXT BOARD FOR 110$, IT IS THIS MUCH AWSOME !

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not into skateboarding, and don't want to contribute, you can still share this project with your friends!

You can use the Indiegogo share tools! (see under the first picture)

 

PM and Jonathan in Santa Barbara, California, 2010.

 

ROTULE FOR THE WIN !!

THANK YOU!

With the Desert Eagle master building comes into contact with brilliant board design."


You can also follow the Desert Eagle thread.

IF YOU CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE SURE TO GET YOUR "PERK". GET OUR NEXT BOARD FOR 110$, IT IS THIS MUCH AWSOME !
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not into skateboarding, and don't want to contribute, you can still share this project with your friends!
You can use the Indiegogo share tools! (see under the first picture)

 






PM and Jonathan in Santa Barbara, California, 2010.
 
ROTULE FOR THE WIN !!
THANK YOU!

story:
THE BIG BAND PROJECT

My name is Dan Olivo. I am an Italian/American actor and jazz singer based in Los Angeles. For the last few years I have had the amazing opportunity to perform the songs I love. I have been fortunate to be able to appear with my jazz combo at various concerts, festivals, venues and private events all over Southern California.
 
Some of my most recent performances have included Bar Nineteen12 at the historic Beverly Hills Hotel, the fabulous 570 KLAC Mistletoe and Martini Christmas Concert at The Universal Amphitheatre (which also included acts like Natalie Cole, Frank Sinatra Jr., Steve Tyrell and Big Bad Voodoo Daddy), and The Eagle Rock Music Festival.
 

MY DREAM

I love The Great American Songbook which include the songs of Frank Sinatra, Nat "King" Cole, Dean Martin, Ella Fitzgerald, Tony Bennett, Bobby Darin, Harry Connick Jr. and Michael Bublé. These songs are timeless and it has been my lifelong dream to one day record a big band album. That time is now.
 
I have teamed together with my dear friend and fabulous musician, arranger and band leader Brendan McMullin and some of LA's best musicians in hopes of creating an album of some classic standards, songs of today that could have been standards, and one or two originals. I also plan to invite a special guest or two to join me in a duet.
 

MY GOAL

To raise a total of $15,000 - $20,000 split up in three Phases. Phase 1 will include the cost of writing, arranging, and obtaining the rights to record twelve songs. It will also include promotional materials such as photos, videos and marketing materials.
 
Phase 2, which like Phase 3 will come at a later date, will include the actual cost of studio time, the musicians, and mixing fees. Lastly we have the final phase, Phase 3, which will include the cost of post recording, CD production, CD cover art, cases, digital downloads, and merchandising materials (hats, t-shirts, posters, and the launch of the CD release concert).
 

REALIZING THE DREAM

By contributing to the production of the Dan Olivo Big Band Album you are not only helping me fulfill a lifelong dream, but you are in effect helping to keep the Great American Songbook alive. This album will be enjoyed by all who love the great standards, and will also act as the calling card for my band and me to draw in other opportunities to play the music we love.
 
Those of you who are able to contribute will be entitled to some fabulous perks including an autographed CD, digital downloads, a copy of a signed photo of the entire band as a thank you card, hats, t-shirts, your name with a thank you message on the album, and the opportunity to come to a free concert such as the album release party.
 
For those who simply cannot make a financial contribution, you can still help make this dream a reality. There is no greater marketing tool than word of mouth. Please let your friends and family know about this campaign. Let them know that there are still many of us left who love this music and want to keep it alive for this generation and those to come.
 
The Great American Songbook is simply the greatest music of all time. It is my passion and my dream to share it with the world. Please help the Dan Olivo Big Band Project achieve this goal.
 

JAZZ SINGING VIDEO

 

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING

When Dan began to sing, the crowd stopped what they were doing to listen. He grasped the attention of all 300 people

This guys a great old school crooner. He's studied the greats and you can here it in his voice.

Dan Olivo was born in the wrong era. He's definitely an old soul with a crooner's heart and voice. I love listening to Dan sing and have his songs playing while I'm working all the time. Do yourself a favor and get lulled back in time.

When Dan began to sing, the crowd stopped what they were doing to listen. He grasped the attention of all 300 people.

 

WITH GRATITUDE AND THANKS

Thank you from the bottom of my heart.
 
Dan Olivo
 
www.danolivo.com

story:
Short Summary 

   

     We all reach a point in our lives where we come to a crossroads.
     So many of us spend our lives floating in a gentle current, accepting the direction it is heading. Fear stops us from choosing a shoreline to settle on, where we can plant an idea and watch it bloom into something beautiful and life changing.
     Steven Scarpetti, along with his good friend Andy Redeker have decided it is time to take charge of their lives and create something that not only fulfills them artistically but will also supply work to others in the process
     CONNECT 4 is an idea that Steven Scarpetti developed after working years in the entertainment industry.   He envisioned a group of men, woman or a combination of the two that could be sent out to various venues to supply top quality entertainment to clients.
      Andy and Steven have cast a pool of extremely talented men whose credits include Broadway, film and television, first national tours and the cruise ship industry.
      Along with their hard work and your generous help they will be able to continue on to the next step in the creative process. 
     Your donation will help them purchase more arrangements, costumes, film a promotional video, rent rehearsal space in New York City, record a CD and breathe further life into this idea.
     Thank you for taking the time to consider our project.  We have strong faith in this journey and look forward to keeping you updated on its progress.

      Andy and Steven have cast a pool of extremely talented men whose credits include Broadway, film and television, first national tours and the cruise ship industry.

     Your donation will help them purchase more arrangements, costumes, film a promotional video, rent rehearsal space in New York City, record a CD and breathe further life into this idea.
     Thank you for taking the time to consider our project.  We have strong faith in this journey and look forward to keeping you updated on its progress.

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

Matt 5:14-16 (Amp) You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden.15Nor do men light a lamp and put it under a peck measure, but on a lampstand, and it gives light to all in the house.16Let your light so shine before men that they may see your moral excellence and your praiseworthy, noble, and good deeds and recognize and honor and praise and glorify your Father Who is in heaven.

 

We live in a generation where evil is deemed as good and good as evil. Emedded in our culture, music, and media are doctrines surrounding our youth with a a dark hopeless outlook on life. We continuously see the fruit of these perverse seeds planted day in and day out. Jesus died so we could not settle for what this world would feed us, but that we may by His spirit create a life on earth that honored Him, full of light and life, a life in abundance. The Word calls us all City Lights, so will you shine with us?

City Lights Ministries began in May of 2011 and currently consists of Cory Ard (Amasiah), Jordan Hall (J. Carter), and Gavin Palmer (Raging Moses), (Evan Ford-Artist/Drummer), as well as the many others that make the ministry run behind the scenes, .  We are a collective of individuals who aim, using our gifts in music, to encourage, inspire, and challenge a generation to pursue God, igniting them with a passion to light up the world.  By doing what the bible says, using our transformed lives by the Blood of Christ to shine our lights into a dark and dying culture, we aim honor the sacrifice of Jesus Christ with our influence and giftings.  We aspire to create music inspired by the Holy Spirit, using it to serve our community with outreach & discipleship. 

 

THE IMPACT

This campaign will not only enable us to continue the great work God has started but we feel now more than ever God is prepared to exponentially expand the reach/influence of City Lights as a ministry. This is part of our calling, it is our passion and with the new mixtape and vision implemented, Jesus's name will be glorified! 2012 proved to be an amazing year for City Lights! We were able to travel all over Colorado, participating in many different events orchestrating free concerts. With the help of partners and individuals blessing the ministry we were also able to give out over 3,000 free CDs, make many valuable connections locally and globally, and see the fruit of thousands of transformed lives. We were blown away at God’s favor and the testimonies of all the people we were privileged to come in contact with. As of May of 2012 City Lights as a ministry felt God calling us into a season of rebuilding and preparation for what was to come, and THAT TIME IS NOW!!   

 

WHAT WE NEED

For City Lights VisionCast 2013 God has given us more vision than ever to impact the young minds and hearts of a generation of lost souls.  With the release of a new mixtape, new logo and graphic designs, drastic expansion, and so much more, City Lights is excited to see the continued provision of God for what He has asked us to do in this New Year. THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN. Us as a ministry have always felt led to not allow money to come between what God is doing with us and someone’s ability to be blessed.  For this reason we do not charge for people to come to our events and supply all of our music for free. Faithful supporters, such as yourself, have supplied the foundation and enabled every stride this ministry has taken thus far. Because of your support, partnering, and prayers this ministry has flourished even in the short year and a half since we began.  For this New Year we intend to launch our first ever street team, have product readily available for street events, make CD and merchandise production more efficient, design a brand new upgraded website, and invest in the media team for promotions and outreach.  We also intend to continue to disciple and develop young leaders introducing opportunities for them to be used by God in greater capacities. 

WE ARE ASKING YOU TO JOIN US in being a part of all that God is doing with a financial gift/contribution to City Lights VisionCast 2013. We are looking for monthly partners who feel led to give monthly donations to the ministry in any amount God places on your heart. We are also looking for individuals to make single contributions if that is preferred.  Whatever you feel God is leading you to do even if it is prayers alone, we are happy to be partners with you in whatever capacity that may be.  All donations stay within the ministry to help build what God has started and are solely used to pour back into City Lights. 

  • New Inkjet Printer
  • 2500 Bulk Cds
  • 2500 Inserts
  • 500 Plastic Sleeves
  • Fully Restocked Merchandice ( T-shirts Men & Womens all sizes, Hoodies all sizes, wristbands, posters, stickers, and the proction of the shirts & hoodies)
  • New Website
  • New logo, & other graphic designs
  • Music Video & Production/Editing
  • Advertisment & Promotion
  • Photo shoot
  • Shipping & Handling cost

WHAT YOU GET

There are perks that we are giving out for each level you reach on your giving, many of which are more value than the amount donated! Perks include:City Lights Shirts, City Lights Hoodies, Braclets, Stickers, Instrumentals & Accapellas of the Album, Name on website, Shoutout on Final song, and MUCH MORE!! The higher you go, the more you get. We truly believe that God will bless you especially in building His kingdom (Gal 6:7 - Reap what you sow) so we encourage you to give as much as you can!!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!!

If your reading this and feel compelled to help but are unable to contribute financially  THERE ARE MANY OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!! Prayer is a powerful tool and we believe that it is the most important part of this campaign! So keeping us in your prayers and on your hearts as we venture on this journey! Also SPREAD THE WORD!! Use the Indiegogo share tools for Facebook twitter & more. Def share with friends and family to get the word out! Also multiple post will make the effort even more effective! Again we praise God for you and thank for your support!

There are perks that we are giving out for each level you reach on your giving, many of which are more value than the amount donated! Perks include:City Lights Shirts, City Lights Hoodies, Braclets, Stickers, Instrumentals & Accapellas of the Album, Name on website, Shoutout on Final song, and MUCH MORE!! The higher you go, the more you get. We truly believe that God will bless you especially in building His kingdom (Gal 6:7 - Reap what you sow) so we encourage you to give as much as you can!!
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!!


If your reading this and feel compelled to help but are unable to contribute financially  THERE ARE MANY OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!! Prayer is a powerful tool and we believe that it is the most important part of this campaign! So keeping us in your prayers and on your hearts as we venture on this journey! Also SPREAD THE WORD!! Use the Indiegogo share tools for Facebook twitter & more. Def share with friends and family to get the word out! Also multiple post will make the effort even more effective! Again we praise God for you and thank for your support!

story:
Grounded EP

Hi! I'm Grounded (aka Fatt Melten). I make music that you may or may not enjoy, but lucky for me money doesn't have a genre preference!

I've spent that last 5 years learning, trying, failing, succeeding, and experimenting in electronic music production. My path stylistically has been all over the map over the years, but with this EP I feel I've finally found my sound and am ready to share it. With your support I will be able to fund the final stages of production, release, and promotion and get the Grounded EP out by the end of the year!

What We Need 

There is a lot of work and quite a few expenses involved with releasing a body of music properly. The money this campaign raises will be put towards:

  • Professional mastering 
  • Track copyrights
  • Promotional materials/tools
  • Merchandise
  • Spotify/iTunes placement
  • An EP release party (which you're all invited to)

Each tier of donations includes it's own perks including a digital download of the EP, posters, t-shirts, and even a custom made song! 

I truly thank you for your support, every dollar helps.

story:
OSP New Album 

We are Omaha Street Percussion. An entertainment group that uses recycled items to make music. In addition to performing, we also host a variety of different classes and programs for kids, from ages 4 and up. 

Our programs include:

  • OSP Summer camp 
  • Junior Drum Club (Ages 4-7)
  • Crosstix (ages 8-15)
  • Private drum lesson studio (ages 7 and up) 
  • Before and after-school enrichment programs at local elementary schools. 

Our album sales will help fund and grow these programs. Also, we have a long term goal of purchasign our own building where we can host these programs. 

What We Need & What You Get

The estimated cost to complete the new album is $4000. We are offing perks for those who contribute to the fundraiser. Anyone who donates $20 will automatically receive the new album. There are more perks for larger donations. We want as many people as possible to have our new album!

The album is expected to be done in early June, 2018. Just in time for our busy summer!  

The Impact

All profits from album sales will go towards our future building fund, as well as funding our music programs. 

Please share this campaign on your Social Media Platforms to get the word out! We are so thankful for the strong community support we've received over the past 5 years. We are excited for everyone to hear the new music!

story:
La producción de ‘HiHeal’ comenzó en noviembre 2017 con la colaboración de grandes músicos como el baterista Tony Escapa, el bajista Bryan Pérez y el ingeniero Nicolás Linares.

Con tu ayuda podremos cubrir los gastos de producción tales como:

  •     Horas de estudio
  •     Mezcla 
  •     Masterización
  •     Músicos
  •     Arte gráfico
  •     Reproducción
  •     Promoción

Vivo agradecida de las grandes muestras de apoyo recibidas a lo largo de mi vida.  Han sido estas, las fuerzas que me han llevado a conquistar mis metas. 

Gracias por las fuerzas ,

 

AleXa RiVera

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My name is Alexandra Rivera and I’m a puerto rican pianist and composer.  I was born surrounded by music and before I was 4 I knew that music was my path.

With great joy I have given my life to music because music has given me life. I’ve made of my passion my profession, with which I’ve worked in stages around the world with important artists like (Draco Rosa, Tego Calderón, iLe, and many more). But today I need to share all that’s inside me and for that reason I’m currently working on my first album ‘HiHeal”.

This album marks a cycle of stages lived in three planes: the spiritual, terrestrial and inner world.  

HiHeal started recording in November 2017 with the collaboration of some of my favorites musicians such as drummer Tony Escapa, bassist Bryan Perez and engineer Nicolás Linares.

To finish this work with the quality it demands I need to cover some production expenses such as:

  • Mastering
  • Musicians
  • Mix
  • Art
  • Distribution
  • Promotion

I started this campaign to invite you to be part of this important step in my career.  I’m grateful for all the support I’ve received through my whole life because it has inspired me to fight for my goals.  I invite you to make your contribution, spread the voice and give me your good energy to make all this happen. 

Thank’s a lot for your support,

 

AleXa RiVera

story:
LADIES AND GENTS! I am Ethan Butler from Season 7 of "The Voice." You probably recognize me from Team Adam where I made it all the way to battle rounds.Still can't remember? Check out my performances here:
Blind: 


Battle: http://youtu.be/FtS2JXKAGSI

 But as Pharrell said, "everyone, at the end of the day, goes home." But for me, going home doesn't mean stop; it's an open door to the next chapter! 

In Spring of 2015, I will be working to release my Debut EP, That 4Letter Word, which is to be recorded at BlackBird Studios in Nashville, TN. This EP is a deliberate statement between me and each of my fans - new and old. It will feature six of my best songs, and is my firm declaration to each one of you that I am serious about my music and my dreams becoming reality.

It means pushing myself and not limiting myself to only what I can do alone, and so I need your help.

I have a team that shares my vision and is dedicated to doing it right (an amazing producer, sound engineer and full band), and have booked 11 days in the studio including post production. With all these components, we’re projecting a $15,000 project cost.

Sometimes I think that’s such a lofty goal, but if 375 people give a total of $40 each we will reach our goal in no time!  And I hope that in my efforts to reach my goals, I inspire you to dare to dream big, to believe in that dream, and to live it out with all of your heart.

Even the smallest donation is a much appreciated gift so I’d like to gift back to you.


For a $5 donation you’ll receive my iTunes single from the EP.
For a $10 donation you’ll receive a digital copy of the EP. 
For larger donations I have other perks I’ll be making available so as to show my appreciation to you for your financial support.

I love you all and I thank you for never giving up on me and helping turn my dream into reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell your mom, tell your dad; tell all your friends about this project!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story: Deryle Perryman and I (Moises Gonzalez) spent 5 years working on a documentary (Same Same But Different) about Vietnam Veterans who had the courage and compassion to return to the country they helped destroy with the mission of healing the wounds of war.  On October 10th, 2015, we will finally have the official World Premiere.  The Albuquerque Film Office is sponsoring the event at the one-and-only Kimo Theatre in Albuquerque.  To make this an evening to be remembered we've invited Terry Allen (whose music is featured in the film) to play a live show after the film.  He will be joined by his son, Bukka Allen.  While the Albuquerque Film Office is covering the cost of the Kimo Theatre, we still have to come up with the funds to pay Terry Allen and Bukka Allen.  We are hoping to cover those costs before the show so the revenues from ticket sales can go to Deryle's project: TWOBRICKS Music Schools in Vietnam.  Anyone contributing more than $100 will receive an 8x10 image of "Girl Reading" (the beautiful photo taken by Mr. Perryman).  Help us make this incredible show a success.  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

After their recent West Coast tour being such a huge success, pop singing duo and real-life partners, Jason & deMarco, are again setting out on the road this Fall to spread their unique brand of inspiring music.  The Journey begins in Nashville, Friday, September 27th and will continue for 30 days through 21 cities as Jason and deMarco continue their message of 'Celebrating Diversity'.  Jason & deMarco will again board the RV tour bus along with their twin two-year old sons, Mason and Noah, and Jason's parents.  

What We Need & What You Get

A tour like this has many expenses.  The goal of this campaign is to cover travel expenses specifically.

Gas expenses for the RV.  The RV gets approximately 7-8 miles to the gallon and takes approximately $300-400 per tank to fill-up.

Parking and lodging at RV parks will also be coverd through this campaign.

For donations of $30 or more, you will receive a FREE CD with FREE shipping.

For donations of $50 or more, you will receive a personal phone call from Jason and deMarco thanking you for the donation and a free one-year membership to their VIP Angel Club offering an array of benefits.

For donations of $100 or more, you will receive a personal phone call AND a birthday phone call from Jason and deMarco over the next year singing Happy Birthday to you.  You will also receive a free one-year membership to their VIP Angel Club offering an array of benefits.

For donations of $500 or more, you will receive a personal phone call from Jason and deMarco and they will give you a life-time membership to their VIP Angel Club which offers a vast array of benefits.

The Impact

“We saw how including my parents on the last tour was such a powerful statement of reconciliation; showing a mothers and fathers acceptance and support of their son, his partner and our non-traditional family" says Jason. "A highlight in our show was when Jason’s mom performed with us on stage and we plan on doing more of this on the Fall tour", says deMarco.

Your contribution to our tour will allow us to continue touring, sharing our message and story with many around the country.

Thank you!

story:
>> Our self-titled cd: "Released From Quiet" <<

           "Released" date  ..  July 19, 2013

******** 

THANK YOU TO ALL WHO CONTRIBUTED & TO ALL WHO PLAYED OUR REFERRAL GAME. OUR WINNER WAS "KH"! THERE IS A $25.00 GIFTCARD HEADING HER WAY!

Our focus now turns to getting out to play! and promote our new album. Do you have a favorite venue? Let them know YOU would like to hear RELEASED FROM QUIET play on their stage!

ReleasedFromQuiet.com 

Sign up for our newsletter      ^^^^    We'll keep you posted!

We, Chris and Mary, are a musical duo from the Bellevue/Redmond area just east of Seattle, Washington, USA.  Chris is the vocalist/guitar player & Mary percussion/occasional varied stringed instrument. 
 
We have had the great pleasure to perform in the Pacific NorthWest - where we came to be as a musical entity.  After many years of us tinkering and talking about music Chris ventured into a 'tour' of open mics. This was the kickstart of a refining process of his sound.  Mary joined in on percussion and we continued the Open Mic Tour. We began to add our own shows to this 'tour' and soon had fans asking for recordings. 
 
October, 2012 we had the good fortune to meet Jay Pinto, former member of Bananafish, producer, recording engineer, and mixer! We joined forces with Jay to co-produce our first single released November, 2012, "Room 610".  
 
We were inspired by the recording process and decided to jump in with all four feet to put together a collection of songs. Nine months of learning a new computer & programs, recording, engineering and LOTS of listening .. our debut CD is getting ready to 'hit the presses'.
 
Jay polished up the mixes for us and our mastering session with Rick at RFI Mastering in Seattle added the finishing touch!
 

"The songs took us on a ride --rather than the other way around."  

It was a scenic route and we invite you to share the ride with us.

 
 
Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hello

Im Jeff Best, I have been in the music biz since 1998, although I did record one album and toured all over the world, I still have a passion and fire to connect with people through music.

I have so much more to say now, being a dad and family man, life experiences have taught me so much and I want to share and sing about them with my friends and fans

What We Need & What You Get

I will be going back into the studeio in nashville tn, most likely recording at a studio called the Rukus room, where my old producer resides.

I will be use the funds for studio time, paying the musicians, paying an engineer and all costs related to recording and mixing 4 to 5 new songs.

The Impact

I own one of the coolest online radio stations for country music in the world, countryradio.com. I will use countryradio.com and all its resources to push my new music out to the thousands of fans who listen to my station everyday!

At countryradio.com, I only play independent country artists like myself, so when people come to my station, they know they are not going to here the big country stars, they are hearing unfiltered, pure country music, you cant hear any where else.

I make it my duty to find artists who are just as good if not better than most of the main stream artists we have out there today, and since the current listeners seem to like my music, the new songs should do very well.

Other Ways You Can Help

It would be a huge help to me if you cannot donate, that maybe you can share my artist pages jeffbestmusic.com and @jeffbestmusic on twitter and also come and listen and request me on countryradio.com @countryradiocom

story:
Nyah Lyan Foundation - Energy In Love LLC Company Launch Crowd Sourcing Campaign.

HEY!!! My name is Oriel Cornwall A.K.A. Nyah Lyan. I am an independent Singer/Songwriter, and i recently registered and founded my own singer/songwriter & Music Publishing Company: Nyah Lyan Foundation - Energy In Love LLC. We harness the influential power of music and use it as a form of socio-economic change. Music & art media humanitariansim.

- We are hoping to raise resources to fund the purchase of industry standard physical copies of our latest released album. we will purchase 100-200 depending on funding high quality eco wallets or digi-packs from the company discmakers.

- We also intend to use resources to produce professional press kits to be used in the process of shopping our music to major publishing and recording companies. press kits will be purchased and developed locally however information on press kits purpose, usage, design and production pricing can be found by simply searching online for music press kits. it is a competitive industry and the pricing varies from company to company.

 

 

Learn More About Us At:

:NyahLyan.com

Here Is A Sample Of My Music.

NYAH LYAN - ST. CROIX MUSIC VIDEO from Nyah Lyan on Vimeo.

Funding Specifics & Gifts and Rewards

Here are the detailed facts about our campaign

    • We have disclosed below the specific pricing and links to the products that we will be purchasing. In an additional effort to maintain transparency we want to clarify that resources are going directly to the production of physical album copies and press kits. Discmakers is a large a popular CD duplication and replication company and has high quality products and services. So we decided to use them for our project. Here are the details:

      DiscMakers Quote For Eco Wallets and Digipacks.

      With shipping and color printing combined the total is above $600 for a shipment *before music content is added

    • The Gifts & Rewards You Will Get For Contributing and Joining Forces With Us!

      Social Media Site Take Over!

      I will dedicate an entire day to promoting you, your event, your movement, or anything you are interested in on one of my various social media presences. this is ideal for getting exposure because i have a global reach of over 25,000 fans who avvidly support creative and positive ventures.

      Website Take Over!

      The same is perk 1 however you will be featured on my company website in the main page Hero Slider as well as a featured post

      Digital Music Catalog Distribution

      For a select few contributors they will be given an exclusive limited edition Digital Package of my over 50 fully mastered recorded songs, a never before given opportunity to have time marked songs from my music journey that may not have made it on a commercial album release.

      Physical Music Catalog Distribution with Autograph, Autographed Memorabilia from the Nyte Lyfe Music Store and a personal thank you letter from me.

      The title Pretty Mushc Explains what you get here, a full fan appreciation package.

      Digital Serenade!

      Have an exclusive public online performance dedicated to you, with lyrics catered to our already established connection or the new connection to be built.

      Be My Creative Coach For a Day

      An all day skype session where we collaborate on a music project that I dedicate to you, a written sound recording that will be produced in our studios and sent to you as well as broadcasted on our network.

AND MANY MORE!!!

  • IF OUR GOAL IS NOT REACHED

    If we do not reach our goal, all funds and proceeds from this campaign will be prorated and allocated accordingly to the two products specified in our financial summary and we will produce as many of each that the budget allows, and take it from there. Though numbers are nice and ideally we would like to hit the ground running as hard and as fast as we can, if we do not accomplish our funding goal starting small we can still make an impact.

The Ultimate Goal & Mission

Your contribution helps mobilize and energize our music company in a way we have not been able to ever before. We are poised to introduce a new outlook on socio-economic activism by way of music and artistic cultivation. By using the influential power of music and art to captivatingly educate, stimulate economic growth, radiate positive energy & re-direct cultural media hyper-trending combined with charitable philantropy, we are pioneering a new age of humanitarianism.

  • We need a positive change in our media more than ever these days, evident in how the urban music culture has detoriated to a state of sexual objectivity and crive glorification. The youth have been dis-jointed from the morals and maxims of peaceful co-existence and the music industry has its fingers on the pule of the younger generation. By supporting efforts like mine, because there are many you are making a stand towards the corrupt and perverse world views that are perpetuated on a large scale through music media. All people have a cause, but not all can be the voice of it, You have tools, We have tools, Our voice is one of them, if you need someone to speak on your behalf, join our cause by contributing. One Love.

  • Here is One of Our Signature Music Videos just to give you another feel of our media.

    Nyah Lyan - I Know She Love Music from Nyah Lyan on Vimeo.

MONEY IS NEVER THE ONLY WAY!

We understand the economy is rough and many of you may be feeling compelled to help but may not be able to give money at this time. One of the biggest ways to contribute to the cause is to spread the word and build awareness to the movement. Tell a friend, tell a family member, tweet about us, share us on facebook. Any assistance is golden.

  • Thank you so much for your time and consideration and we really appreciate the help! one love!

/p>
story_txt:
Nyah Lyan Foundation - Energy In Love LLC Company Launch Crowd Sourcing Campaign.
HEY!!! My name is Oriel Cornwall A.K.A. Nyah Lyan. I am an independent Singer/Songwriter, and i recently registered and founded my own singer/songwriter & Music Publishing Company: Nyah Lyan Foundation - Energy In Love LLC. We harness the influential power of music and use it as a form of socio-economic change. Music & art media humanitariansim.
- We are hoping to raise resources to fund the purchase of industry standard physical copies of our latest released album. we will purchase 100-200 depending on funding high quality eco wallets or digi-packs from the company discmakers.
- We also intend to use resources to produce professional press kits to be used in the process of shopping our music to major publishing and recording companies. press kits will be purchased and developed locally however information on press kits purpose, usage, design and production pricing can be found by simply searching online for music press kits. it is a competitive industry and the pricing varies from company to company.
 
 
Learn More About Us At:
:NyahLyan.com
Here Is A Sample Of My Music.

NYAH LYAN - ST. CROIX MUSIC VIDEO from Nyah Lyan on Vimeo.


Funding Specifics & Gifts and Rewards
Here are the detailed facts about our campaign

We have disclosed below the specific pricing and links to the products that we will be purchasing. In an additional effort to maintain transparency we want to clarify that resources are going directly to the production of physical album copies and press kits. Discmakers is a large a popular CD duplication and replication company and has high quality products and services. So we decided to use them for our project. Here are the details:
DiscMakers Quote For Eco Wallets and Digipacks.

With shipping and color printing combined the total is above $600 for a shipment *before music content is added



The Gifts & Rewards You Will Get For Contributing and Joining Forces With Us!
Social Media Site Take Over!
I will dedicate an entire day to promoting you, your event, your movement, or anything you are interested in on one of my various social media presences. this is ideal for getting exposure because i have a global reach of over 25,000 fans who avvidly support creative and positive ventures.
Website Take Over!
The same is perk 1 however you will be featured on my company website in the main page Hero Slider as well as a featured post
Digital Music Catalog Distribution
For a select few contributors they will be given an exclusive limited edition Digital Package of my over 50 fully mastered recorded songs, a never before given opportunity to have time marked songs from my music journey that may not have made it on a commercial album release.
Physical Music Catalog Distribution with Autograph, Autographed Memorabilia from the Nyte Lyfe Music Store and a personal thank you letter from me.
The title Pretty Mushc Explains what you get here, a full fan appreciation package.

Digital Serenade!
Have an exclusive public online performance dedicated to you, with lyrics catered to our already established connection or the new connection to be built.
Be My Creative Coach For a Day
An all day skype session where we collaborate on a music project that I dedicate to you, a written sound recording that will be produced in our studios and sent to you as well as broadcasted on our network.


AND MANY MORE!!!


IF OUR GOAL IS NOT REACHED
If we do not reach our goal, all funds and proceeds from this campaign will be prorated and allocated accordingly to the two products specified in our financial summary and we will produce as many of each that the budget allows, and take it from there. Though numbers are nice and ideally we would like to hit the ground running as hard and as fast as we can, if we do not accomplish our funding goal starting small we can still make an impact.




The Ultimate Goal & Mission
Your contribution helps mobilize and energize our music company in a way we have not been able to ever before. We are poised to introduce a new outlook on socio-economic activism by way of music and artistic cultivation. By using the influential power of music and art to captivatingly educate, stimulate economic growth, radiate positive energy & re-direct cultural media hyper-trending combined with charitable philantropy, we are pioneering a new age of humanitarianism.

We need a positive change in our media more than ever these days, evident in how the urban music culture has detoriated to a state of sexual objectivity and crive glorification. The youth have been dis-jointed from the morals and maxims of peaceful co-existence and the music industry has its fingers on the pule of the younger generation. By supporting efforts like mine, because there are many you are making a stand towards the corrupt and perverse world views that are perpetuated on a large scale through music media. All people have a cause, but not all can be the voice of it, You have tools, We have tools, Our voice is one of them, if you need someone to speak on your behalf, join our cause by contributing. One Love.

MONEY IS NEVER THE ONLY WAY!

One of the biggest ways to contribute to the cause is to spread the word and build awareness to the movement. Tell a friend, tell a family member, tweet about us, share us on facebook. Thank you so much for your time and consideration and we really appreciate the help! one love!
