story:
After a decade, I'm recording my fifth solo album! I can't wait to share it with you. 

 

Hello, friends! We're in the final week of crowdfuning!

With the incredible support of my wonderful friends and fans, we're nearly 60% funded! We completed our first session of Barn Recording at the Seed Savers Exchange barn; now, we're waiting to be sure we're funded before heading back to to finish up with the band. Your contributions will make it possible for us to complete the album and get it playing in your ears, where it's really meant to be.


Before reading any further, please take a moment to watch my new video. 

 

Thank you! Continue on...

 

 

Yup, a whole decade.  

The last ten years have been full. I've been raising a child, working as a spiritual director and retreat leader, founding and leading a spiritual direction training program, and making music with Richard, my husband and partner in music. It's been deeply fulfilling work and so much goodness has sprung from it. But as the years marched on, I began feeling homesick for my solo music -- writing, recording and performing -- and longed to know and share that part of myself again.   I took 2012 as a year of sabbatical to reflect and replenish, and reacquaint myself with my music.

 

That was also the year we planted our first garden. My sense of adventure took over. When we ran out of space in the backyard, I began peeling back sod all around our house to plant more and more produce. (Why, yes, those were big purple cabbages right outside our front door.) 

The practice of working with the earth, planting seeds, and growing wholesome, organic food for my family took root within me in surprising ways. Hands in the dirt and face in the sun, I hummed little songs and let the dream of a new solo album start to take shape. 

 

 

Fast forward to now, Summer 2013, where the lush green of growing things meets brand new music ready to blossom forth.  
 

 

 

 

A new Trish record:   
Wild Acre.  


 

 
 
Solo, but not alone. 

These are not the songs I thought I would write. They're stronger. 
These are not the stories I thought I would be telling. They're richer.  
This is not the album I set out to make. It's better.  

Everything about WILD ACRE is finer than I'd even hoped. Why? Because I'm not doing it alone.   Yes, it's a solo album, but I'm working with some incredibly talented folks, and together we're creating a project that's more than the sum of our parts. It's deepened, ripened, and gotten juicier in all the best ways. 

My previous recording ventures were written, arranged, recorded and packaged on my own with the help of my husband in our home studio. Richard and I have enjoyed this way of delivering new, shrink-wrapped beauty to our beloved listeners. It's been pretty "Mom and Pop" style. In all, Richard and I have made more than a dozen CDs together (no doubt we'll make more!), and I love what we've created.

  But WILD ACRE was asking for something different…   

 

I've made independent music my career for nearly twenty years.
Why try something new now?

  In the decade since my last solo record, I've changed. Technology has changed. The music industry has changed… a lot. I wanted to live into that change. To challenge myself as an artist and songwriter and press the edges of anything I'd done before.

  When it came time to think about who would produce and play on the record, I consulted indie rock 'n' roll artist and long-time friend Jonathan Rundman to help me navigate some options. Jonathan encouraged me to dream bigger about what this album could be, and connected me with Jake Armerding, producer, singer-songwriter, and player-extraordinaire-of-all-things-stringed. Jake soon signed on as my producer and principal arranger for the record, and we've also co-written several of the songs together. His gifts have helped steer the Wild Acre project into new and fun places, and we've jumped in with a sense of adventure.  

 

A return to real-life roots. 
As the project has unfolded, a clear theme has been emerging. The music of Wild Acre hearkens back to the songs of my own musical beginnings: acoustic, Americana, roots-infused, real-life story songs comprised of themes both lovely and raw, weaving threads of love, loss, sweetness, ache and redemption. Some of my early influences have even come back around with some unexpected and welcome inspiration. 

 


 

Born in a Barn 
In thinking about where to record this album, we wanted a setting that would bring out the rich character of the music and contribute to the soul of the project. A vacuum sealed studio isolation room felt a little too sterile for our purposes, but a barn… now that might just work! 

 

Wild Acre meets Seed Savers Exchange
 Seed Savers Exchange has graciously made the barn on their 890-acre Heritage Farm, near Decorah, Iowa available for our recording sessions. I'm beyond thrilled!

 

 

When I think back to humming my way through last year's garden planting -- using seeds our neighbor had saved and shared -- I am in open-mouthed awe at this Wild Acre-Seed Savers Exchange partnership.

Seed to seed, garden to garden, community by community, this music is coming to life.


 

 

How to Plant an Album 
You could say Wild Acre is similar to the work of a community garden, or CSA (Community Supported Agriculture). (Or, as Jake calls it, Community Supprted Arts.) Making an album of this caliber requires a tremendous investment of time, energy, money, and people coming together at just the right moment. Without the backing of a label, I am unable to fund this alone. In addition to all the behind-the-scenes musical "farm hands",  I want to invite you -- my community of listeners, supporters, and fans -- to join us and fund this project.

Together, we have 40 days! Let's bring this Wild Acre to life!
 

 

Where the Money Goes
  Every dollar you contribute goes directly toward the creation of this album and getting it into the world. Plus, because I have fiscal sponsorship through Fractured Atlas, a significant portion of what you give is tax-deductible. Score one for both of us!  

Our fundraising goal is $20,000. This will cover the basic cost of recording the album.

Your pledges allow me to do these things:      

  • pay my producer, Jake Armerding 

  • carry out our barn studio recording sessions 

  • hire top-notch musicians 

  • mix and master the album at a pro studio    

  • manufacture and duplicate the CDs    

  • make great album art with a photographer and graphic designer    

  • pay royalties and mechanical licensing 

  • cover the fundraising fees  

  • cover travel expenses for myself, the producer and the musicians

 

Dreaming Bigger. 
Wild Acre is by far the most universally accessible of all my albums, making this the perfect opportunity to extend the latitude of my music. My greatest hope is that the songs will reach new listeners, open the door to fresh venues, and place me in front of wider audiences. I'd be delighted if this record also led to collaborative ventures with other musicians whose work I love and admire. Dreams for a Barn Concert Tour are sprouting, and we'd love to bring this music to a barn near you!  

  Our budget does not, however, cover album promotion, distribution or concert tours, all of which are essential to getting the music out into the world. If we exceed our goal, the extra capital will go toward the requisite components for successful promotion, distribution and tours.  

Making this album - and sharing it as widely as possible - is deeply important to me. If we don't reach the funding goal, we will still make this album, but we'll need to make some hard, careful choices about where to compromise.


 
Anybody Want a Peanut? 
When I say "I can't do this without you", I really mean it.  
What we're able to do on the record is directly tied to the funding we receive. Thank you for the opportunity to continue making great music that means so much to me.

And remember… a portion of your contributions are tax deductible with my fiscal sponsorship through Fractured Atlas.
 
 

Many hands...
Obviously, raising funds to meet our Wild Acre budget is one vital and tangible way you can help. But there are other ways, too. As you pass the word on to your network of friends and family, you're reaching people and places I could never reach alone.

  • Spread the word!

  • "Favorite" this IndieGoGo page to stay in the loop.

  • Like my TrishBC music Facebook page and share with your friends.

  • Like, Link, Post and Share on all your social networks.

  • Pull up the video on your phone or tablet and show someone in the room.

  • Email your friends.

  • Forward this page to your favorite blogs, websites, magazines, and public radio and television stations -- particularly those interested in music, arts, and sustainable community.

  • Whistle "Wild Acre" around the house/office until people pay you to stop. (Hmmm... might raise enough to get yourself a free barn concert.)
     

If you'd like to be on my street team to get the word out, I've got a list of many more ideas. Email me and we'll gladly put you to work!
 
 


Thank you, Friends!
Your support means so much.
 I can't wait to unveil what we're all creating together! Wahoo! 

 


Q and A:
 
Is it possible to make a contribution without selecting a perk?  
Yes. Click on the $2 Tip Jar perk. At checkout, fill in the amount you'd like to contribute. But, don't for a second think you're getting out of here perk-less: I'll be pleased and proud to blow you a kiss from the barn.
 
What is Fractured Atlas?
Fractured Atlas is a 501.c3 non-profit organization under which member artists may obtain fiscal sponsorship. My husband, Richard, and I have obtained fiscal sponsorship through Fractured Atlas for our music business, The River's Voice, LLC. All contributions to this project will be processed by Fractured Atlas, then distributed to me as needed to cover the expenses of making the album. Not only do our contributors get a kick-back at tax time but, the standard of accountability we're held to means you get the assurance that your contributions are working as promised.
 
Hey, can I chip in for my own shipping costs?
You betcha! The cost of shipping is included in your perk contribution, but you're more than welcome to add a few dollars to contribution amount. Add your desired amount as you check out. Truly, every dollar counts! (Please note: Orders shipped outside the U.S. require an additional charge. Please see your individual perk for that more information.)
 
Can I give beyond the level of my desired perk?
Yep. Add whatever amount you wish as you check out. Every dollar helps us meet our goal!
 
I contributed earlier, but I'd like to give again. How do I do this?
Well, golly, thanks for double-dipping! Simply go through the process again. Each contribution you make will appear on your credit card statement as a separate transaction.

story:
Hello!

I'm Peter Slocombe and welcome to my Indiegogo fundraising page. 

Most people know me as a professional saxophone player based in Los Angeles. However, I also have a strong love for songwriting and have been working for the last three years to create a body of original work that I'm proud of and excited to share. 

Taking elements from my Jazz background and blending them with country and folk music, I've found my unique voice. Creating lyric driven music inspired by events in my life, I've searched for universal themes that relate to the human experience. 


Here's the scoop!

It's taken me a long time to build up the courage to expose my songwriting. I decided that my 30th birthday (8/21/14) would be a great time to take a leap of faith and do it.  

Your contribution will provide me with the means to record my music in a professional studio with a group of amazing musicians. Having a great sounding EP will give me the opportunity to build my fan base, receive positive reviews, attract commercial interest, and pitch my act to performance venues.  

The Breakdown!

I have carefully calculated the cost of producing a polished recording on a budget. I'm fortunate to have a great network of producers, engineers, and musicians eager to help. Here are the specifics of what your contribution will support:
  • Studio Fees $1900
  • Musicians $750
  • Disk Pressing $600
  • Album Artwork $200
  • Mailing $500
  • Taxes and Credit Card Charges $395

What's on the Menu?

Yes, there are perks that come with a donation to my campaign. Sticking to my British roots, I've laid them out like a pub menu. I'm sure you'll find something to quell your appetite, just look to the right. :) Cheers!  

Stretch Goals

Due to the fantastic news that my campaign has successfully reached it's goal early, I have implemented "Stretch Goals" to utilize excess funding.

  • $5300- Additional musician costs for rehearsal time and soloists
  • $6300- Two extra songs added to the EP
  • $8450-  I'll scrap the EP idea and make a full length recording

The Impact

Given the competitive nature of the music industry and the resources now readily available to emerging artists, it's important to have a top quality product to distinguish myself from the competition. With your help I will have the means to showcase my songs in their most organic form, utilizing a studio that gives me the ability to perform live with great musicians and capture the emotion and sensibility within each individual track. In a market that's saturated with great sounding productions, I aim to let the strength of my compositions, and the individual talents of my musicians shine through, maintaining the integrity of performance based music sometimes lost from a bygone era. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges to pursuing any dream and I have overcome many hurdles to bring me to where I am today. When I started out as a professional saxophone player, I placed unrealistic expectations upon myself to try and "make it." My rigorous practice routine and self induced stress took their toll and I ended up taking a number of breaks from performing to heal some severe repetitive strain issues.

The damage from my younger years has stayed with me and stunted my chances of reaching my goal as a  world class Jazz saxophonist. Although I might have lost that dream, many unforeseen paths have opened up from my experience. I now play a number of instruments other than saxophone, and enjoy a variety of styles of music outside of Jazz. I started working on songwriting and singing and have enjoyed working with a music form that allows me to learn from and share my experiences. 

I am sure that I will face many more complications in the future, but as they say in England "chin up, boy."

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that I rely on the love and generosity of many when launching this project. If you feel like helping more, check below for ideas. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word through your family and friends.
  • If you can't donate funds, you can still help by donating your time to refer others to my Indiegogo campaign and my websites (below).  
  • https://www.facebook.com/Peterslocombemusic
  • http://www.reverbnation.com/peterslocombe
  • www.Peterslocombe.com
Much love and thanks!
Peter Slocombe
story_txt:
Hello!
I'm Peter Slocombe and welcome to my Indiegogo fundraising page. 
Most people know me as a professional saxophone player based in Los Angeles. However, I also have a strong love for songwriting and have been working for the last three years to create a body of original work that I'm proud of and excited to share. 
Taking elements from my Jazz background and blending them with country and folk music, I've found my unique voice. Creating lyric driven music inspired by events in my life, I've searched for universal themes that relate to the human experience. 




Here's the scoop!

It's taken me a long time to build up the courage to expose my songwriting. I decided that my 30th birthday (8/21/14) would be a great time to take a leap of faith and do it.  
Your contribution will provide me with the means to record my music in a professional studio with a group of amazing musicians. Having a great sounding EP will give me the opportunity to build my fan base, receive positive reviews, attract commercial interest, and pitch my act to performance venues.  




The Breakdown!
I have carefully calculated the cost of producing a polished recording on a budget. I'm fortunate to have a great network of producers, engineers, and musicians eager to help. Here are the specifics of what your contribution will support:

Studio Fees $1900
Musicians $750
Disk Pressing $600
Album Artwork $200
Mailing $500
Taxes and Credit Card Charges $395




What's on the Menu?

Yes, there are perks that come with a donation to my campaign. Sticking to my British roots, I've laid them out like a pub menu. I'm sure you'll find something to quell your appetite, just look to the right. :) Cheers!  





Stretch Goals


Due
to the fantastic news that my campaign has successfully reached it's goal
early, I have implemented "Stretch Goals" to utilize excess funding.


$5300- Additional musician costs for rehearsal time and soloists
$6300- Two extra songs added to the EP
$8450-  I'll scrap the EP idea and make a full length recording

The Impact

Given the competitive nature of the music industry and the resources now readily available to emerging artists, it's important to have a top quality product to distinguish myself from the competition. With your help I will have the means to showcase my songs in their most organic form, utilizing a studio that gives me the ability to perform live with great musicians and capture the emotion and sensibility within each individual track. In a market that's saturated with great sounding productions, I aim to let the strength of my compositions, and the individual talents of my musicians shine through, maintaining the integrity of performance based music sometimes lost from a bygone era. 



Risks &
Challenges














There are always risks and challenges to pursuing any dream and I have
overcome many hurdles to bring me to where I am today. When I started out as a
professional saxophone player, I placed unrealistic expectations upon myself to
try and "make it." My rigorous practice routine and self induced
stress took their toll and I ended up taking a number of breaks from performing
to heal some severe repetitive strain issues. 
The damage from my younger years has stayed with me and stunted my
chances of reaching my goal as a  world class Jazz saxophonist. Although I
might have lost that dream, many unforeseen paths have opened up from my
experience. I now play a number of instruments other than saxophone, and enjoy
a variety of styles of music outside of Jazz. I started working on songwriting
and singing and have enjoyed working with a music form that allows me to learn
from and share my experiences. 
I am sure that I will face many more complications in the future, but as
they say in England "chin up, boy."



Other Ways You Can
Help
I understand that I rely on the love and generosity of many when launching this project. If you feel like helping more, check below for ideas. 




Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word through your family and friends.
If you can't donate funds, you can still help by donating your time to refer others to my Indiegogo campaign and my websites (below).  

https://www.facebook.com/Peterslocombemusic


http://www.reverbnation.com/peterslocombe

www.Peterslocombe.com

Much love and thanks!
Peter Slocombe

story:
We believe that all climbers with ambition—not just sponsored or elite athletes—should have opportunities to explore and push limits. The Live Your Dream program funds adventurers of all abilities and helps everyday climbers take their skills to a new level.

In just the last three years this program has helped 132 climbers become more competent while living out their dreams. But fewer than 20% of applicants receive funding. We're hoping you can inspire a new generation of climbers to dream big, go big, and then serve as mentor-ambassadors in our community.

Thanks to a matching grant from The North Face, we have the potential to increase grant funding from $28,000 in 2014 to $45,000 in 2015. Back this project today to help us reach our goal of $15,000 by December 3, 2014. This will unlock enough funding so that roughly 75 climbers will have the opportunity to grow and live out their dreams in 2015. Maybe one of them will even be you!

About LYD

We all love those bluebird days at the crag, catching some sun and climbing splitter pitches, but those aren’t the days you remember. It’s those times you had to bivy at 14,000 feet, happy to be alive the next day. It’s those times when you can’t get out of bed because of the 20 hours of hiking and climbing you did the day before. It’s the epic stories you love to tell around the campfire but never actually want to relive. This was one of those memories, one we will never forget.
—Tony Chang, Past Live Your Dream Grantee

The purpose of the Live Your Dream grant is to support and promote unforgettable experiences for all climbers—specifically, experiences that provide the skills and confidence to realize one’s climbing ambitions. Rather than rewarding cutting edge or exploratory objectives, the Live Your Dream Grant seeks to fund projects that have a significant, positive impact on grantees' individual progressions as climbers. We want to help you to dream big, to grow as a climber, and to inspire others. This grant funds individuals of all ages and experience levels and represents a range of climbing disciplines and backgrounds, including but not limited to: bouldering, sport & trad climbing, ice climbing, mountaineering, ski mountaineering, peak running, and mountain exploration.

About the prizes

The North Face has generously donated several different items to help us reach our goal. We will be giving away The North Face gear in three separate raffles! Below are some descriptions of the items that we will be raffling off:

10 Surgent Hoodies

Versatile for warm ups, cool downs, and everything in between, this performance-driven pullover is made from durable, soft stretch fleece to withstand your workouts. The kangaroo pocket features an interior compartment that securely holds your MP3 player while keeping it accessible.

6 Cinder 40L Climbing Packs

A versatile 40-liter climbing pack that is fully dialed for a day at the crag. This top-loading pack is constructed to stand up on its own and has a roll top, so you can access and organize gear quickly. Removable hipbelt and frame sheet.

4 Thermoball Hoodie Jackets

The ThermoBall™ jacket offers ultralight, highly compressible synthetic insulation to keep you warm in a variety of winter conditions. The new insulation technology features round ThermoBall™ clusters that trap and retain heat to achieve phenomenal warmth in cold, wet weather. Wear or pack this ultralight jacket for reliable thermal insulation while winter camping in the backcountry.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to make a donation, please consider sharing this campaign on Facebook or Twitter. Let your friends know about the work we are doing and encourage them to make a contribution. Every bit helps—no matter the size.

We appreciate your support and enthusiasm!

story:
Short Summary

Hello Indiegogo Friends : )

I'm Elise Bellew, most well known as the singer/songwriter for the indie dream pop band The Mary Dream. With The Mary Dream, we were completely independent and worked very hard to develop our own unique sound and style of "vibey alternative pop/rock". With The Mary Dream I had many TV placements on shows such as The Real World, All My Children, Heartland and more : ) Also, our very first full-length CD "Beautiful World" (2006) was just added to Pandora Radio this October!

I am now embarking on a new musical journey as a solo artist and this is where I need your help!!!

Because of the incredible generosity of some very talented people, I was able to record my first solo EP "Bellew Christmas" last December. I still can't believe all the miracles that happened to make that recording possible! But now it's time to record again and I need your help to raise enough money to record a brand new EP next Spring in Nashville!

The new EP will contain 5 brand new Original Songs written by me, and will be produced by myself and Nashville engineer/producer Michael Head.

With my Christmas EP, I worked meticulously to co-produce and oversee every detail of the recording process to make sure I took The Mary Dream sound to the next musical level... I will be doing the same thing on my new EP and already have some fresh new musical influences to bring to the recording studio...

Music is the love of my life. Helping me achieve this dream to record again would be miraculous and I'm excited to invite you to become a part of my next musical journey : ) ~Elise


Breakdown of Recording Costs

My goal with this Indiegogo Campaign is to raise a total of $10,000 to record, mix and master 5 new songs. Here is the breakdown of Recording Costs:

2 Full Weeks of Recording Time: Recording will take place with Michael Head at a well-established recording studio located on Nashville's historic Music Row. Sessions will be Monday through Friday, 9-5 for 2 weeks. Recording Schedule: Day 1-2: Arranging & Pre-Production; Day 3: Drums; Day 4: Guitars; Day 5: Keys; Day 6: Bass; Days 7-14: Main Vocals & Background Vocals.

2-4 Weeks Mixing & Mastering: An additional 2-4 weeks of Michael Head's time will be needed to Mix and Master the recording once all the tracks have been completed.

Total for Recording Time, Mixing & Mastering = $5500
The total amount Michael's studio usually charges for the above is $7500. Michael has generously offered to reduce this amount to $5500 to make my goal more achievable.

Session Musician Budget Total = $2400

The Nashville Session Musicians that I use are so talented and experienced that they are able to record ALL 5 SONGS IN ONE DAY EACH. Session Musicians in Nashville usually work for Union Rates, but for my project, they are all willing to work for indie rates. The indie rate for 1 day for each session musician is $600 per day:

1 Full Day Drum Recording = $600
1 Full Day Keyboard Recording = $600
1 Full Day Guitar Recording (both acoustic & electric) = $600
1 Full Day Bass Recording = $600

Roundtrip Travel Expenses to Nashville (Rental Car + Gas) = $700
This Total includes Economy Rental Car & Gas for 18 days (2 days driving time each way to Nashville plus 14 days driving to and from Recording Studio). (I don't fly to Nashville to save money since I have to rent a car anyway. I also don't fly because I have to keep my recording dates flexible to fit into Michael's recording schedule in between his higher paying clients.)

Lodging Expenses for 2 Weeks (Includes 2 Driving Nights) = $886 
Extended Stay America = 14 Nights in Nashville = $756
1 Night hotel each way in between driving days (2 Nights Total) = $130

Miscellaneous Expenses & Variable Costs = $514

TOTAL COST OF PROJECT = $10,000


*If More Than Goal Is Reached: If more than the Campaign Goal is reached, extra funds will go to the following additional costs: Photoshoot & Makeup Artist for Cover of New EP ($300-$500); Printing of New EP ($300 for 100 EP's), Digital Distribution to iTunes, etc ($50); Video Shoots & Makeup Artists for Videos for each of the 5 songs ($300-$500 per video).  

*If Goal Is Not Reached: Currently, recording of the new EP will take place in the Spring of 2015 (March, April or May). If the Campaign Goal is not reached, all funds raised will be placed into a special savings account until the remaining amount can be raised, in which case a new recording date will be announced once total funds are raised for the project.

Select The "Perk" of Your Choice : )

My dear friends and patrons, I have a number of "Perks" for you to choose from (Listed here on the Right). Select your favorite Perk or you can just make a donation, whichever you prefer : ) Thank you for supporting indie music!!! ~Elise

THANK YOU DEAR FRIENDS & PATRONS

The miracles that have occurred in the last year are still hard for me to believe. Thank you so much to my dear friends and patrons for your generous support. I am so excited to invite you to become a part of my next musical journey... Please visit my Blog regularly to keep up with all the latest developments at: http://elisebellew.com

Help Spread The Word!

Share this Indiegogo Campaign with friends who might enjoy becoming a supporter of indie music (share buttons are located under the Video on the top of this page). All music is also available on iTunes & Amazon via digital download. Every little bit helps! Thanks so much!!! ~Elise

story:
Emissary Echo is a newly formed band breaking new sonic grounds in the Midwest rock scene. Their sound is a unique blend of modern-aggressive hard rock music possessing a classic familiarity.

Emissary Echo's self-engineered debut album "Erasing The Negatives" (Independently released Jan. 10th, physical/digital download) was produced by Sammus Theory/Buried as Thieves vocalist Sam Hughes. 

“The new album features searing guitar tones and huge drums.” – Nick Quijano (Guitarist Powerman 5000)

Although new to the scene, Emissary Echo’s hi-energy live performance and growing dedicated fan base has landed them support slots with national touring acts: Powerman 5000, Eye Empire, Nonpoint, Trapt, Starset, 3Pill Morning, Bobaflex and The Sammus Theory.

Emissary Echo is: Cory Zimmer (drums), Preston McKay (rhythm guitar), Justin Kraft (lead guitar), Tim Scott (bass), Cody Milbradt (vocals)

Emissary Echo starts off the New Year with a bang! Catch this Midwest heavy-melodic rock band on tour Jan 29th – Feb 8th with industrial electro-rockers Powerman 5000 (Featuring Rob Zombie’s younger brother Spider One on vocals). If you miss your chance to see Emissary Echo on the PM5k tour you will have a second chance to see the band March 5th – 8th (More dates TBD) with national act Nonpoint. Check out the list of tour dates below and support this fast rising new band!

Powerman 5000 – With special guests: Knee High Fox and Emissary Echo*(*=Dates w/ Emissary Echo)

Jan 28th – San Francisco CA – DNA Lounge

Jan 29th – San Jose CA – The Ritz*

Jan 30th – Portland OR – Hawthorne Theatre*

Jan 31st – Seattle WA – El Corazon*

Feb 2nd – Spokane WA – Big Dipper*

Feb 4th – Boise ID – The Shredder*

Feb 5th – Idaho Falls – The Falls Venue*

Feb 6th – Salt Lake City UT– The Royal*

Feb 8th – Las Vegas NV – LVCS*

Nonpoint – With special guest: Emissary Echo

March 5th – Minot ND

March 5th – Bismarck ND

March 8th – Idaho Falls ID

More Shows TBA

As we get ready for our upcoming tours we are hard at work on our 2nd album. We are very excited about this next album. But as you know it takes lots of hard work, time, and money to get your music to be heard. Thats why we are reaching out to you our fans for the help. Our whole budget for the next album plus more has been put into making the following tours work. 

Thanks for all your help!

Emissary Echo
